The loneliness is likely part of the depression  ANYTIME a person is contemplating suicide it has to be taken seriously  It can be scary to open up to others and tell them how you are feeling   You said you are afraid of telling your parents  your parents will be greatly relieved that you told them how you are feeling so they can get you help  If  for some reason they brush off your being depressed  please talk to your school counselor the day you go back to school   The school counselor is trained to recognize the signs and symptoms of depression and the counselor can explain to your parents that the way you are feeling needs attention   Depression can leave one feeling very hopeless  Please know there is hope and you can feel better  You are not alone   This is a conversation that needs to take place with your parents now   Oh  and the phone    phones can be replaced   You and your wellbeing are far more important than a phone

I'm guilty of  2 and 3  But that's only because I've been through it   the heartache after a failed relationship is many times more shitty than what you're feeling now   Knowing you had it and lost it for whatever reason   You're just going to blame yourself even more because that's what depression does  whether it's your fault or not   You need to understand how depression affects you and others around you before you pursue a relationship   Learn more about yourself   Read more about the disease   Learn how it manipulates your thoughts and emotions   Only then could you have some control over it   If you learn about the disease you can teach it to your future SO   And they can help you manage and control it   Otherwise if you can't help yourself  it's not realistic to expect them to make you feel better any and every time you're down   I say all this with the hope and optimism that depression can be managed and controlled 
Exact same place right now  20 and all
  The women I'm confident around I'm not attracted to  and the women I'm attracted to are too good for me   I have this problem as well   
When I was young  my mother was very abuse physically and mentally  I was bullied at school because my hair started falling out when I was in 1st grade  My best friend was a guy that would throw me under the bus every chance he got to seem cool to other people  I was a fat little fucker and I had problems trusting people  especially women  My depression worsened day after day  One day I decided that I had enough  I was tired of dealing with people  I was tired of trying to seem like a cool and good person  I was tired to trying to please everyone else  I said fuck it and fuck anyone that doesn't like me because I am going to live my life the way that I want  I am going to be the best person that I can be and I am going to get rid of anything or anyone in my life that gets in my way of being happy  My mom and dad got divorced when I was 10 and my dad got emergency custody of my siblings and I in 7th grade  I started drinking water instead of my regular 4 or 5 pops a day  I started watching how many calories I took in and started working out  I studied harder in school and started getting better grades  When I was living with my mother  I loved to figure out how things worked  I would sometimes break things just so that I could show my mom and she would let me take it apart  I know I shouldn't have broke things as a child   I started to try to build things and I messed a lot of stuff up  but I learned from my mistakes  I kept going  I got to really know my dad after my parents got divorced  I never got to see him much before as he was always working to provide for us  We lived in a little apartment for a long time until my dad built a house  I didn't have a lot at first  but I had my dad  I remember wearing my dads shirts that were way too big for me to school in 7th and 8th grade  I learned how to live cheaply  Buying nice clothes at yard sales for a couple dollars  My father and I would stay up until 12 or even 1 building end caps out of fiberglass for a trailer company that he worked for  We worked our asses off and we started to build something for ourselves  My dad like to fix wrecked vehicles and he traded many things for tools and equipment  Today we have our own body shop and we have cars lined up waiting to be fixed and sold right now  The only thing that I know to tell you is that you must find at least one thing in your life that you love and let it motivate you  Set goals for yourself  Find out what you want to do with your life  You have to stop living for others and start living for yourself  You must strive and work hard to reach your goals and you can't let anything get in your way  It's a hard road and it is never easy  There are going to be many obstacles and trials that come your way and you are going to feel like giving up  I can't begin to tell you how many times I wanted to just lay in bed all day and just be lazy  but I let the things that I love be my motivation  No one can do it for you  I know that things are going to happen and you are going to want to blame others or blame something for the failure or the sadness  but you must learn from the bad and use it to help you reach the good  It is not an easy battle especially when facing depression  I can only hope and pray for the best for you  I hope that one day you can find your happiness in life and I know that if you get motivated that you will  You are facing a battle that many people face  but you can do it and don't let anyone tell you any different

i was talking to my counselor  and she told me to try changing things a little at a time  for example  if you normally wash your hands for 5 minutes  stop after 3  then as you become acclimatized to 3  slowly whittle your time down in that same manner until it's at a "socially acceptable"  awkward phrase  more like  a normal  healthy level     it shows you that ocd is not unchangeable and that you do have a say in how things go   your rituals do not have to be rigid and control you  this is how i dealt with my ocd in terms of handwashing for the most part

Because being in love isn't a long term cure  the depression will come back   It always does   And if you're not educated on how it affects you and others around you  the relationship will not work   The least you can do is read more about it   Get counselling   And just really work on yourself before you seek out a relationship  After the honeymoon period of a relationship wears off and you become comfortable and complacent with each other  you will find you are annoyed with many little trivial things that your SO does   At first you may think they are annoying and that they don't understand you   "Why can't they just make you happy "  you will ask yourself   "Shouldn't they know you by now  "  But really it's the depression fucking with you and you not noticing it  because you are associating the symptoms of depression with whatever you are doing in your life   So you will blame your shitty feelings on everyone around you but yourself   You will alienate yourself from others because they don't understand you and how right you are and how stupid they are   Depression warps and manipulates your thoughts   That's why I suggest really really working on yourself first   I hope with this post you will be motivated to learn more about depression and the causes and triggers and how you can avoid it the best you can   And you seeking a relationship and you actively working on yourself are NOT mutually exclusive  I'm not denying the benefits of a relationship   HOWEVER  if shit does not work out  which most likely won't for first relationships   the depression and emptiness and anger and nothingness is SO MANY TIMES greater than whatever you are feeling now 
I'm sorry that your meds aren't helping  and that you feel that your mother isn't taking you seriously  Are there any local youth mental health groups that you can contact  Not sure which country you are in so can't offer specific advice there  Also do you have a school counsellor or someone that you can talk to  You really need to try to open up more  as hard as that is  people cannot help if they don't know the true extent of what is happening  Also given that you have been given medication  it seems that you are being taking seriously  as your mother has taken you to a doctor and gotten you meds  Perhaps just talk to her again  wrote a letter  send an email  anything that makes it easier for you to tell her how bad you're feeling  It may be that she just doesn't know the extent of things  Also I don't think that anyone will look at you as a druggy and not prescribe medication

I'll tell you my story  maybe someone on here will be able to relate  maybe not   I've never been good at feeling close to people  I had a best friend for many years  over a decade  We met in middle school  and continued our friendship into our mid 20's  But he became addicted to drugs and alcohol and spiraled out of control  I tried to help him  I let him treat me like shit  I stood by him when nobody else did  I was his only friend  The only reason I stuck around as long as I did is because he was the only person in the world who I could be myself around  my true self  When I spent time with him  the world felt shiny and new again  nothing was impossible  and life was an adventure  Two years ago though he fell off the wagon again after having been sober a while  He started being cruel to me  really tried to tear me down as a person despite me being his only real ally and friend  I finally cut ties with him and told him to fuck off  Fast forward to 10 months ago and he hurt some people real bad while fucked up on who knows what  His trial is in a few weeks  He is pleading insanity  but it likely won't work and he will end up in prison for the majority of his life   Despite all of that  a day doesn't go by that I don't miss him terribly because without him I can't be me anymore  at least not around other people  I just spent the night around family and whatnot  and it left me feeling so drained and alone and wanting desperately to just talk to my best friend again  My current lineup of friends don't give a rats ass about me  Most of them only talk to me when they want need something from me  In the last two months I haven't bothered to start conversations with most of them since I'm always the one having to start the conversations  In that time the two people I considered to be the best of my friends have barely spoken to me  One of them has sent me about 5 sentences of messages  and 4 of those sentences were asking for advice on technology  This was someone I talked to daily and gamed with all the time  My other friend has messaged me maybe once in those two months  My existence is increasingly becoming a lonely one 
Hi   I don't think anyone will read this  or really care  since this is mostly just a dumping thread for all of our emotions    I will probably say too much  and people will skip the long post   I am 20  female  I consider myself attractive and witty  I love my personality  I love myself  But do I    2017 has begun  I have now lost two SOs from an opiate addiction  I have lost my best friend from alcoholism  I have lost countless friends to prescription drugs in the past few years    I have lost interest in everything  I danced for 13 years  have always been creative and artistic  An excellent painter  photographer  cinematographer  always had an eye for art and design  I don't care about any of that anymore    I wake up every day at 1pm  exhausted by 6pm  can't sleep until 4am  Wake up multiple times throughout the night  If I don't smoke I'm plagued by nightmares  Just last night I watched my parents die in my dreams  If I do smoke  I'm numb to the world around me  and my grades begin to drop    When I am alone  the isolation cripples me  I'm left to my own anxious thoughts  worrying over things I can't tell if they're serious or not  If I should be worrying or if it's just anxiety  I can't tell    When I'm with people  I feel as if everyone is talking about me  Judging me  Then immediately feel like I'm conceited  thinking anyone pays me any attention at all  Why would anyone care what I'm doing    I lost 20 pounds this year  I don't let myself eat  any excess fat I notice is a shame  and so are the bones when I see them poking through my skin  Especially my pelvic bone through my back  or my rib cage and my bony chest    I don't remember what excitement feels like  Like I said  I am attractive  I meet guys easily  I have an awesome personality  I think  But when they realize how unstable I am  the extent of my anxiety  the never ending self doubt and exhaustion    they're gone  I'm alone    I'm lucky if I shower three times a week  Sometimes I don't get out of bed for whole days  Most times I just get out of bed and move to the couch    I wish I had a therapist  someone to talk to  My friends are tired of listening  my problems are my own and they shouldn't be burdened with them  But I need someone to care    I tried to kill myself on October 20th  My roommate called the cops  they took me to the ER  where the psychiatrist asked me why I was feeling suicidal  and when I began to explain  he told me he didn't understand why I would feel so upset over little things    Because of what I look like physically  no one will ever take me seriously  No one  I'm expected to be happy  I don't remember what happy feels like  The week following my suicide attempt  the person I was seeing told me that I needed help and that he couldn't be the shoulder I needed to cry on    I keep telling myself that my happiness is in my own hands  I can be my own shoulder  I can make the difference in my life    I wonder if it's okay to admit that's not true  I can't do it on my own anymore    I'm so tired  I want to sleep  But I don't want to wake up in this world    I'm sorry for this long post  I left my journal at home    Please let this end  I just want to sleep  I just want to stop crying  I just want to live throughout the day  I don't want to feel like brushing my teeth is an obstacle to face  I don't want to drown anymore  Please  I have no answers    Please let it end

Sorry about that    Love is a really nasty thing sometimes  It's awesome that you want her to be happy  but yeah  of course you're not going to feel good at the same time    Hey  I promise it does get better with time though  I'm pretty introverted too  and I am horrible at speaking with people I don't know that well  I got lucky  and I was able to get a job that allowed me to work with other people my age  Eventually in a year or so I went from being almost completely mute to being able to have conversations with people on a regular basis    I think I sort of get what you mean when you say you don't show interest in people when you talk  I had the almost the same feeling as well  When I talked to people before  I did not give a fuck about them  They saw a movie over the weekend  Okay  They like to play the piano  Okay  They enjoy going on hikes during breaks  Okay  But eventually I started asking questions about it  I had to fucking force myself  but I did  You watched a movie  What movie  Oh you play the piano  What kind of songs do you play   You like to go hiking  What's a good hiking trail around here  Eventually  I realized that people have interestings things to say  But not only that  you get to learn from these people and apply the newly learned knowledge into other conversations as well  Oh you went hiking on this trail  I heard about it that trail blah blah    Sorry that I'm ranting my ass off right now  I just wanted to share that I was shit at talking  but now I'm alright  And once you start talking with people it got a lot better for me    I understand that this shits hard especially when all you can do is think about her  But with time it does get better  And hey  maybe with time it lets you forget  but maybe that will heal you along the way     And maybe with enough time  you can think of the happy memories you had with her without getting sad

 mitragynine  Yes  it can cause withdrawals if used daily for an extended period of time  but so can antidepressants like Effexor and run of the mill drugs like caffeine  And every prescription antidepressant  and while we're at it  caffeine  has a higher risk of toxicity than kratom  Zero deaths have been attributed to kratom in isolation  whereas I see people who fatally OD on Xanax  SSRIs  and alcohol every day at work  often in combination but frequently by themselves    Nothing is without risk  But by and large the benefits of kratom greatly outweigh the risks for many many people  Kratom has been a godsend for me and so many others  It's a tragedy that the DEA has been running a full throttle smear campaign in a desperate power grab  Please check out the American Kratom Association to learn a little more about this amazing plant  
It definitely sounds like you could be experiencing some sort of anxiety  My advice would be to try and see your doctor  perhaps get a referral to a therapist  or even a CBT or DBT program  Hotlines are good too  as are subs like this where you can talk to people who understand  Also look mindfulness for anxiety  it may help you  Lastly  if you ever need someone to talk to  please don't hesitate to inbox me

I lived with my in laws  and they ate dinner together every night at 5 30 as a family  I was used to living alone and eating alone  I hated going to make food when anyone was around  and even hated using the toilet  As soon as it started getting closer to dinner time  I would get more and more anxious  and when 5 30 came  I would feel awful  heart beating out of my chest  feeling sick and have red blotches all over my face and neck  my biggest anxiety sign   The last thing I wanted to do was eat  BUT I forced myself to go out there  I couldn't manage it every day  but I tried as much as I could  Eventually it got a little easier  but I'm not going to lie and tell you I was cured  Perhaps just start small  if you hear someone out in the kitchen  go out and get some water  look in the fridge  say hi  then go back to your room  Keep on doing it until eventually  hopefully  it is easier for you  Just little by little start interacting more  and hopefully you'll get more comfortable  If all else fails  do you think you could stand forcing yourself to eat a meal with them very now and then

If by non stop you mean everyday or multiple times a day you are more than likely addicted  Benzodiazepines are intended for extremely short term or occasional use  Depending on your dosage and other factors they will cause those types of side effects which in the midst of a panic attack those side effects are totally worth it   Talk to your doctor  maybe see a therapist  A slow titrate off of them including additional anxiety medication and or therapy can help a lot

Med compliance for BP is super important in general  but even more so with lamictal   Messing around with its dosage and starting stopping is a way to increase the chances of the serious rash side effect   Lamictal is a wonder drug for a lot of people  but believe me   you don't want any part of that rash   Be careful

Last year I decided that I needed to join some kind of fitness group so that I can force myself to be around others and hopefully make friends  I decided to join Crossfit and it has made such a positive change to my life  I am still socially anxious and don't get out much but CF has given me a reason to get out of the house  I've gotten over my eating disorder  I've gained confidence  I've gained strength  and I have actually made some friends   I tried things like netball and athletics clubs but I stopped going after about a month  The CF community is second to none   the environment is so encouraging  I would highly recommend you trying it   I am so much happier in myself purely because of CF

Yup I hate touching all these things  But I carry around a little bottle of hand sanitizer  so I can touch them if I need to and just disinfect my hands afterwards   Honestly  it's hard for me to internalize that it's irrational to not want to touch these things  or to disinfect my hands after touching them   because these things ARE objectively dirty  they've been handled by so many random people  some of whom are sick  or who use the bathroom without washing their hands   and I've worked in enough service industry jobs to know this stuff rarely or never gets cleaned 
I've been dealing with this type of thing for a few weeks now  my stomach just hasn't felt right lately and of course my anxiety likes to exploit that  I've been trying to take steps in the right direction and keep telling myself that I've been extremely anxious with everything and anything involving my health in the last few months and that this upset stomach is just being caused by anxiety  I don't think I have any reason to suspect anything serious  and again i just try my hardest to tell myself that my health anxiety has probably just made me more aware of what are probably normal bodily functions with the anxiety making more unsettled then normal  But it's tough you know  Things such as stomach cancer are scaring me and has given me my first panic attack in a while  I was honestly doing so well with the panic attacks before today  Ulcers also crossed my mind  Every sensation i fell in my stomach sends me into an anxious state  I've even started confusing hunger pains with reasons to worry  my appetite hasn't been the best lately  But I'll continue to try make myself believe its my anxiety until i have reason for concern  Unfortunately  anxiety is winning by a landslide  
2016 was the worst for me too  but cmon bro    2017 will be great  Everyone can do it  so can we 
I tend not to post on the younger folks' threads  as I am sure my negativity likely won't help them out much  People like to say that things get better  but that's really not how life works  you know  Chances are  the thoughts spiral downwards until you are forced to put up walls to protect yourself from the pain and nagging thoughts  And through this  you become more jaded  more cynical  more empty as your walls begin to suffocate you in the truth of your hollow existence  You tell yourself you put up those walls to protect you from those outside influences  but in all honesty  you are protecting the people around you from you  from your scathing anger  loathing  and negativity   Just food for thought from a mid 30's fellow 
You're very welcome  In my experience you rarely know whether or not you're suffering unnecessarily until you've stopped suffering  Good luck and feel better soon

hello   your anxiety and concerns are definitely worth mentioning to the relevant person at your uni  this could be an academic registrar  welfare supervisor  accommodation manager or whatever the university has  so that they can bare your needs in mind when allocating rooms  They might not necessarily be able to guarantee anything  but they have a duty of care to students and given that it's still so early in the process there should be plenty of flexibility  like universities have to house people they accept in clearing and that doesn't happen until after a level results day   Also get in touch with your student union  again their quality reaaaaalllllyy varies from uni to uni but they will be able to give you really specific advice about what provisions your particular uni has    And finally when you get to uni I promise you'll be absolutely fine   it is super daunting for everyone and everyone feels at least a bit of anxiety at some point  You'll be amazed at how quickly you adapt to everything and the how strong your new friendships will be  Also don't forget that you definitely are not alone whilst you're studying   universities all have incredible networks of counselling services  welfare structures etc etc that will be wayyyyy beyond anything you had at school  I did loads of research about all this before I went away for first time  almost 3 years ago now omg  and I found it really reassuring to know exactly who I could turn to no matter what my problem was    That turned into a bit of a random waffle but I hope it helped   basically uni has the potential to be literally life changing in the most positive of ways if you approach it with the right information and mindset        
Engaging in other OCD rituals  doing heroin  ingesting copious amounts of sedatives  and dropping heavy objects on one's head all have similar effects    It's useful to keep the focus on actions  not relieving feelings or thoughts  Trying to avoid those feelings thoughts is what OCD is all about  If you take drugs so you don't feel distressed  that can lead to practicing OCD even more because you don't see feel a problem    It doesn't sound like you're connecting the shots of alcohol with the OCD attack  Do you see them as helping you get out of it  Not causing it  If somebody said that their door checking ritual doesn't make them anxious in the morning  it helps them calm down  what would you think about that   If somebody got an injury while running in a race and then chugged a few shots of whisky and gotback in the race  Maybe they wouldn't feel the pain from the injury anymore  But they're doing the same thing that caused the injury  Whether they feel it or not is irrelevant  they're making it worse  They'll experience even more pain later   
I hate when I am having thoughts like these  and I have even acted on a few of them  What I did to help reduce the risk of hurting myself is adopt emergency measures  such as ice cream or my favorite tv show

You are going through a tough time  I was there for 5 years  I sometimes look back and think 'what did I do for 5 years ' I barely functioned  lost a lot because of it  How did I get on the road to recovery  This is going to sound annoyingly simple but I just forced myself to 'do it ' I saw my choices as either remain a prisoner to SA and live a miserable life or face my fears and get back out there and make something happen  It really is that simple  It involves feeling uncomfortable  facing situations that brought about fear but the alternative  living in fear and avoiding everything  is much more scary to me   Two things that really helped me were mindfulness meditation and exercise  The meditation helped to calm all the harmful thoughts I had about myself and the exercise burned off adrenalin and cortisol and made me feel calmer    The only thing to do is put on your running shoes and workout  Do it today  What is the alternative  I guarantee after you work out you will feel 100 times better than if you avoid it for another day   Go on  Get it done   Edit for clarity  I still battle SA everyday and I still have bad days  I don't want OP to think I am saying it's easy  I know how hard it can feel sometimes  But no one can change it for you  You are in the driving seat  You can change  You will change

the thing that worries me about that is that you don't just "get put on a different mood stabilizer"  that's a whole  thing  where you try something for two weeks  work up to a dose  try that for another two weeks  spend another two weeks moderating the mood  and then if it doesn't work you start the whole month two month cycle over    should i really worry that much about the lack of blood work if i'm taking a lower dose of a med that i've been stable on for years

Hi  I'm new on this subreddit and yours is one of the first I've read  I have to say  if your therapist doesn't take you seriously  find another  An aspect of depression is that little things have a huge affect  I've been dealing with depression now for several decades  on and off  and have been on sick leave since last May because of depression and anxiety  What you're describing are pretty typical indications  especially the losing interest in hobbies and such   My therapist tells me that I need to do those things regardless of whether I "want to" or not  doing them will slowly rekindle the interest and the joy that they bring  Hang in there  And find a therapist that takes you seriously

If I'm busy when I'm drunk I'm good  Even symptom free  But once I'm alone like when I got home last night I was a mess  It almost seemed to double because I was drunk  I wanted to be sober really bad but obviously that isn't how it works lol    I normally end up focusing on my breathing then start to freak myself out  Then my symptoms increase a lot when I start panicking  Overall using drugs to mask OCD works personally but often makes things worse the next day for me  or after the party  
I've been thinking a lot about loneliness for a while now  I think I worded quite well in a recent comment too      One thing I believe we all have in common is a sense of aloneness  Whether this manifests itself as loneliness in everyone  I'm not sure  But the way we see and deal with ourselves is different to the way we see and deal with others  and the way we see other people see and deal with each other    I experience the world only through my own eyes  I can only think with my own mind  When I pee  or get out of bed  it's only me doing it  Nobody else  Feeling sore or tired is only done myself  I can't feel your pain    When I talk to someone it is a fundamentally different experience than when I see someone talk to someone else  For example  I might talk to Steve and Paul  When I talk to Steve or Paul  it's me talking to the "other"  someone separate from myself  There is an element of aloneness present in that  I can't see what they thinking the way I can see what I am thinking    When I see Steve and Paul talking however  it's different  It's now two "others" talking  It's different from when I talk to Steve or Paul  It's more connected  It's more connected because they're the same in my experiences  they're both an outside entity  Something of which I cannot experience life through  This means I look at them as more connected together than I am with either of them    I'm more alone than the other people I meet  but they're more alone than me  We all share this common aloneness  this sense of loneliness  And we can experience it together    Coming together doesn't remove that feeling  Might make it easier to cope with  I'm not sure  This is just what I've been thinking about as I become less bitter and try to reach out to people more     I think it also causes a bit of a vicious cycle  When you feel lonely you want a connection with other people  So it makes sense that the "cure" to your loneliness is company  But company doesn't change that fundamental aloneness  In fact  in my experience  group company can make it worse  By directly seeing Steve and Paul talking  you experience that sense of difference and enhanced aloneness    Company then enhances your loneliness instead of helping it  So now  feeling even more lonely you start to think something is wrong with you  Other people have such strong connections with each other  it's different to how you connect with people  "What's wrong with me " you start to think  "Why can't I get close to people "  And it's not like they don't like you  nor you them  You just don't feel close to them  There's a distance    The way I then see it  the answer to dealing with loneliness is understanding that fundamental aloneness and dealing with accepting that  How do you do that  Good question    I think it's easier to do sometimes than other time  We all have moments of weakness    Don't mean to too my own horn but I feel this understanding of loneliness has helped me immensely both in regards to myself and others  There's nothing wrong with the person surrounded by friends feeling lonely  nor is there anything wrong with the person almost entirely alone not feeling lonely  or vice versa   
Sometimes OCD still affects me when I'm drinking  sometimes it doesn't  It's a nice bonus if it doesn't    That said  I am starting to consider the theory that alcohol may make my OCD better at the time  but it may also mean the OCD is likely to be worse the following day

all alone than feel alone in crowd dbv5l4h      I can't tell you how to stop hating yourself  but I can tell you that I used to hate myself and was in a bad place in High School as well  After High School I gradually became less bitter  made jokes about how great I was    then the jokes gradually stopped being jokes  It seems for most people it gets better with age  It doesn't for everyone  but there's always hope there     I can't tell you how to deal with loneliness or depression  I can explain loneliness as I understand it and hope that helps  I can recommend therapy to deal with depression  Otherwise  again  those both often get better after High School  High School is a messy place full of teenagers with messy hormones  It can be hard     I can't tell you how to keep your friends either  But I can suggest you look up things like the book "How to Win Friends and Influence People"  or the youtube channel "Charisma on Command" and think about how you come across to others  The way we act  even subtly can affect how people perceive us  being aware of that and changing even minor things  Like saying 'I don't mind'  instead of 'I don't care'  can make drastic improvements on how you come across     One more thing  I started to feel much better when I stopped caring about being more invested in the friendship  relationship  whatevership  Oddly it made me both more and less invested  I invite people to do things  or start up conversations with people just because I want to  If they don't want to  I don't mind  I give friendship out as I want like a gift  not expecting anything in return  I think people often WANT to be a better friend  they WANT to be there for you  but they don't know how      You say you're fat too  I'd suggest you change that  Not even to stop people teasing you or anything  Fuck 'em  Plenty of fat people are incredibly popular  But you've stated that you hate yourself and have low self esteem  I believe losing weight will be a step in the right direction in that regard  Keep it simple  just replace soft drink with water  Or  if replacing it altogether is too much  just drink a glass of water before you have any soft drink and you'll drink much less  Gradually replace your bad dietary habits with good ones  By 2018 you won't even recognise yourself     You're young and you want to improve  you're gonna do fine

Just at night or when you're tired  When I was depressed  whenever I got tired any negative feelings I had were amplified  A friend has expressed the same thing  Even now  I'm in a very good place in my life  when I'm tired I can get more down than normal    If I eat and sleep well this effect is mitigated  Eating a generally healthy diet and sleeping consistent early hours  Always getting up at 7am  going to bed at 10 30pm  and no screen time past 9 30pm  All leads me to feeling more energetic and better

Hiya  McDonalds employee of 2 years here   Obviously your Wendy's part spoke to me the most  Of course you felt shame at first  Society practically trains everyone to scoff at people who work jobs like that  But what I learned very  very quickly as someone who also had almost no work experience prior to McDonalds  is that the job teaches you healthy humility  resilience and the ability to work under pressure  IMO  these traits are extremely beneficial to someone with anxiety   What I mean by healthy humility is that you don't think low of or hate yourself  but rather respect for being able to work a job many others think themselves "too good" to do  Someone has to give these people their food every day  Someone has to clean the bathrooms  Someone has pick up trash off the roadways  Without them  it flat out  doesn't get done    I think you should try again  Maybe not at Wendy's but really at whatever job gives you the chance  Because if you stick with something and learn those traits  you'll become a respectable employee in time  I know exactly what it's like to show up to work at first and be terrible at your job and have managers belittle everything you do  Now  they're practically begging me not to go every time i announce a vacation   You haven't given yourself enough of a chance to declare yourself a bad worker  Give yourself a real chance to shine and make a living in life  I thought myself the same before I really decided I wasn't going to give up for a change  Put up with the crap that comes with the early days of a new job  and see if you can turn it around  I'm pretty certain that if someone like me can  you can too 
If this is a symptom of an illness it's unlikely to improve on it's own  I don't know how old you are or where you live  but here in the UK it's relatively easy to see a doctor anonymously  I believe the cutoff for when they can't tell your parents what you tell them is 16  If you can't see a doctor anonymously you should consider explaining your situation for full to your parents in order to get help

I was 'laid back' as well  but it was me avoiding all responsibility and thoughts of the future because of that feeling of anxiousness you get    When I was about to graduate  or start my own company  or make a big change I would be horribly stressed   I had to learn to recognize and deal with my anxiety in the good times to avoid getting really bad sometimes 
Just to add  below is an exact description of how I feel but missing a few extra thing   You feel low  like really low  you've never felt this way before you feel like nothing could ever make you happy  nothings going your way and everything you love leaves  you feel like your life is a constant merry go round of the same shitty job and the same shitty routine with the same depressing faces  you feel alone  no matter what anyone says to you about love or life it's all empty words going in to an empty shell of a man that's been worn away at for years  no one cares  not really  they say they do but at the end of the day when it comes to them or you they always choose themselves over you and you know deep deep down that you'd chose them over you now and forever and no matter who it is they're this way  so what's the point  Why keep going round and round when things don't get better  they just get worse  the government don't give a fuck  family means fuck and and no one wants me  why not just end it all and get off the merry go round and stop the pain  I'm not talking pain as in sore headaches or cuts  I'm talking a pain that's unthinkable a numbness from deep down and swirling of the mind like water draining down the sink forever and ever  a never ending feeling of aloness and just bluntness that no matter what you do  what people say it never goes away  things you know  your mind says  that will make you happy it doesn't do it  it just won't work the numbness is still there that empty black hole of a void that can't be filled

  You sound like a very sweet and compassionate person to me  and I'm sorry for your loss      I know when I was 17  I had a bf and friends but only a couple of friends  They saw me go through a lot with depression and anxiety and it really does put a strain on relationships  My Mom was pretty strict too  and still is  I'm 20 now   She's still overprotective and it makes it harder to do all the things my friends like to do      But when I was in high school  I talked to her about the problems I was having and really just explained how I felt as much in detail as I could  We had a few disagreements but she did understand and loosened up a bit after that     Plus  I realized that it wasn't just the things around me that was causing my depression  it was a chemical imbalance  It's sad that not a lot of younger people realize this until later on or until it is too late     Without the right amount of chemicals in your brain  it's so much harder to deal  even with counseling  If I were you  I would talk to your parents about the way you're feeling  no matter how you think it might turn out      Also  see if you can get an appointment with your doctor and explain these things to him  It sounds weird  but they will help you  My whole senior year was one of the best I remember because I was on the right medication and I made friends a lot easier because of how I felt       Love you OP  stay strong

A suggestion inspired by my therapist  Before you can get to any of those places  you have to know where they are   Make a list of the things you  would  be doing if anxiety were not getting in the way   These don't have to all be gigantic "find my soul mate" kind of things   One of the most mundane items on my list is to hire an electrician to get a range top microwave installed   Once you have the list perhaps you can identify one of the more 'doable' things at your current comfort level   Maybe there is a way to make some small progress there   Or discuss the list with your therapist or somebody else you trust

To those with this delima let's do an experiment  Ask yourself what would you do if you was the boss of your own life  Write that question big  And Everytime you feel anxious or depress write it under that question  Eventually you will have a list of things you like to do if you were in control  That's step 1   Step 2 is asking yourself how will I get there from the first list  Step 3 is upon looking at each entry ask yourself is or was it will it be worth it

Please find some help  There's nothing wrong with asking for it or needing it  A therapist can be an incredible help no matter what your problem   If you have some family  friends  or even acquaintances  reach out to them  I know you feel like nobody cares  but that's virtually never true  Unfortunately people can't always tell when something is wrong  so you have to tell them  I know what it's like to sit there and wish someone would text or call you  or sit in the same room with someone and wish they'd ask how you're doing  You just have to say "I need to talk "  From your recent post history it looks like you've been doing well in terms of alcohol and self harm  Four years sober and three weeks without cutting is no small feat  That shows that you're a strong person  Stronger than you might think or feel right now  I know that relapsing can really bring you down  even severely  But you can't think of it as all or nothing  You can't think of it as complete success or complete failure  You've already chalked up that much time where you've abstained from these things  You know how to handle urges  You can always get right back to it    Don't let a temporary state of mind decide your life  I'm sure you've heard it  and probably don't want to  but it's a permanent solution to a temporary problem  And taking your life is like taking the pain you're feeling  amplifying it ten times  and inflicting it on everyone who cares about you   You have the ability to push through this  You have people who care  Find them  Don't assume that they don't care just because they're not asking you how you're doing  You said you spent time making other people happy  If that means just being kind to them or acting happy when you're not or cheering them up when they're down  I guarantee that they noticed    I have a friend who is one of the nicest  most upbeat guys I know  After I was dumped a few months ago he was kind enough to give me advice and help me through it  That's when he told me that he was fully ready to commit suicide within the past year  Rope tied up and everything  I never would have suspected that  If I did I would've talked to him  and if he asked to talk I would've met up with him in a heartbeat   Please stick around  Message me if and when you need to  Ask someone for help  Talk to someone  Life is worth it  and you're fucking worth it   I know I'm only a stranger on the internet  but I wish you a very happy New Year 
You'll make a lot of mistakes in life  because we all do    The most important thing is that you think honestly about what went wrong and what you can do better in the future    It can be discouraging to fail  absolutely  But you should feel those feelings instead of ignore them  and then try and do better next time    If you'd ever like to talk  I am a teacher and a I have a psychology degree  Feel free to message me if you feel down or need help    I've worked with a lot of students who felt the same way

What I used to do was go to events where I knew nobody and just try to become comfortable with being uncomfortable  I know that sounds weird  so let me explain  I would go to a bar or club and just sit there alone and not try put unnecessary pressure on myself by needing to come across as "likeable" or "cool" or whatever  Just sitting or standing there alone and becoming aware of what thoughts and emotions are going through me  So when I felt uneasy    I noticed it and just allowed it to be there  The interesting thing is that after a while  when you allow the feeling of discomfort to be there    it no longer is discomfortable  And you will start to see that everyone  although they might come across as relaxed and comfortable  is far more occupied with afraid of how people are judging them  than with judging you  Once you are able to be ok with feeling that discomfort then it becomes much easier to connect with people

I guess if your choice is Hospital or clozaril  you have to choose which one of those is more uncomfortable for you    Clozaril has a list of somewhat unfortunate potential side effects  but they are potential ones  Meaning  not everyone gets them and it's highly dependent on the individual who takes it  Seven people could come on here and tell you their experience and all seven of those could be wildly different    Many people decide that the side effects  if any  are worth having their minds back once they experience that  It is a very effective medication  It is honestly known to be one of  if not  the most effective medications for the symptoms you are describing  The only reason it is not prescribed more often is an extremely rare blood disorder than can develop  It's almost unheard of it is so rare  It requires that  especially at the beginning  you go in for a weekly lab draw  The pharmacy will not be able to fill your prescription unless they have the results of that lab work  It's a highly regulated special registration system for that med that pharmacies have to go through  If you miss your lab work  you don't get your prescription  They cannot give it to you  There may be a one day exception or something but in general  that is regulated by the FDA  so I don't think they have much leeway  I have two pharmacists in my family who practiced for over 25 years and neither one of them ever saw anyone have signs of the blood issue ever  They don't know any pharmacists who have either  It's a very rare issue    The other thing to keep in mind  is like any med  if you take it and it becomes unbearable in terms of side effects  where they outweigh the benefit of the drug  you can talk to your doctor about changing  If the side effects cause you so much distress that your quality of life is crap  then clearly the drug isn't worth it  Your doctor should be able to see that and work with you  A prescription is not a marriage  It's just a "try it and see "

Please don't take this as an attack  it isn't meant offensively  I'm quite sure I'd be in a similar position myself if my boyfriend broke up with me  Maybe I should listen to my own advice     It sounds as though you're using relationships as a crutch to deal with your own problems  Everyone has to have a crutch to get them through the bad times   religion  food  gaming  people  drink  drugs  again  this isn't an attack  people are also my crutch   Now obviously it's healthier to be reliant on a person rather than something harmful like alcohol food binging  But the problem with relationships is a lot of the time they aren't forever   and that can leave you vulnerable when your crutch is pulled from under you  I would perhaps recommend you find some coping strategies on your own  and get a little space from your partner for a while to ensure that  you can be ok on your own   I had a break from relationships for almost a year and began to rely on friendships instead  which can be a lot more stable   It also sounds like you may be putting too much on your boyfriend  Some people can't deal with mental health problems  and we as people suffering with them  shouldn't inflict anything on others they can't deal with  If you love your boyfriend  of course it would be hard to let him go  However  you should also want him to be happy and what's best for him   If after discussing his needs and your needs  you don't feel like they can be aligned or fulfilled   you may have to accept that at least at this point the relationship cannot continue  Not "never"  just  not now   Ask your boyfriend to write a list of qualities traits about you he thinks are 'you'   and how these change when you take on this new 'personality'  This way  you can focus on particular aspects next time you're in one of these social situations   Finally  even if you don't mean to  it is manipulative to use your suicidal thoughts to stop him from leaving you  If you are in crisis or feeling in any way suicidal  please ring the emergency number in your country or go to your nearest emergency department  Our illnesses can make us selfish but for those we really love the real us can shine through   I really hope you can talk through what needs to be talked through  and work things out  But please try to lessen your reliance on him  for your own sake   exercise  engage in a hobbyist group  join a church buy a Bible  or whatever religion you follow  I often wish I was religious so I could do this    go out with friends   do  something   Best wishes  2017 is  our year  
Happens to me all the time  Almost makes me think I'm just making the whole thing up or something  I just think hey I'm depressed  so I think I'll just lay in bed here all day because that's what depression is right  Even though in reality I think I have he abiliy to at least get some things done  Best method I've tried is to just sort of move on through it  Like if I'm actually too depressed to do anything of course I'm going to just lie around  but if I have at least some energy I might as well try to do  something  with it  Not anything in particular  just anything to keep my mind off the awful sinking feeling and the endless dread  Again  it all depends on how bad the depression is

I'm not "great" at it by any means but I think you should keep working on it and give it another shot  The feeling of not deserving it is a good example of another negative thought rushing to your mind and I think if you can slowly work on meditating and focusing on your breathing you can better control those things  You won't be perfect at it  the general process for me is "dammit there's a thought" over and over  but doing it imperfectly is still a great relief  This sounds odd but i've found it helps when I have a negative thought  imagine it as a leaf flowing down a river  think to yourself "this is just a thought " and watch it go away

Everyone needs a crutch for their anxiety   whether its something damaging like drink  drugs of binge eating  or something 'safer' like friends  religion and hobbies  I'm glad you found something that helps to take the edge off   and hope you'll use this as a stepping stone rather than a conclusion   I don't want to sound like a nagging mother but for the sake of your health  I would try to find something less damaging you can transition to as a crutch  This could be a slow transition by all means  but I wouldn't want to rely on it in the long term  Best of luck 
Make sure you eat  Taking antibiotics on an empty stomach is a bad idea  What I do if I am on antibiotics is kind of bury it with food  usually oatmeal is my go to  So I would eat about half of the bowl of oatmeal or whatever you choose to eat   take the meds and then finish the food so there's plenty in your stomach  otherwise the antibiotic will irritate your stomach  Good luck  you will be fine

Assuming like most of us  you don't have any reason to fear imminent death  and that this is just a general long term concern     yes  the concept of not existing is extremely terrifying to me  Somehow  many people especially as they get older come to peace with this    maybe they're just tired from life  or their religion gives them promises of afterlife  For the rest of us  I think we just willfully and naively ignore the looming tragic reality of death   otherwise we could not even get through the day  not function at all  because we'd know that this is all just hopeless    I also sometimes get that overwhelming feeling of insignificance  Usually it comes for me on long distance flights  in the middle of the night when everyone else is asleep  and we're flying over uninhabited ocean or the arctic  hours from any human civilization

Hey  Don't worry at all about vomiting from antibiotics  I hate taking them because no matter what with an empty stomach or full stomach I always get diarrhea from it but that's just me  I have a sensitive stomach  My words of advice  IF you get diarrhea  REMEMBER it is from the antibiotics because they kill the good bacteria as well  if you do get it  it will have NO correlation to stomach virus or throwing up  You will be absolutely 100  fine

You can outgrow it  When I was in high school the mere mention of the symptoms of any disease would give me panic attacks and I threw up on more than one occasion from worrying about illnesses I'd convinced myself I had   Now  I occasionally find myself worrying about something because I do have certain mild health problems that aren't identified  but it's just usually a passing thought and not something that I dwell on or panic over    One thing that helped me was treating my anxiety in general  I quit smoking  I quit drinking caffeine  I cut way back on drinking  started exercising again  and I eat much healthier now  These aren't cure alls  but I found the combination lowered my anxiety dramatically and helped me approach things more clearly  I also tried some medications that I didn't end up liking  but that can be an important part of getting better too that's worth trying  Of course if you can afford it therapy is also a great resource  but the above are things you can do immediately that can have a noticeable impact   I wish you luck in overcoming your health anxiety  and just remember that it IS possible  You don't have to suffer from this your whole life

   don't neglect your teeth of all things  that shit wont heal    listen to this man  not just cause he's chuck norris  Last week I bit down on a fork too hard and chipped a tooth  It's a fairly small crack on my front tooth but it's noticeable close up and it is sharp enough to cause pain when my tongue runs over it  I had a "come to jeebus" moment when I remembered this is my only set of teeth  No more baby teeth to fall back on

I used to think 'i don't want to commit suicide  but I'd be fine with not waking up tomorrow so at least that way it's no one's fault that I died ' it's a permanent answer to a temporary problem   I say temporary because you can get help for these thoughts  I don't know where you are  but I'm the UK and I phoned a free crisis helpline and spoke to someone who has anxiety and they told me what they do to cope  and worked through ways of what I can do to distract myself from these thoughts  They also connected me with some more long term help  CBT  and it's a long road  but I no longer have these thoughts  That was about rambly but hope it helped even a tiny bit

This is exactly what I felt  in my post only yesterday   https   www reddit com r depression comments 5lb2hh have so much but dont want any of it    Yeah  some shitty stuff may have happened to us  but there are so many others who've had so much worse happen and they turn out fine  Then there's people like us who have so much to be thankful for but no enjoyment of any of it   All I can say to you  and i guess for myself as well  is that you are what you feel  There's no way of hiding you feelings to yourself  and those emotions are what will eventually find their way out to your being  If you feel like you're depressed  just admit to yourself that you are  Force yourself to go see a therapist  even if it's just once  Seeing one doesn't necessarily lead to anti depressants or other drugs  so you'll at least have the chance to say that your depression isn't as bad as some other people's

that dogshit example was neat
Why not try a different approach  well what is dogshit to begain with  it's got nutrients and vitamins and bacteria  It works with the digestive system of the dog  So a good piece means the dog is healthy    Now try to understand depression  It makes you wanna do nothing all day and things like that  But have you ever been depressed and someone  like your grandma or boss  calls and that forces you to be on your best behavior and for a minute you're not depressed anymore  Well that's means its a state of mind  Perhaps going outside and forcing yourself to deal with not people like that could provide you with a deterrence for the state of mind that is depression    There are different kinds of depressions so this example might not work for you but you get my point

I think the phrase intrusive thoughts can help you here  Simply put  they are intrusive  unwanted  and thoughts  not actions   I had a very bad episode of anxiety and panic attacks months ago that had me fearing going near knives in fear is hurt someone including my kids  It was extremely unsettling  I also  around this time  visualized myself walking right into traffic  I absolutely love living and have a decent life  but these thoughts just came   Id say if they continue for more then a few months  seek professional help  There is nothing wrong with talking to someone  As a veteran of a war  pride aside  it's healthy to be open  When you normalize your situation  it becomes very easy to live with it    Be well

Buspar IMO sucks and not even worth filling the prescription  Propranolol is def better but  also comes with possible side effects  In a nutshell propranolol physically stops you from having a panic attack but  mentally   any intrusive thoughts will still be there  If you suffer from anxiety but mainly suffer with physical symptoms racing heart  hyperventilating  etc  then I would def recommend it  If you suffer mentally as well   a different medication would be a better option

I don't know if this can work for you  but humor me   You say you feel like you "have" to do things that a depressed person would do during depression   Usually those seem to be "negative" things that reinforce or validate the depression   What if you convince yourself to do "positive" things a depressed person might do   For example  force yourself to do one good thing for yourself  Even if it's a tiny little thing like brushing your teeth or doing laundry   After you do it  give yourself a huge pat on the back   you deserve it   Another excellent one that I recommend is going out in the sunlight in the morning for 30 45 minutes  You don't have to leave home even  just go out on your porch  balcony or backyard 
Don't give up just yet  Keep trying  there is a solution to your problems

Hallo  I hope you can benefit from your partial hospitalization program like I  and many others I personally know  have benefited from ours    My psychiatrist also prescribed Abilify to add on to my antidepressant  generic of Effexor XR  as an enhancer thingy when I was at my partial hospitalization program  He saved my life when he prescribed it  and that is not an exaggeration  My antidepressant was working really well for me  but then it was losing its effectiveness  in my case  So  Abilify was added  Adding it has made a huge difference in how I feel  and I wouldn't have made anywhere near as much progress without it    As far as side effects go  the only side effect I experienced was increased hunger at higher doses  I'm on five milligrams now  which I believe is a lower dose  so increased hunger hasn't been an issue

Gratz mate  Brushing your teeth is great  You feel so confident when you look into the mirror with those well kept teeth 
You definitely exist without connections  Rejection is something we all experience  but for some the anxiety associated with the potential of being rejected is too much and we avoid social situations  People will tell you it's in your head and that if you just go out and try  things will be different  but they never are  The problem with social anxiety is that the expectations have been programmed in   the most rational thought cannot overcome the feelings of anxiety  The only way to deal with it is to gradually reprogram yourself out of the anxiety  There is a good approach for dealing with this sort of anxiety and it may be difficult  but it works    https   www verywell com how do i get over my fear of social situations 3024829  I also want to add that it is best to think of this as a disorder that can be fixed  not a fundamental part of who you are  Who you are at any given moment is the sum of your current thoughts and past experiences   if we change our daily experiences and our thoughts  we can gradually change who we are  It just takes time

Have you told anyone about your hallucinations  Because yes  what you just described could be OCD  however  that behavior WITH the hallucinations is schizophrenia not OCD  The hallucinations significantly change the diagnosis  People with OCD have delusions   like believing the world is going to end  but not hallucinations  Schitzophrenia has BOTH hallucinations and delusions

Hi  Sorry to hear about your struggles  Give yourself a lot of credit for reaching out and wanting help   I will copy and paste a guide I wrote about how to find a good  affordable therapist in the US  One second  let me find it  I also recommend starting with a primary care physician to get a check up done and a blood test ordered  These things can help rule out any potential causes or factors contributing to the way you're feeling like thyroid issues  hormone imbalances  and vitamin deficiencies  Keep in mind that seeing a doctor doesn't automatically mean you'll need to take psychiatric medication  nothing wrong with that at all though  I'm on psych meds myself    I also mean this respectfully  but would seeing a therapist be an option  as well  A therapist who is a good match for you can provide support  give you a private place to express yourself  give objective feedback on your situation  help you move forward   if you have any questions  like what types of questions you would be asked by a professional  how to prepare for a first appointment  how first appointments usually go  or my personal experiences with professional help   then don't hesitate to ask me  Feel free to send a message anytime

OK  found it  Part 2                                              How to find an affordable therapist in the US     There is a well known website called psychologytoday com that has a therapist finder and psychiatrist finder to locate professionals in the US  Here are the steps    1  Search online for psychologytoday com's therapist finder  Search by your zip code or city  or nearby ones  in the search bar of psychologytoday's search engine thingy    2  If you have insurance  look on the left sidebar to filter your search results by your insurance provider  If you don't have insurance  look at the bottom of this post because I address this    3  Hopefully after selecting your insurance provider  a list of professionals will come up  Each professional's profile should have their picture  what they specialize in  price  contact information like an email address or phone number  etc  The information you'll find in each profile can help you find a professional who is a good match for you  It's a lot more useful than just randomly calling a name from a list  you know what I mean    4  Read through a few profiles and see whom you'd like to work with    5  Go ahead and contact a few therapists through email or by phone  I suggest contacting a few  just in case there is a waiting list  If you need help with what to say  then let me know and I can write up a quick example that you can tweak or use as is        If you have no bad insurance and or are in a tough financial spot      In the US  the key phrases you want to look for are   sliding scale   or   income based    which just mean that the professional will take your financial insurance situation into account and lower the price  People can even qualify for free help  depending on their situation  As far as finding professionals who charge on a sliding scale or provide income based services  remember when I said above to look on the left sidebar after you search by your zip code or city to filter by your insurance provider  Well  you can disregard that part  Instead  what will happen anyway is that after you hit enter when you put in your zip code or city  a list of professionals will come up anyway    Click on any profile and scroll down to the finances section  If it says sliding scale  yes  then you're in luck because the price can be negotiated and should be able to be lowered    Now you know where to look for professionals who charge on a sliding scale  If you have any questions about anything  don't hesitate to ask me  I wrote a lot and some may be unclear  Feel free to ask anything

In my experience  weed is very counter productive  It can reduce the anxiety in the moment  but leads to overthinking things and paranoid thoughts  And it also warps your sense of reality a bit  making things worse  That slightly different perspective is cool in the moment  but if you smoke too much  it can be harmful   I know a lot of people here are giving you a pass on this  but I've been through a similar path you have and in my experience  it's better to deal with things head on  and LEARN to deal with them head on  That will make you stronger in the long run  and allow you to deal with anxiety when it comes back  which it often does   That's also why I'm not a fan of medication for anxiety  Certainly not long term  You're simply silencing the symptoms without dealing with the underlying issue that's causing them in the first place 
propranolol is great  as mentioned above  it prevents physical symptoms but that helps your thinking too  it's far easier for panicky thoughts to overwhelm you if your body is panicking too  it gets me through anxious situations pretty well

Intrusive thoughts were the worst part about my rough patch of anxiety last year  They really can be terrifying and take many forms  What I learned is that the more you force those thoughts away out of fear  the more you are validating them in your mind  And they just keep coming back stronger and more frequent  I read tons on the subject  and what eventually worked for me was learning to see those thoughts coming and simply acknowledge them as 'oh  intrusive thoughts'  but not judging them as good or bad  Takes practise  But learning that will make you stronger in the long run   Journaling is a very good way to get to the underlying issues  but also just to realize how absurd those thoughts really are  and that there's no evidence that you would ever actually do them  They are thoughts  not impulses  You are not feeling a compulsion to do them  In fact  you are probably horrified by them  That's a good thing  Once you write things down in an anxious moment  and read them again when you are feeling good  you realize how silly they are  And that eventually takes away their power over you   A few articles I saved that helped me back then  that might perhaps help you    http   theworrygames com 2016 02 anxiety scary intrusive thoughts story   http   www megsanity com article asp title Lies Your Brain Tells You Why We Have Scary Thoughts post 49
I felt like this for a long time  but then I realised that I was happy where I am  For example  there were a number of times when I would think I was missing out by not socialising  but whenever I would bite the bullet and go out  I'd always be thinking about home and wanting to be in the comfort of my own home  
My first panic attack came on after a discussion about death with my step father  The fear hits me at night too  for which I take xanax  Obviously that isn't a long term solution so I only take it when it is absolutely necessary  My sister recommended this Alan Watts' video  which did help me some  You might give it a watch      https   www youtube com watch v M7KRgluYeps  I know that probably isn't the answer you're looking for  but I haven't found the answer yet either  Death is a very difficult and anxiety provoking topic for me to discuss and ponder

Stands for exposure response therapy  it's a type of cognitive behavioral therapy that involves confronting an obsession  the thoughts  but refraining from compulsions  the rituals   It's very effective in treating OCD

Look   the stinking dead moose in the room is your high pressure status   School in another COUNTRY   I bet you and your folks have stratospheric performance expectations  right      Plus you living this jetset life  living abroad is stressful EVEN IF YOU ARE HAVING A GOOD TIME    So give yourself a hug and pat on the back   You are at a high pressure time of life  and actually handling it well    Right now   With antibiotics  you have to suck it up until they are finished  but make sure to cover the basics 'in extremis'   no caffeine  no alcohol  plenty of low intensity exercise   time by yourself  no screens   to decompress   listen to ASMR for soothing  breathing exercises or simple meditation  and recover from the toxic impact of antibiotics namely full spectrum vitamins and minerals   and a range of gut repair supplements or foods  especially pre and probiotics      Try magnesium for immediate relief of anxiety  it's worth a try    And know this   you WILL make it through   Good luck for 2017

I guess it's my turn to pay it forward   I know the feeling and circumstance you are talking about  no action you take betters your situation all the while everything just keeps deteriorating  Career  Family  Health  and Life in general   You have to understand one thing  It's the perception of mind  the intent of actions  and performing the intended action that will slowly but steadily change your circumstance  Unless you understand this and apply it to every aspect of your life  nothing will change  Another thing I would add is that the change wont happen overnight  It will take months before you see the effects    What you need to do is install new habits  adapt new values  and ultimately change your mindset so that the actions that you take yield the desired results      Here's what helped me       Creating a routine ritual  This way you have something to look forward to through the day     Workout  Hit the gym  focus on form  repetition  and then the weights  Don't have money  look into calisthenics  All you will need is your body  ground  and a pull up bar   Elementary school playgrounds have them and are free to use after school hours   After a few weeks  you will notice that you're less aggressive  have a more defined self esteem  and will begin to value self discipline and persistence     Eat  Not eating doesn't do anyone any good  You will be bitchy through the day and people will reflect that bitchiness back at you  If you are working out  you will need your strength so eat a balanced diet     Breathing exercises  Not sure why  but they will make you more mindful  make your body more efficient  and increase concentration  I suggest the Wim Hoff method since it's free on youtube     Clean up  Shave  get a haircut  brush your teeth  take showers  wear clean clothes  etc  It's nice tell people to nor judge a book by it's cover  but let's face it  your presentation of yourself will dictate how many folks look at you  This will also help you get a job     Few other thoughts       Ask yourself what success means to you  And then make really small goals steps to accomplish it  If you just perform the above steps without a set goal  you will aimless proceed through life and you will not be in tune with the changes      Hug your dad  He is the only dad you will ever have in this world  Even if you hate him  after a few weeks  you both will realize the the need for each other  If you don't see any changes at least know that you tried to love      Plasma donation usually give  10 30 depending on your location  It isn't much but it will put food on the table for a day or two  Also  there are churches and soup kitchens that can help you out      Wake up every morning and look at yourself  Make eye contact with yourself  And then tell yourself that you will put all your effort in whatever you are doing regardless of the outcome  There is nothing more "manly"  your words not mine  than giving your best and accepting the win or fail outcome    Good Luck   D 
Go to the festival that I've already bought the tickets for  don't be a complete hermit and maybe even get a job 
After forty five years of self loathing and perennial self harm thoughts  I finally found the help I needed   Yes  it does get better  It does take way too fucking long  imo   but the man I am today would be nearly unidentifiable to my children  both physically  I've lost nearly 100lbs from my peak and 50 since I last saw my girls  as well as being completely me  nearly symptom free  and recently described as the embodiment of don Miguel Ruiz call that we all love until we can help everyone   It gets massively better    Find your solution  The Four Agreements was life altering for me   once on the twisted road home  you will find more peace than you thought possible  even if you've never known it before

I've spent the last ten years using bipolar as a sort of victim card because it was easier for me to use it than to address it  I know that probably makes me sound like an awful person  but whatever    Diagnosis or not get the help you think you need and don't be afraid to be your own advocate  The med trial and error game suckkkks  And antipsychotics in general are no walk in the park  but just wait it out    I was originally diagnosed depressed than had a HUGE antidepressant induced sleeping 2 hours a night  solving the worlds problems  as hyper sexual as a hardly pubescent 14 year old girl manic episode that took about a month and a shit ton of abilify to bring down  And after times trial and errors  unintentionally going off my meds  getting hospitalized  going on and off meds for years  experimenting with adderall only to find it changed me life  un medicated stabilizing through out pregnancy and breast feeding  and my most recent depressive crash I'm full of diagnosises and found a med combo that is promising   It's not an easy road  but dude  you've made it this far with out the diagnosis  you can keep on  Just advocate for yourself  Be as strong as you can  find support for when you need help being strong and keep your head held high      Also haven't slept this year cause I suck at meds sometimes so this is me trying to type out my thoughts before they go away

Yeah  I started off taking 500 mg per day and saw some temporary benefit  Then I read a study that demonstrated how three depressed patients went in full remission after taking 2 3 grams per day  I have been taking two grams per day for about a month now  I am currently experimenting with dividing the two grams into two seperate doses and taking both grams at once  I have read some anecdotes that taking two grams at once works better  In any case  it will likely take a couple of weeks before you see any benefit   I have also been taking 4 5 mg of low dose Naltrexone per day  which I suspect is helping as well  Interestingly  both Naltrexone and Agmatine have tolerance reducing properties  I have no idea if these mechanisms directly play a role in their antidepressant effects or if other effects are at play  However  both substances seem to be sustainable treatments  as opposed to treatments that need to be cycled   which is probably the best characteristic for a compound intended to treat anhedonia  
At times life is good  at times it feels like worth of giving up  Fixing those issues is like moving a mountain just to get to the starting point where other people start their journey 
I have had mainly "Pure O" OCD my entire life  It makes living painful  and unrelated struggles become fifteen times harder  I can't shut my mind off  I'm always seeking reassurance  always assuming the absolute worst  It gives me a short temper because the anxiety rises up like a volcano under stress   I can't have discussions with my friends and disagree with them on something because I feel like I'm inherently wrong  that I'm flawed  that the things I think and feel are not as valid as anyone else's  It's why I'm constantly seeking reassurance  If I don't feel like I'm "perfect" to someone  it gives me a lot of anxiety  I can't have different views than my friends because I feel like my friends are "tainted" if they feel differently about something I take personally  it messes with that feeling of having "perfection"   I can't take anything at face value  I have to scrutinize and analyze and turn it over and over in my head until my brain is numb  I don't know how other people are so laid back and can let things go  It's foreign to me  everything in my brain has to be in order  have a place  be controlled and perfect    I get intrusive thoughts too  I have a hard time with sexual things because I always suddenly picture something awful  But those things bother me less than the constant analyzing  I'm so exhausted that I went to a sleep disorder center and they thought I had narcolepsy  I don't  we found out  because my brain is so burned out    I can't think of what else to say right now  I've been to therapy and have practiced mindfulness techniques  I've been on every kind of OCD medication  I just want peace  I'm too tired to try and keep going

Yes  not giving into the compulsion  reassurance seeking  for example  is part of the ERP  but one thing that ERP involves is specific triggering of things  carefully chosen  so that you don't start with stuff too far advanced  it's entirely staggered so that you build up to the hard triggers  and then active resistance of the compulsions  So  it is a very active process  It is difficult  but achievable   like climbing a mountain  you go one step at a time  and you bring along the right supports  I think of it like going outside into the sun after having lived indoors for years   you'll get a bad sunburn fast  so you need to work up slowly to being able go to the beach  if you get my drift   I'm glad to hear that you're making your friends family part of the process by letting them know about reassurance seeking behaviour  Friends and family can be amazing allies in overcoming OCD  Good luck
