My first reaction was to start typing and say of course this is creepy and unhealthy  But there's one thing that comes before anyone else's opinion  and that is whether or not you are okay with this  If you know deep down that you want a real committed future with someone and not some half measure where they can't marry you because of their mommy  then no  of course this is not okay  On the other hand  if the official title or status of the relationship doesn't matter much to you and you're happy existing in a situation that is pretty much a dead end while you maybe keep your eye out for other opportunities  nobody else has the right to tell you whether that's okay or not   Based on what you wrote I'd have to assume this is of course not the situation you wanted otherwise you wouldn't be here asking about it    He's 28  Of course anyone would be hurt by hearing their parent make a threat of suicide or something like that  but at the end of the day his mother is of the previous generation and he has his own life to live and should understand that he has to think about his own future and not throw away opportunities in his own life because his mother made threats    I think there's one strong possibility here that you may not like to confront  Rather than seeing this as his manipulative mother coming in and messing things up and tearing him away from you  you have to consider that if he gave up the fight that easily that he must not have been too concerned about having a real future with you or taking this relationship to the point of full commitment  I can tell you right now if I deeply loved someone  even my own family trying to come between us and manipulate me with some silly threats wouldn't be enough that suddenly I'm willing to distance myself from that person  So don't do him the favor of acting like he's an equal victim of circumstance here and that you've both had your future taken away because of her  He wouldn't be going along with her demands if he valued having a real future with you  In the end this gives you a clear window into how much he was concerned about you and having that future together  and it doesn't seem like much  No man who loves you could be taken away from you by his mother  That's his problem to live with and maybe some day in the future come to realize how foolish he was that he made that more important than you  But don't look at this like it's the circumstances keeping him from you  He's allowing himself to be kept from you    If you wanted more than some relationship that can never be anything official  then of course it is unhealthy to put aside what you know is right for you and try to go along with it  Of course this all depends on what is causing the problem in a relationship  if you were here saying you want a man who can provide you all the money and riches in the world and you're not sure if you can settle  it might be different to try to tell you that you're hung up on all the wrong things and you should be able to love the person anyway  But this situation is not like that  It's an an unhealthy desire to actually want to have a full  admitted future with someone and not have to treat it like some dirty secret that can't be talked about    And if he's actually saying he'd go along with it if his mom finally sound some other person that she'd approve of him marrying  then hell no there's no reason for you to stay in this  What are you gonna do  spend years of your life as his companion until the mother finally "hires" him a wife and then you get left in the dust   It's over  A 28 year old man just let his mother come before you  You can do better than that  If you struggle with self esteem or self worth like so many of us do  it's all too easy to take the wrong road in a situation like this and decide to put up with it  if you have fears and doubts about meeting somebody else or if you still want to justify having strong feelings for this person  But I hope you won't  It won't be easy and it's going to hurt  It's pretty cowardly of him that rather than him accepting it's his limitations that are ruining this and he should be the one to end it by acting like a man  it ends up as if you're the one who has to break off the relationship instead when you're not the one with the demanding mother threatening suicide  So it reveals something else less than ideal about him that he'd be okay to stick you in this horrible position and now is going to let you carry the burden of making the tough choices    You may care about him but I hope with what happened here that you can maybe see him in a new light and see how weak and pathetic he is acting and maybe that will break the spell about how much you think you love him and make it a little easier to walk away  The refer to these things in relationships as "Red flags" and ultimate we seal our own fate when we either decide to pay attention to those warning signs or try to look away and keep marching forward anyway  You've received a pretty huge red flag in this situation  I wouldn't ignore it  Find something better  Let him be in a relationship with his mom and she can pick a wife for him  Yikes    He's winning a really unfair game right now  that you're continuing to date him and give him all the same sort of access to you despite being told this new change in circumstances  You deserve to be with someone who has to put an equal amount into the relationship and wants the same type of future as you do

Nah  definitely not weird  The only tip I've really got is that sometimes I'll go for a run or bike ride  and that helps  It's getting too cold here to do that  but I imagine in Australia it's probably pretty warm this time of year   I'll also try to do something that requires more concentration than watching TV  like   and this is where I'll sound weird   I like translating songs from English into Spanish and vice versa  I learned Spanish in middle and high school  and doing the translating helps me not forget it  And since it requires some brain power  I get distracted  Though I guess distracted is not the same as being comfortable alone  but it does help   If I pick up any less oddly specific tips  I'll definitely send them your way      oh wait I just remembered one more thing actually  When I'm at school and want to be around people but my friends are doing something else  I'll go to the library or a cafe to read or do work or something  That way  even though I'm not interacting with people  I'm still around them  Hearing the distant chatter is kinda comforting

I was repeatedly emotionally abused  no  tormented  for years after my father's death  I was the only one to deal with the brunt if my mom's episodes  she'd kick me out and if I refused to come home she would threaten me  Once I would return home  this happened many times  she would be in the psych ward for about a week and there was sharpie all over the walls lying about how nobody cared about me and my dead dad 'never wanted me'  I was 10 when he died  he was my everything and he spoiled me with love  Finally  after being the victim of all of her abuse  I was freed right before my 15th birthday  By finding her dead in her bed  At least she died from something other than suicide    It's been 4 years and I still have nightmares almost every night of her coming and stalking me  and running her normal mental tormentation routine  It feels real every times  I want to miss my mom  but I don't remember the real her  All I remember is her disease and the torment  And how she looked when I found her  Just typing that last sentence was hard   I feel like shit for not being upset with her death  She was torturing me and her life itself was torture  she wanted to die so bad   Hell  I'd probably have killed myself if she hadn't died   Now I'm happy with my high school sweetheart and we're getting married and he holds me when I have attacks and takes such good care of me  Tl dr  orphan kid suffers greatly from now dead abusive mother

 hugs   I know you feel responsible for her suicide and consider yourself negligent in preventing it  but you don't deserve to carry this weight alone  You're going through your own issues just as she was  and in the end it was your sister that made up her mind to find an ending  and I feel like it would have been impossible to stop her regardless  It's difficult to avoid "could have" and "should have" thought patterns for sure  but I want you to know that while such statements may indeed be true   we all could have and should have done certain things that we never did   it is also true that we often don't have the level of control over others' actions that we think we do  I'm so sorry for your loss and for the pain you're going through  I hope that one day you will find peace and healing

Im 44 and 6 feet tall yet kids make my anxious  Its because they dont have a filter yet and will say anything    Kids learn by pushing boundaries which is why he threw the ball at you anyway but lightly  to see if he could get away with it  The problem is that depending on the parents they might not approve of you "teaching" their child so it leaves you in an awkward spot    In your example is sounds like the parents are the problem as this kid is disrespectful to everyone

Used to have severe vertigo  Started taking OTC magnesium because I was low on blood tests  Lots of praying went into the magnesium  It has quite literally negated my vertigo issues  Though  they're big ass pills  I could barely change oil in my vehicle  or have my teeth cleaned  Because as soon as I looked up it would set off an attack  After taking magnesium for nearly a year and a half  praying that stuff actually works  it finally left  I still have minor attacks sometimes

I relate to some of the things you mentioned  I think about things I worry about pretty much literally 24 7 and sometimes if it's really bad my brain will feel like it's literally tired or strained  Like the muscles in my brain are tensing up or something  I think odds are I just stress myself out so much to the point I give myself a mild headache from time to time  I can also relate to the hair pulling  something I rarely do but am trying to stop at any rate  Whenever I get violent thoughts they usually revolve around myself  but I've definitely been through your situation of imaging them happening to other people and it sucks  it's awful  For me when it comes to reading I tend to feel like I didn't fully comprehend a sentence I read because my mind is always going a hundred miles an hour so I'll read the same line over and over again until I feel sure that I understood exactly what it said    I don't really have any great advice since I'm kind of in the same boat as you  But I just wanted you to know you're definitely not alone in this kind of stuff  What I'm going to try to do is do more things that are beneficial for me  I find I feel really great after I exercise  Like  it sucks during the actual exercise but once I finish I feel all this adrenaline and I feel really proud of myself for accomplishing something even if it's small  My brother was also kind enough to loan me a book on anxiety that I'm going to genuinely try to finish instead of just read the first few pages like I normally do with self help books  And lastly I'm gonna give meditation a try  I think it's helpful to just try to clear your mind of all the junk your ocd is trying to feed you all day and let your body just exist for a moment in peace  Not saying you've gotta do all those things  but those are always options  Seeing a therapist if you're not already could also really help  although I haven't exactly taken my own advice on that yet  Sorry this comment was so long but best of luck

I'm kind of in the same place  I used to have super bad harm thoughts which gave me super super bad anxiety and depression  Now whenever I have them it's almost like I brush them off  but I think that's just because my mind is giving priority of sorts to my more dominant obsessions  But honestly  the fact that you're freaking out about it is a pretty good indicator that you have no actual will to act on your thoughts and never will  Just keep in mind ocd is a pesky little thing  likes to play tricks on you and the things you most never want to do  Yeah  it's gonna find some way to make you think you actually do  ocd's mean like that 
Congrats on going  My visit was very simple  I noted on my paper that I was having depression and anxiety issues  they had me fill out a form before I came back so that they knew what the visit was about   and I explained my issues to my doc  at which point I was prescribed anti anxiety medication that changed my life for the better    pretty simple stuff

I would definitely recommend it  it made me feel a lot more comfortable with staying on my meds  I also did a lot of digging on PubMed  but the research published on lithium exposure isn't very extensive because it's obviously hard to test in any way other than self reported studies  The biggest risk seems to be a heart valve defect  but like I said  the doctors I saw aren't convinced that the incidence of that is actually any higher than the general population  I believe risk is dose dependent though  so that might be work talking to MFM about  I take 600mg day  also take lamictal and risperidone

While I certainly understand the aggravation and anxiety this caused you   I also suffer from OCD  you have to realize a lot of these things are considered normal behavior  outside he toothpaste spit  She had no idea a lot of those common things would cause you a level of anxiety she honestly has never experienced    In a positive turn    you made it through it   All those things you deem dangerous didn't get you  This was a great exercise in exposure for you    Just remember your sister most likely didn't do anything on purpose  
Whenever I drink I tend to drink with a group of close friends  I can't bring myself to drink around a large group of people with maybe only one good friend since I have diabetes  and have constant anxiety that the alcohol might effect my blood sugar dangerously  But with a group of friends I know I can trust I always drink enough that I get decently drunk  Personally for me whenever I drink everything is pretty great for the most part  I feel relaxed and happy and like dancing around  not a single worry on my mind  Once things calm down a bit I tend to get slightly depressed but it's nothing too bad  I've found however that I do obsess a lot on things I did or said when drunk  I'll dwell and dwell worrying that my actions have a reflection on my sober self  even though I could never imagine my sober self doing or saying half the things I do or say when I'm drunk  But it's hard to disconnect it  you know  When you're constantly uncertain about what you really want  sometimes getting drunk isn't the best thing

I was diagnosed with anxiety a couple of weeks ago  They have prescribed me Etizolam  Since the diagnosis  even before I had begun my medication  I used to feel extremely dizzy and nauseous  Once I started taking the medication  I have been getting random spells of dizziness  but it is much better  I usually try to pull myself to the reality during these spells by doing something that interests me  like browsing  reading  watching funny videos  music etc  But yes  I do believe that dizziness is related to anxiety and depression 
Wow thank you for posting this  I was totally ignorant of "atypical" depression and thought I just had heavy limbs because I am a worthless human being   It did not occur to me that it might be a symptom of my longstanding depression    So     No advice  but if you do find that MAOIs or any supplements help you  I hope you will post again   
Here's how I dropped a large part of my negative thinking  I looked at it as "reverse narcissism"   Why should all these bad things happen to me or my loved ones  but I don't think they're going to happen to other people  I found myself doing mental gymnastics to imagine horrendous torrents of events occuring to myself and I realized that I was singling myself out   for better or worse   by imagining that I was going to be the victim of these bad events  I was acting like I was the center of the universe  but for bad stuff    Look into the concepts of CBT and mindfulness  which is not so much an attempt to "think positive" as it is a method of eliminating regretting the past or being anxious of the future

Thanks
I still struggle with believing negative thoughts much more easily than positive ones  i still feel as though it's what I'm meant to do  I feel like I'm supposed to have a negative view of myself   But what helped me was thinking positive thoughts that were actually true or believable rather than something big  Grand positive thoughts made me feel worse  so thoughts like  I am beautiful  I am enough  I am going to be ok were just too big  Smaller thoughts or thoughts I knew to be true were better like  I have a safe place to sleep at night  I am fighting my anxiety depression  These thoughts didn't contradict my negative views so they were easier to introduce into my thought pattern  And then I was able to use this as a base to introduce more positive thoughts  bigger thoughts that really gave me a more positive outlook

 because apparently  they are very racist to foreigners in Iran    uh huh  no     In the 1990s  Iran sheltered a staggering 4 5 million exiles from Afghanistan and Iraq  the largest refugee caseload any single country has handled in modern times  The numbers have shrunk in the last few years to slightly more than two million people  but that figure is still twice as high as anywhere else  And because of the unsettled regional political and military situation  Teheran may have to continue to shoulder this burden for some time to come   The Afghans received heavily subsidized state food  health and education packages and many refugees  including women  found local employment    http   www unhcr org en us publications refugeemag 3b6814092 refugees magazine issue 108 afghanistan unending crisis iranian surprise html

Consider buying homeworkouts on DVD along with some adjustable dumbbells   The advantage of getting a DVD workout is that the onscreen instructor will tell you about good form   If what you want is strength training  since you mention bodybuilding  a few good DVD instruction workouts include  P90X or P90X3  these ones use a pull up bar in addition to dumbbells  Rushfit  martial arts combined with endurance strength training  Body Beast  more traditional bodybuilding I think  uses dumbbells and pull up bar and bench  And MOSSA  which is coming out on DVD soon   I know it because it used to be available on XBox  fun workouts for beginner or intermediate  some martial arts and some weights workouts   If you buy adjustable dumbbells  there are two types  standard size or Olympic size  It is important to make this decision first because the weight plates fit either one or the other size but not both  Olympic size has a higher weight limit and the handle is thicker  Find out highest limit  and decide based on that whether you will ever need Olympic or if standard is enough for you  If your long term goal is very heavy weight  then you could decide on Olympic from beginning   The plates can be reused for barbells in the future  but I read recommendation to start with dumbbells for 1 3 years before moving to barbell  Once you decide on size  you can buy a bunch of plates of different weights to gradually attach to your dumbbells    Start low weight  and increase very gradually  for example every 2 3 weeks increase by smallest possible amount     I recommend getting more than one set of handles for dumbbells so you can have two or three different sizes prepared for your workout and don't need to take time to switch plates during the workout  For some muscles you will be able to use heavier dumbbells than for others   An important thing to keep in mind  if you do strength training with weights  do not exercise same muscles two days in a row  Plan to let the muscle rest for 48 hours before working same muscle again  Either alternate lower body days and upper body days  or alternate strength and cardio workouts

30yo and have had feelings similar to what you describe for the past 15 years  Talking to anybody can help  If you're still in education there are services available that might be able to help  In my experience they weren't great but I took what I could from it and moved on  Don't force yourself through somebody else's process  find what works for you   I currently see a private therapist but I'm still deciding if it is going to work for me    Something that I have found helpful in the past is to try disconnecting for periods of time  Just a few hours a week  No distractions from tech or online or other people  Even music  Use the time to work on yourself or explore your thoughts and feelings on paper  It sounds lame and it can honestly be pretty terrifying but if it helps you to understand yourself more it will be worth it  Just remember that it is for you  Be cautious about sharing it

oh no  don't do that  have you tried other meds  I know cymbalata worked amazing for me  but my insurance no longer covers it for me unfortunately 
Trintellix   Mirtazapine would be a good antidepressant combination to antagonise 5 HT receptors known to have antidepressant effect  5 HT2A 2C 3 7  and Alpha 2 adrenergic receptors   The only downside with Mirtazapine is that it's a potent H 1 antagonist which causes drowsiness and sedation  Some say it subsides over time while others say it never truly goes away  It's also a weak mAChRs antagonist  670nM   It's claimed to have negligible anticholinergic effects but I'm skeptical since Abilify's mAChRs antagonism is in the 1000's but it's still considered to have  ACB Scale of 1  http   www agingbraincare org uploads products ACB scale   legal size pdf   So although Mirtazapine hasn't been tested  it could potentially have ACB scale of 2 which is concerning   Another downside with Trintellix   Mirtazapine is that it's missing the NRI part  Unless if Mirtazapine's Alpha 2 adrenergic antagonism can make up for that   While Nortriptyline has a nice pharmacologic profile  I feel like its mAChRs antagonism  40nM  is too potent for me to want to try it    So I'm currently leaning towards Trintellix   Mirtazapine or Reboxetine

Face my fears regularly  
I get this  too  It's one of those anxiety feedback loops  The stress of being very anxious causes those overwhelming emotions  which makes us more anxious     Try not to give weight to them  They may feel very real and genuine  but their cause is chemical  It's the hormonal stress response that is creating them   
As difficult as it is you need to stop analyzing it  It will drive you crazy  You are not an awful person for this  our minds spit out like 40 000 thoughts a day and every one of them is not going to represent you as a person  so disregard that thought as it is not evidence that you are awful  Your friend was not harmed touched  there is no harm done  try your best to stop thinking about it   
Okay mate  message me specific problems and I can help with them  and if I can't I'll get someone else to give me a hand  It's been a while since I programmed and I used another language so I'll get in touch with an IT friend for you  But  you need to set yourself some achievable targets right now  even if it's just a single page  You can't say  'today I will learn all the math ' because you won't achieve that and then you'll want to say fuck it to the rest of the studying  Making the targets small also helps with attitude  because even if you're feeling really down you can usually motivate yourself to do something if you know it's easy to achieve

This goes against everything   everything  a hotline would do   Call them back  and tell them what happened  This is not the way it should go  You also may want to read the  hotline FAQ  http   redd it 1c7ntr  from  r SuicideWatch  specifically        I called and it was a bad experience  I still need help  what do I do    Call back  and let the responder know what happened  Crisis intervention  especially if suicidality is a factor  is not easy  and not even the experts get it perfect every time  Personally  if I have a call go "south" on me  nothing makes me happier than to know that the person called back and had a better conversation with one of my colleagues    If you found yourself being rude or verbally abusive  apologize if you can  but either way try to hang in there with us  We understand that people in crisis struggle with self control  you don't need to be calm or businesslike but it really helps if you can show that you're trying your best to work with us    If you have a complaint about a hotline experience  please try to report it to the hotline administration    If you want to talk I'm here if you want  If you feel unsure about opening up to me you may want to look into my comment history to see if I'm 'OK'  You are not alone all right   hugs

I got my anxiety from the majority of people around me being negative and treating me like shit  Now I'm almost 22 and missed out on so much life experience I'll probably never recover
Are you registered as a student with a disability   My school had resources for people struggling  I was offered to write my exams in a private room with no time limits  I was able to easily defer exams if I was unwell with my mental health  and they just generally accommodated what students needed  They offered note takers too  if attending or paying attention in class was difficult   My anxiety was bad   I ended up deferring a few exams and wrote them the following week  It was nice being registered though  because if I ever needed more help  I knew it was there   You can do this  Just take it one day at a time   
I'm sorry that you experience it too  but at the same time  it feels nice to know that I'm not the only one  I don't quite get flashbacks  but deja vu is the closest word experience that I can think of  but I didn't remember the word til you wrote it     I do the distractions to try to drown it out  Sometimes it works  and sometimes it doesn't  I wish I could find something that worked at least 90  of the time  but even combining activities  I'll often chew gum  squeeze silly putty in my left hand  color in an adult coloring book with my right hand  and have a "light" show going on  sometimes isn't enough  I've been working on the breathing too   After I posted this last night  I searched on youtube for emetophobia  There was a video where a girl described her fears and how she got past them  She said 2 things that really stuck with me  1  getting sick and throwing up isn't something that just happens out of the blue  it's a defense mechanism that your body has to get rid of bad stuff  And 2  what's going to happen is going to happen regardless of if you're afraid or not 
I'm battling a nasty cold too  It stinks even though I cannot smell  I feel like a failure since I had to take a break to let myself heal   But I know it's not the end  Because I chose to let my body heal it will perform better more quickly than if I didn't  There are more days ahead and missing a few doesn't negate the days I did exercise in the past  I'll do a little routine today to get back on track    Happy New Year 
I can relate to this because its been so relevant for me this year  Im approaching the end of university and that means that the real  adult world is barreling at me  In terms of my social life my social anxiety disorder is the best that its ever been and things are looking up  However  I am now coming to the realization that social anxiety disorder is going to have a profound impact on my professional life      I have only had one ever job that doesnt have anything to do with my field of study  Ive never had a big people job  My resume is empty  I have no network contacts at all  I have a mentor but am too afraid to contact him and im worried that hes angry with me    It just really sucks when you figure out out how to manage social anxiety in one area of your life but also figure out that its out of control in another

What kind of jobs have you tried so far  Are there any kinds of jobs you know you wouldn't be able to do mentally or physically  And do you know what kind of boss worker customer groups you're looking to avoid or join specifically  These three questions can help form the base for your search if you want to begin looking for yourself  As for suggestions is a bit difficult without knowing you but here's 3 for funsies     "Movie theatre usher"   very easy most of the time  not much work for not much pay  but you won't have to deal with people outside easy directions inside a building or a hello     "Pizza delivery"   the biggest downside here is you need a car  after that the people you interact with will be hungry people  sometimes ass holes but you can't avoid that  relaxing in their own home and a few Co workers doing the same thing you are  Okay pay  and if you get tipped well you can make pretty good money     "Flight attendant"   you'd be dealing with a large group of people  a large portion of whom will likely be up their own ass  But the pay is solid and it gets you away from everything while you work  think mini vacations every trip you take   The hours are tough  but the possibility of fun and relaxation outside of literally being on the plane  are high     Hope I could help a little  any insight you would be willing to give might garner better advice

I emphasize with your struggles  I was going through a very stressful time in college this most recent semester  Last year I was prescribed Fluoxetine which worked fairly well for my depression except for the side effects including nightmares   headaches  tremors  jaw clenching  the occasional mania  which I kind of miss except for one serious incident where I felt way too good after finals    I was walking with my former girlfriend outside a giftshop that played Ohio State's marching band songs and tried doing a high kick like the drum major after she told me to and ended up kicking myself into the air  I landed on my arm   hyperextending and fracturing my left elbow and wrist on asphalt    yeah    that left me feeling like a grade A moron after an ambulance had to be called since I was in the worst pain of my life and couldn't stand up  She felt so guilty because she thought it was her fault since she told me to do it but I definitely wouldn't have made such a reckless high kick if I was on the mood stablizer I'm on now     etc  After about 7 months of enduring the side effects I had enough  so I switched to Zoloft which didn't work out for me  and then Wellbutrin which made my anxiety nearly impossible to manage on my own   After being prescribed three different medications by family doctors  I was told I had to see a psychiatrist  so I called the on campus psychiatric services asking for an outpatient appointment  The phone conversation went like this     Hello     Hi  I'd like to schedule an appointment     Sorrywe'refull  hangs up   I was stressed out enough before I called  After I heard the sound of a phone slamming down to hang up I involuntarily let out a torrential downpour of tears  People who are suffering from any mental illness are likely to struggle with getting help on their own  especially with depression  People  like me  who on some days have barely enough motivation to get out of bed but realize how much they're suffering and try to get help should not be treated this way  but unfortunately there's people out there who work mental health jobs who don't truly care   Don't let this stop you from seeking help from elsewhere  There are people out there who really do care and will help you

To me it feels similar to spacing out  but more physical  if that makes sense  When I "space out"  and am just not paying attention I still feel present  This feels different physically  I think what I've found that helps me over the last week or so is to be mindful of it and pull myself back  I can feel myself sort of drifting away and have to really be aware of it lately  I hope this passes for both of us  I've been getting into meditation and yoga and it helps me with mindfulness  which seems to help this weird feeling happen less and less  
Yes  they will  It's a coping mechanism  It will help you to deal with the thoughts better  I don't want you to be afraid of what I am about to tell you  but the thoughts may never go away  Don't think that you are beyond help or dealing with it  however  There are people that have completely gotten over their thoughts  and bless them for it    What mindfulness will help you do is  instead of reacting in such an intense way to the thoughts  anxiety  depression  etc    it will lessen the pain around it  It's a way that teaches you not to resist the thoughts  as much as you want to  and just learn to let them go   It's more of a meditation thing  and like I said  it's really helped me  The Mindfulness Workbook for OCD is a good resource  There are some out there that focus more on the spiritual aspect of it  zen  buddhism  etc    but I find that this workbook really gets to the heart of it for people suffering from OCD  And if you're iffy about spiritualism or religion  don't worry  this workbook doesn't cover anything related to that    Dr  Jon Hirshfeld is the one who wrote it  and he works through the OCD Center in LA and Baltimore 
Can you write down what goes through your mind  Maybe it will sort it a bit  If i have those   im loosing my mind" feelings  i turn my headphones up and listen to music super loud  that helps   try   iridescent" from linkin park  and tell me how you like it   Hope you are feeling better soon

I am so sorry  That is awful  It feels like a omen  a sign and a portent  It's not  I promise  Counselors and people who field calls are people  and as with people in any profession  some  perhaps most  of them will not operate at the level they should be operating at   It's frustrating when the mental health system often only gets one or a few shots at offering help and giving you hope  and the person you interface with doesn't have the capacity to offer anything constructive and does more harm than good   Happened to me in a different setting  when I hit rock bottom and knew I needed help  I went to see a therapist and he spent an entire session making fun of me and cracking jokes about my situation  It was gut wrenching  I still feel sick thinking about those sessions  This guy was well respected and credentialed  I was a person hanging on by a thread who desperately needed help and because of his ignorance I went another 6 months not seeing any professional whatsoever  I wouldn't have found my way back at all without support people who basically forced me to because they assumed  quite correctly  it's what I would've wanted if I were thinking clearly    I found a better therapist who's actually good at her damn job and things have gotten better  I'm not telling you this as a "go get 'em  champ" sort of thing  Sometimes the system is so prohibitively ineffective that people go years without finding someone who can actually give the help they need    The point is  the failures of the system do not reflect you or your condition  Don't believe anyone who suggests that anything less than complete support and validation from a professional means your situation is not serious  It is  You wouldn't be seeking help and posting on here if it wasn't  The likelihood that the person you've communicated with is kind of shitty at what they do is far greater than your problems being trivial and unimportant   Thank you for taking the step to share your experience here  I'm sorry everything has to be so hard right now

I can completely relate my health anxiety always consists of either throat or lung cancer issues  The only good thing to come out of it was it helped me to quit smoking but I still struggle daily  I'm even at the point some days of feeling even more anxious if I actually feel fine  
There are high points and pitfalls when it comes to recovery  It takes a long fucking time  I'm still not even there yet  I was told that things aren't always going to be good  and that's okay  there will be bad days  I'm glad I was told honestly because that makes the really shitty days a bit easier to get through  knowing that it will happen and to not freak out when you aren't happy 100  of the time   It's not good to say 'everything will be fine'   You are still going to feel pain  but you will also feel happy at times as well  It's not easy  but people should be told like I was  that it isn't always going to be good  You have to feel bad to feel good   it sucks  but it's how we are  depression just makes pain a hell of a lot worse 
Upvote for being honest about your situation  It's a tricky one for sure  but I don't know how to phrase my advice any other way than "if you love her  let her go"  Cut all contact from her if possible  At some point it's no longer love  and becomes a burden for both parties involved    As someone who has been on the receiving end of "obsessive love" with no intention of ever reciprocating it  it can be a dreadful and heavy burden  In my case  we started off as friends  but he became possessive and jealous over the smallest things even though he had no right to be  This obviously put a massive strain on our friendship  and I cut him out of my life because of all the anxiety I would get from being around him  It was suffocating  I miss the friendship a lot  but don't regret my decision    Hope this gives you a bit of perspective of the other side  so that maybe you can find closure for yourself too  
There are so many lonely people here  Why can't we be friends    For me it's because I fear that I lost my ability to "connect" to people  no matter how nice and well meaning they are  That I have nothing to contribute and just bore others  That they 'find out' about me   Recently there was a  "looking for friends" thread  https   www reddit com r depression comments 5ko0li anyone hear want to be friends   in this sub  But I can't really participate in that  
Please don't think your 'genes' make you not a good person  You're defined by things you do  things you think  and things you like  And please don't think people don't like you because of your appearance  Even if some people are actually like that  that's because THEY are pieces of shit  And you don't have to be good at study and sports  Those two are not the only gifts people could have  You have so much more possibilities  please don't give up yet  It's never too late 
23 year old here  I have support groups in my area  but none of the times offered work for my schedule  So I do the online DBSA young adult support groups  I recommend it  The groups are informative and it's nice to be able to talk to the same people every week  Online friends are definitely different from in person friends  but I'm assuming you're wanting someone to confide in and provide support for your condition  which is what everyone in the support group does

Yes  Suicidal thoughts are a feeling  They sit in a cloud that constantly shrouds over you  Even when you're happy and laughing  the thought and feeling of suicide is still there  it never completely fades  It may not feel as strong on a scale  it may be lower  but it's still there  No matter where I am or what I'm doing the thought and feeling of suicide is always present somewhere in my mind   even if I'm not trying to think about it  the cloud remains  The feeling never passes

This is pretty much what hasn't allowed me to escape the HA cycle of hell   I always seem to wake up with some kind of pain discomfort each morning  It can be my knee  I bumped it really hard back in October  or most usually throughout the day it is sternum rib neck spine pain  And very few things seem to take my mind off it  walking exercise helps sometimes and well getting drunk  but I've decided to lay of the booze cuz it isn't exactly the best coping mechanism    The thing is that getting pains troughout the day is normal for most people  I think that we are just hypersensitive to it  Talked to my mum today  she has chronic back pain  a pinched nerve which causes her not to feel one of her toes and even chest tightness and an upset stomach  this is purely psychological as she got some bad news recently   But she wakes up and goes about her day as usual and doesn't even complain about it  Aunt and cousin also have chronic back pain from sitting at a desk carrying a heavy child 
Seems overwhelming but things will be A OK  IMO buspar is a sugar pill more than anything  Prozac is far more superior than buspar  What dose were you on when you tried Prozac   The starter dose is 20mg  I remember i started at 5mg and moved up 5mg every week and it curved any side effects I was having  Maybe try that

I've come to realize like any medication  moderation is key right  But its days like today i pulled up to work to find out the shop was closed   GREAT i get the day off   but not so great cuz I'll probably just smoke my face off even though i know I'll regret it  Now I'll probably pace my home for a couple hours trying to convince myself to do the hundred other things i need to get done which leads to realizing the time  money  and energy its gonna take which leads to feeling hopeless and depressed and plotting a clean easy fail safe suicide   I don't suggest smoking when unemployed especially just to pass already idle time  I've always made it a point not to when in your situation   I think we all know in the back of our mind when we're abusing a substance dont let the self destructive thoughts overcome   also ANY work is better than none even if has nothing to do with your career   i had a lot of fun stocking shelves nights   Anyway i hope something in there helps  Also there was a list of movies on front page about "loners" for better of a word   I ended up watching one called NAKED  1993  its on KODI if you have it   strange yes but has really interesting dialog

I can't offer much help for people with depression as someone who suffers from it everyday  I just think its important to reach out to other people and see you are not alone in how you feel  Depression makes you feel isolated and insecure and so I look at various support sites for people with depression as a way to cope and connect with people like myself

I was worried about the same thing two weeks ago  so much so that I felt an ER visit was worth it  I've had Bradycardia my whole life  so I thought that was the end  Turns out I have Sinus Node Arrhythmia  You're breathing speeds up and slows down when you inhale and exhale  It's very common  like I can't even explain in words how common this is  If your really concerned talk to your GP  Odds are you're gonna be fine  Most people have some form of irregularity  and most people never notice  Hope this helps

If you suffer from anxiety panic mystery chest pain is most likely due to hyperventilation  Chest pain and anxiety go hand in hand with each other  If it is anxiety panic related  it's more of a scary feeling than it being actually dangerous  If you feel a need to visit an ER then you should never second guess it but  if you're prone to anxiety panic   I'm willing to bet that's the cause of it

A nice short term solution and a terrible one longterm  I got really drunk on New Year's and then felt even worse the next day   I was asking myself the same question as the OP or a similar one  My current problem is more of a having trouble stopping focusing on physical aches and pains and discomfort  I am seeing a therapist in a few weeks  but would like to be better by then  I have already lost 3 months of my life to this and I want to stop feeling miserable   I don't have the answers  but I am going to try with the following   1  No googling researching symptom checking 2  Moving more   I try to get at least an hour of walking each day and want to get back into swimming and start with Pilates which might in turn improve my issues with back pain that played a huge part in setting oc my HA  though who knows what came first by this point  3  Spend more times with tasks that require full attention   lrarning languages  reading as well as performing household chores 4  Spending more time with people   friends and family  even if it is hard not to concentrate on this hellish HA when with then right now  it's bound to get better 5  The last but probably the most important one  I will try to accept that I will not get better overnight and won't just suddenly wake up feeling better next morning as if the last 3 months didn't happen  It requires work  Sucks that I have no patience in this regard 
Heating pads are designed to handle heat  slim to zero chance it'll actually melt   unless you don't follow directions on how to use it  I use heat pads all the time for my neck when I'm under heavy loads of anxiety  If anything it works wonders 
It hard to save someone online  People with depression need real support as well as the motivation to get better to make changes in their lives  I see depression as a response to how one is feeling in their environment as for me I get really depressed when my social anxiety kicks in and I am not able to do things the way I want to  Making changes is hard and frustrating and oftentimes requires to leave someone or something behind

Negative thought patterns are my biggest concern  I think about my illness 24 7  And I believe my mind is atrophied because of this unproductive thinking  My job is pizza delivery which unfortunately lets my mind wander and ruminate on stressors  I think the mind is like a muscle and we have to exercise its capabilities such as memory and problem solving  Its not enough to distract it with music or chores or tv  you need to push your brain into higher levels of thinking  Read a book  solve math problems  draw  play a video game  play sudoku  fix things  socialize     just do something that requires interaction and imagination  I think these activities promote healthy idle thought patterns

I am sorry for your loss  It must be difficult but remember just because you are diagnosed bipolar does not mean that is why you are struggling  Depression sadness is normal when grieving from the loss of a family member  The blankness you feel could be the sadness you feel from losing someone   The best thing you can do is rely on your support system around you like your mom  Talk talk and talk more  The more you get it out the more you will see you do have people around you who care    Also feel free to continue to post up here as much as you want  There are some great people in these groups who love to listen and provide support and share their own stories and how they have gotten through them

For what it's worth  I'm 27 and I'm still afraid of growing up  Everyone you meet is just a kid trying to figure out what the hell happened    I understand though  College allows you to maintain some of the patterns you follow in highschool  you follow a routine that is largely set by others  You have mentors and teachers  You have peers you see everyday  Then one day it abruptly ends and you immediately lose that structure and support  I think some people wind up in grad school purely because they don't know what else to do   A word of advice  drop the guilt about living with your parents for the time being  It's rooted in old fashioned and antiquated ideas that aren't going to be of much use to you  I have a reasonably high paying job now and live on my own  I never would have been able to accomplish what I have without my parents acting as a springboard from time to time   I have a close friend who has lived in a trailer on his parent's property for the last six years or so  Sounds like a real loser right   That's SIX YEARS of rent he's avoided paying with the blessing of his family  He and his girlfriend are going to buy  a house of their own within the next year  He got there by being pragmatic and not caring about what strangers might think of his living situation   As long as you have a goal you shouldn't let it bother you    Have you given any thought about your next goal 
Psychosis is a legitimate fear  It happened with my first baby  and worse  I never got it diagnosed  I told everyone I was just a little depressed  So they put me on antidepressants  which just made everything worse  I did eventually get things fixed  but I'll be honest  it took a couple of years to get back to normal    My advice is that you have a comprehensive psych plan before birth  with support people who know when you aren't functional  Also  and this is entirely anecdotal  placenta encapsulation was amazing for me the second time  and I plan to do it again with this baby

Oh yeah stomach issues heartburn  GERD etc can def cause "chest pain" when in fact is not chest but stomach pain  If the pain is around the heart area towards the bottom of the rib cage  Try some ginger root tea or anti acid like tums and see if that works  I sometimes drink carbonated mineral water with salt and lime  helps settle my stomach down almost instantly  Stomach issues and anxiety go hand in hand as well  the stomach is like a second brain in a way

I personally don't think it's worth opening up the wound for you or him  If you did hurt him  he probably has gotten over it by now  Your apology might not mean anything to him and it may be painful for you to have to admit the wrong you've done to him  but if it makes you feel better and settles your mind  then go for it  I definitely understand the desire to clear the air  
Exchanges like "How are you " "I'm fine  thanks  And you " are just polite talk  which just means it's a social norm established to set another  test  if you will  of your inclusion in the community  You have to know to say the question  and you have to know how to answer  and the exchange tells both of you that you are both part of the same social community via completing these "formalities"   Since it doesn't really mean anything  we spend most of our lives spitting and repeating just as a greeting  not as a real inquiry    But then when someone asks "How are you " and you are NOT fine  the inquiry just draws attention to that fact  Suddenly you are re aware of whatever it is that is making you not fine  and aware that  socially  it's not acceptable to be not fine    I think that's why if feels so bad to tell even that little lie  "How are you " is a matter of inclusion  and when you're not doing so well  you realize how alienated you are

Love is one of the best experiences you can feel  and heart break is the worst experience you can feel  I  know that feeling you get inside your stomach and you just feel sick  you dont want to eat  your mind is continuously clouded with thoughts and scenarios and what if this  what if that    Im gonna be blunt and sorry if this comes out wrong  but stressing out and worrying will not change the outcome  Change is an inevitable part of life and sometimes it happens for better and for worst  It sounds like your other half is saying reacting to you in a negative tone which is what would spark the feelings you are expressing  and i am sorry to hear that       At the end of the day communication is key with your other half  give her some space   maybe everything is a bit overwhelming for her over there  she's still trying to find her groove  in the mean time focus on yourself   take each day at a time and pat yourself on the back for doing so   From my experience things like this just eat me up and i can't withstand them for to long  If i can start to feel what i have been fearing I will just be straight up with the person and really ask how they are feeling towards me  you might hear some things you might not like but it's the harsh reality of life  The quicker you hear these things  the quicker you can start rebuilding yourself and putting the pieces back together  It wont be easy Im sorry to say  but this is just another test in life  Think of all the hurdles that have been presented to you thus far in life  you got through them didn't you  I wish you the best and please stay strong  life really does go on for better or for worst just focus on one thing at a time  Sending you lots of love and hugs xoxo
It depends on the hotline  not the state  All you have to do to comply with that law is say "this line is may be recorded for training and quality assurance purposes " Most companies say that anyway  regardless if the state is one or two party consent  
I'm not one to judge  I have free services through my university  I told myself for the longest time I never used them because it would take too much time  an excuse  until my legs trembled the day I decided to head over  I walked somewhere else instead  That I physically couldn't  isn't  an excuse  It's apart of the problem  but not an excuse  It's simply where I'm at   So  I don't use all my resources because I'm afraid  and with reinforcing experiences like this  I don't know how much more scared I would be  I still go to a university club  So  what do you do to try to feel better  Since it sounds like you've tried and dismissed a lot of things  you've probably learned the hard way that building on what you have is pretty much the only way to go    It is impossibly hard when for illnesses like this there's people you're allowed to open up to  and people who can't handle it  It's hard because  literally everybody  tells you to open up  but for different reasons  For some people  it's because they don't want you talking to them anymore  and think opening up to somebody else solves from problem  For some people  like those at the hotline  and they have to sign off on not having depression before working there  they want you to open up to help with the depression  In most cases  this works  In some it doesn't  There's also people who want you to open up because they know that not being allowed to  being to afraid of being vulnerable  is part of the problem  Those are the people who want to help you  depression or not  and don't expect everything to be solved at a snap  I'm pretty sure that that's everybody on this corner of the internet  But  we  all of us here  are people living somewhere  I'm sure that if you continue to be vulnerable  and that's really what opening up  opening up a vulnerability  you'll find a flesh and blood person that wants to help  you

I know that feeling very well  although in a completely different context  I was bullied by two of my so called 'friends'  And then  the next time I opened up again two years later I got bullied again  You feel stuck  Alone  Worthless  and don't think that you are 'worth it' you know  At a certain point the stress levels got so high that I was having coma fantasies  and was wondering if with the 'correct' dose of toxin I could put myself into one    Now  I fortunately have made some very good friends  and I can even feel positive about myself once in a while  although it still requires some effort   Getting kicked down by professionals  other volunteers at the suicide hotline sucks  The first time I got bullied the school and  my parents set me up with counseling  but I didn't dare open up and didn't accept my suffering yet  As a result and I suspect that the inexperience of the counselor didn't help either  my counselor didn't take me very seriously   Now I've had one session of CBT  and nearly had a combination of a panic attack  emotional meltdown and mental breakdown  And CBT is pretty light as far as therapy goes    but I am improving  I have found a better support group  some good friends  and a psychologist who is really helping me   Sometimes you'll have shit luck at professionals  That sucks  and shouldn't happen  Unfortunately  we don't live in a perfect universe  The fact this subreddit even exists is the proof of that   But there are professionals out there that are worth looking for  Hotlines where there have been few horror stories from  And people whom you can trust

Hey there brother sister   Do not be hesitant to tell your parents  they have been with you since day 1  they have seen everything you have done in life and they will want to give you all the help and love that you need    Those are 2 things that effect those who are severely depressed   affection   and communication  If both of my parents were still alive I wish i could tell them everything from my fears to my accomplishments but i can't and thats why I am so fucked up   Plus my brother committed suicide in novemeber   youre so lucky that you still have your parents  they are there for you no mater what  you will be suprised what they might have to say towards you  Feeling depressed is no joke  once it grips you in its teeth and rips you apart and beats you down where you start to feel so small and insignificant you would have wished you took any chance to tell anyone close to you how you truely felt instead of bottling it all up because thats how i have lived my whole life and i fucken regret not saying shit when i should have    sending you lots of hugs and love xoxo

That sounds like an amazing center  but your basing off all centers from your experience  There are a lot of centers that are run like a low end job  And there are a lot of "volunteers" that are only there to get something for themselves  whether that be a nice addition to a resume or to help lessen some punishment  And yes  there is training  but it can only help so far  It's really the person that has to be right for the job  and they aren't too many times  
It is completely normal to imagine that there is someone there or to even hallucinate because during sleep paralysis your brain and body are not on the same page  which is why you suddenly feel panicked  Your brain actually releases chemicals to paralyze you while you sleep and when you wake up before that wears off is where that kind of night terror comes from  Although they are connected  PTSD and sleep paralysis   they can be worked through separately  I still struggle with nightmares from time to time  I have friends who also have PTSD and they do as well  but believe me when I say that it does go away slowly and YOU ARE NOT ALONE  Kay   Here are a few things that help me   1  Sensory pillows are a fucking lifesaver  Please please please buy one  The soft light when you need it right after a nightmare is so helpful  calming  and makes it just a little easier to go back to sleep   2  This is something I had to work on and it may sound weird  but videogames  They help significantly because it in a way is a sense of false reality  but you can alter it the gameplay itself  easier than you can in real life  obviously   This has been proven to give you more control during the actual nightmare itself by either being able to wake yourself easier or even completely change the dream at your will   3  Christmas lights  Me and all of my friends who also struggle have Christmas lights in our room  Sitting in a lower light environment before the actual darkness of sleep helps you to relax better before you drift off to sleep as well as set a calm and safe mood for if sleep didn't come so peacefully    Sorry I know I just wrote you a whole fucking book  but I hope it was at least helpful in some way  I am 25 now and have had PTSD since I was a child  It's fucking hard  I know  I really do  But don't give up  please  The world needs strong people and if you are able to get through whatever traumatized you in the first place  that must mean you're already strong  Reach out when you need it and remember that life goes both ways  I hope you have a happy life    Nathaniel
Thank you for sharing   I'm in a similar dilemma  as revealing my true persona to other people led to mixed results  I've had friends distance themselves from me when I confessed my depression  For those I haven't told  I remain the 1 dimensional persons that goes gloomy and disappears every now and then   People who truly cared for me before opening up continued to care for me  However  if they are empathetic enough  their new perspective on my motivations and the way I experience things helped them give me more relevant advice  On the flip side  opening up to "normal" people and listening to their response also gave me more points to consider  and sometimes showed me a path where I thought only dead ends exist   It sounds like your husband is truly committed to being there for you  I can assure you it would have been more frustrating for him to see you like that without understanding why  The person he loves and married is still there  even if hidden behind a terrible veil  I sincerely hope you can work it out   Finally  dealing with these crises with other people is not pointless   it can enrich their lives  emotionally  It will give them perspective and a deep basis when they have to deal with similar things on their own  and no "normal" person goes through life without that   They would also have someone to lean on when the time comes    "Bear and endure  This sorrow will one day prove to be for your good "  
Do you feel there are not enough jobs to choose from or that there are too many  Do you want anything other than pay from your job  Have you thought about volunteer work  I find asking the right questions and throwing out your first thoughts help to form a flexible and achievable goal  It can be exhausting  constantly trying to find the right answers but when you feel like you and your time is worthless it's not like you're wasting it    if you want any more advice or if you just want to talk please feel free to PM me though I'm bad at replying right away I promise I'll respond as soon as I see it  Have a wonderful day if you can  and remember that although the moon doesn't produce it's own light  it is still beautiful and important

Hi there     I can relate to this too   First of all i fucken love watching twitch streams in bed I watch league of legends what about you       have been doing this for the past 5 years now at first it started off positive no negative vibes  but now its what i do to deal with the pain of being awake or dealing with the anxiety of not being able to leave my house and walk out the front door or untill i can doze off at some ridiculous hour    It sounds like to me that you are experiencing depression  this can be caused by a number of things but you will have a better idea of what then me  I will start by saying that there are a number of small things that you can do to further help yourself one step at a time   First of all you need to stop eating shit food  i know its easy and tasty but cut it out it's not gonna help you on your road to recovery  thats fine if you can only eat a small amount but PLEASE make it real food like fruit or vegetables  nothing too carby   Second of all is to do some sort of exercise  I know your situation and its fucken hard believe me Ive been experiencing this for years now and no one is gonna help you   if you cant help yourself  All you have to do is go for a 10 15 minute walk  let your thoughts run through your mind  you need to strengthen your muscles retrain them to where they once were at  even if you come back and you feel tired thats fine  take a nap you will feel better mentally for going out   trust me  I even found hill running to cure alot of my depression   i would sit at work googling running techniques  "how running cured my depression" and it's amazing  but ill stop ranting about that    third thing is to start doing some strecthing  just youtube yoga lower body back pain  something like that you will find you are getting pain in your legs because the muscles are becoming weak and they are picking up extra slack  an imbalance in the body in other words  a foam roller has saved me for many years of just lying in bed for most days  and doing yoga   24 year old male    Now whatever you are thinking about your life  it is not bad at all  this is the part of the process were you can prevent alot of negative things happening as long as you are pro active in noticing these changes and dealing with them one step at a time  Both my parents passed away at a young age  my brother committed suicide in novemeber and turned my world upside down  I have been mostly a pot head since i was 14 am 24 now  it's better to get help while you can and please take my advice seriously because all i can say is when i was your age and i was starting to feel symptoms like this  it is no where near as bad as what i am feeling on a daily basis now  my god if i could turn back the time to experience the 19 y o me depression trust me i would  but I am not giving up  i am striving to feel that pleasure from daily life that I once felt a long time ago  you are loved by more people then you can think  please get help  do not be afraid to say your thoughts  but remember this you will benefit from natural ways of healing then taking meds believe me  my aunty is a pharmacist and i flew to asia from New Zealand to get Valium to deal with my head after my brothers passing   hope this helps   Lots of love xoxoxoxo

For the last couple of weeks I've been waking up in the wee hours of the morning anxious and panicky about various things  and then can't get back to sleep because I can't break the cycle of negative thoughts  The last couple of nights I've been listening to ambient nature sounds while I sleep  and it's been helping quite a bit  When I wake up anxious  it gives me something concrete but unobtrusive to focus on instead of the anxious  negative thoughts and really helps with calming me down and letting fall back asleep again   It's not perfect  I still eventually wake up and can't get back to sleep because of anxiety  but I've been hitting that point maybe an hour hour and a half before my alarm goes off instead of four hours before  so it is progress  It also doesn't seem to help as much during the day when my mind starts to wander in that direction  but by then I'm usually in a better position to find something distracting like TV  video games  reading  podcasts  etc   Another option is the podcast Sleep With Me  which is basically just a guy reading a boring story to help you fall asleep  It's geared more toward insomniacs  but I think it could serve the same purpose of providing something to focus on instead of the negative thoughts 
Hm    I believe I may just be spacing out a lot  Even still  I hope we both find ways to stay present  Meditation has really been a huge help through all of this  My physical symptoms have definitely abaded since I began meditating every day

Hey there  Ontarian here   It took me a good three years of trying to get on disability before I got it     But I was only in my twenties at the time of application so that could be a factor  I was also required to inquire if CPP can pay out any monies  If they can the disability rate will be adjusted   I didn't get it until it was almost too late  After losing my work  the chronic pain from car accidents  losing my vehicle to said accident  state of my relationship  I attempted suicide and ended up in the psych ward for a month  During that month in the hospital the doctors filled out all the forms for me and it was accepted within a week of being sent in  WTF  that perplexed the fuck out of me and kinda made me angry  Docs told me why  my psychiatrist at the time didn't want to give me a diagnosis of a mood disorder  but they had no problem diagnosing me with BP1   Anyways  my suggestion is if your wife needs to fill out her portion to explain what she deals with on the daily  she either leaves it blank  or writes out her very worst days  Hopefully her doc will do the same on their report   Like another poster suggested  a lawyer or advocacy group can also be helpful   Good luck to you both

We are two different people  Living in two different places  Thinking very different things  What worked for me  may not work for you      Think about the last thing you did that wasn't "the you that you want to be"  Really think about why you did it  what lead up to it  what was going through your head while it happened and then what you felt afterward  Next time you feel upset by someone  and you feel you need to do something in response that isn't "the you that you want to be" take a moment to make an active choice  will you conform to the past  or change your future right now  If changing your future doesn't sound like the best option then you don't want to change and you should accept that and mold your life to adapt to you  If you can make that change though  then it will be easier the next time  and the next  till one day you find out you are the person you want to be by habit  After that it's only speculation but I think you would be much more content in this world if you could honestly tell people that you like who you are and that others like you  Will you think about doing awful things to the ass holes that infest the surface of our planet  Yes  We all do  But if you can shake that person's hand and have even the worst of people think you're good company  you'll always be the better person

There's being supportive and then there's being judgmental   People here offer feedback   The point behind it is to support each other   I've seen many posts along the lines of "this helped me   Have you tried    "   One of the issues many of us face is feeling isolated and alone in depression   Even having someone else share their experiences can help

for the average person and ill smash these bad boys in 3 months usually    I know everytime I take these it is taking a part of me that i will never get back  but I must make that sacrifice so that i hill running to cure alot of my depression   i would sit at work googling running techniques  "how running cured my depression" and it's amazing  but ill stop ranting about that    third thing is to start doing some strecthing  just youtube yoga lower body back pain  something like that you will find you are getting pain in your legs because the muscles are becoming weak and they are picking up extra slack  an imbalance in the body in other words  a foam roller has saved me for many years of just lying in bed for most days  and doing yoga   24 year old male    Now whatever you are thinking about your life  it is not bad at all  this is the part of the process were you can prevent alot of negative things happening as long as you are pro active in noticing these changes and dealing with If ovarian or cervical cancer runs in your family you can request a transvaginal ultrasound which would show immediately if there were any suspected problems  This in conjunction with a Pap smear will help rule out any cancers    You should be having regular exams and Pap smears to make sure everything is functioning as expected  this would help to lessen anxiety    These types of cancers run in my family so I have to have that ultrasound regularly  It's not fun but helps to immediately rule out some things    Hope this helps some

I would ask him why the hesitancy to change the formal diagnosis   If you are being treated with Bipolar meds and they are effective  then ergo you are Bipolar right   As far as I know  you don't treat depression and GAD with lamictal   It is possible he doesn't want to change it from depression and GAD to Bipolar until he can narrow down where on the spectrum you are  I  II  NOS  cyclothymic     In the end though you are right in that it matters less what "label" he gives you and more that the treatment is effective

Greetings  It sounds like this was a difficult thing for you to write but I think it's really good you're opening up and discussing it  I have a lot of sympathy for folks whose parents had these issues  as my mother  too  had a bit of a hoarding problem  It wasn't quite as bad as some of the extreme cases you see on tv  and it sounds like it wasn't as bad as you're currently experiencing  but even that was quite hard to live with  So I can empathize  and I know how frustrating it is to have to live in clutter when you're a naturally tidy person  I find it literally jams up my thinking   like  I find it harder to concentrate in a messy room with too much visually going on  It can be a real pain in the ass   I think it's important to say two particular things  1  Hoarding  strictly  this problem is usually classified as Hoarding Disorder rather than OCD  though the two are closely linked  is a curable and fixable disorder    2    but not by 'reasoning' or 'logic' ing your mother out of it  If that makes any sense   The problem with stuff like hoarding  or any other addiction  obsession or phobia  is that it's not really caused by having the wrong rational thoughts as such  People don't ACTUALLY believe that losing all their money on a gambling addiction  filling the entire house up with garbage  washing their hands fifty times or running away screaming from a harmless spider are logically clever ideas  Folks with these problems aren't delusional  I'm sure your mother isn't either  However  there's something going in with the more subconscious parts of the brain  the bits that deal with primitive fears and raw emotions  that's skewing someone's perception to make them end up in these situations  And often their brains are literally wired differently or temporarily slightly damaged   this article explaining how hoarder's brains are actually different to regular folks' in brain scans  might be useful to you    https   blogs scientificamerican com observations scans of hoarders brains reveal why they never de clutter      But the problem IS fixable  with proper therapy and support  Your mother isn't stuck like this  Brains are very changeable  if you do the right therapy  and you can learn to think and feel differently  at any age     It would really be a good idea to sit your mother down and tell her that you think a doctor or therapist could help her to feel better about her possessions  and try to get her to see one  It can be tough with hoarders  because they're in one of the categories of disorders where they often don't think they have a problem  But she sounds like a really caring person  hoarding disorder sufferers often are  and if you made it clear to her that it would really mean a lot to you if she could try and learn some techniques to deal with her possessions differently    It's probably best not to frame it as an organization problem  one that just needs a forcible decluttering and a big investment in new storage units  because that's probably not the heart of the problem  Like  the problem is psychological  There will be some underlying reason why she feels the need to cut everything into little pieces before it goes and why to her  it feels scary and distressing to throw away an object  Her feelings are very real  so I guess even though I understand it's a pain in the ass  t least you know it's not something she's doing to you deliberately  you know   There's some info you might find handy on the HoardingUK site   http   hoardinguk org   Or the Help for Hoarders charity association  who can help you find support and therapy for your mother  plus it's got dedicated hoarding forums so you can talk to other people in your situation  so at least you won't feel too alone   http   www helpforhoarders co uk    The charity OCD  UK can also help you with hoarding problems  since it's such a closely related disorder to OCD  if those other two don't turn out useful  http   www ocduk org hoarding    I wish you all the best in getting your relative some help with this  Grit your teeth and hang in there  and see if you can convince her to get some support for this mental health difficulty  Hopefully she can feel better and not let clutter get in the way of her life again     
The ones I tried all bored me after a while  but I'll definitely give the ones you suggested a try   Maybe they're better

Honestly  despite having never tried medication  I have zero faith in it as far as healing my issues goes  and what you wrote above exemplifies one of the reasons why  The only advice I have for you is to get your emotions under control on your own  I have a tendency to lash out at others and regret it later too  I find meditating at least two times a day for 15  minutes useful because it helps you stay mindful of your state of being and your surroundings in the face of depression  Once you're mindful you can work on externalizing your issues in healthy ways when necessary  talking through negative emotions  if you want to find it necessary   instead if unhealthy ways like cathartically lashing out at people  Just want you to know I care and that this won't be easy

That is fair  I agree that there are potential long term risks to really any meds  but especially anti psychotics of any type  The earlier you catch them  the less likely they are to be permanent  but the risks exist and it isn't fair to pretend that they don't   I would also agree that some side effects can make your quality of life so miserable that the benefit to mood or psych symptoms isn't worth it  The problem is  since side effects and benefit is so specific to each individual  it's impossible to know ahead of time what that balance will be for someone    I will be honest  In my case  the side effect profile of clozaril was not worth the benefit  I was taking it for bipolar disorder that literally does not respond to any medication that I have tried  My moods shift  while not frequently  they do and the depths of the depressions in particular become dangerous at times  The idea was the clozaril may prevent that  The side effects made my qualify of life suck which made me depressed anyway and it was another drug that didn't work    Since every drug I've tried either sends me to the ER  gets me admitted into the medical hospital due to horrific side effects  or simply does nothing  I really don't feel like I'm a good example of any experience with any drug   That being said  someone else who experiences symptoms of outright psychosis might have had the exact side effects I had and made the decision that they were worth the trade off  That person could decide that not having psychosis is better than the other things  For me depression was not enough  Especially depression that wasn't relenting anyway    It's all about where you are at  what things you value  what your personal tolerances are  etc   Some people can handle a lot of side effects if their mood levels out  Others want nothing to do with side effects at all and would rather be all over the place than have physical consequences of anything  It is a very personal decision   Edit  on mobile and trying to fix typos  Forgive the ones I missed
