I get these sensations every so often    always freaks me out  I've learned to monitor the twinge pain if it persists  but after occupying my mind I'm usually symptom free    I read a great analogy once    our bodies are like really intricate machines  like cars or computers  Just like our bodies  these machines can overheat  rumble  or slow down a little bit from time to time for seemingly no reason at all  This doesn't indicate they're broken  dying  or wrong  rather these things just happen simply 'cause    Our bodies are intricate  strong  and very capable   it will definitely warn you of anything to be worried about  Keep an eye on things and keep yourself busy  I'm sure you'll feel these types of things more and more throughout your healthy life  so don't stress

I have the same thing  I got a really bad virus  my entire family did  so we couldn't help each other  I threw up like 15 times throughout the night and dry heaving  It was absolutely horrible  It's been about a year since then and I understand how you feel    When I think about these moments  and when they replay in my head this is what I do  I inhale  and while inhaling I focus on the bad thought and imagine it being tied up in a bag  As I exhale  I imagine it flying into a garbage can  then taped shut and then set on fire  It's magic because it really stops me from thinking about it  Lol  You should try something like this
When I first started driving I was super confident because we started on really quiet roads  I could already drive before I took lessons and felt like I was king of the world  The second I had to start learning manoeuvres and facing traffic was when I became like you  Scared of causing an accident or holding people up    Surprisingly people are actually really considerate towards learners when they are with instructors  drivers will usually give you plenty of room  As for dealing with the anxiety side of it  I used to ask the instructor if I could have the radio on for a little background noise and distraction  It helped massively  If you are 100  focused on the driving you will be more nervous and make more mistakes  Sounds stupid but that's exactly what I experienced  You need about 2  of your mind focusing on something else to keep you calm  in my case it was the radio  hope this kinda helped

 removed 
The thing is that I can open up and be comfortable around people  but it takes some time  Honestly  I'd say this a cultural problem   We're expected to be super open and talkative to complete strangers  but in many other cultures  like in most of Europe  people generally don't talk to strangers and aren't open with people until they get to know them  But if you get to know them over time and gain trust  you'll have made a friend for life   It's actually a real cultural phenomenon  Called the peach vs coconut   https   hbr org 2014 05 one reason cross cultural small talk is so tricky  Peach cultures  Very friendly and open on the surface  People talk easily to strangers  move to first name basis and open to asking personal questions  But quickly you hit the "pit" where the person will no longer reveal anything more   Coconut cultures  People are more closed off to strangers  they won't talk or ask many personal questions  But when you get to know them better and the relationship and friendship builds they'll become more open and treat you like family   I feel like I'm the latter stuck in a culture that's the former  And because of that  I'm not given a chance to build that relationship and trust  I really do feel very lost and unwelcome in North American culture

Hello  Im so very sorry you're going through this lately  But let me tell you  if you had an ulcer  which I do  you would know it beyond a doubt  It's hard to explain because people tell me all the time "Dont worry if you had     you'd KNOW it" even though we kind of already THINK WE DO  right   But rest assured if you had stomach cancer or an ulcer you would 100 percent know it    It sucks and is very obvious  When I get focused on just one worry  I tend to OVERFOCUS on that body part and notice every single sensation  So you might "think" you feel something but with an ulcer  I dont want to give you too many symptoms because you might start to worry yourself  you would know  I've never had one before in my life and when I started feeling this one it was like "Omg what IS THIS  It's driving me crazy it's so weird  it hurts and it feels so funny" yeah it's pretty obvious so please dont worry  You have no reason to be upset or scared  When you have an ulcer and you have stomach pains let me tell you  it's OBVIOUS  It's worse and you can't ignore it  If you can ignore your symptoms even for just a bit and they aren't really causing you significant pain or anything I would definitely say please dont worry  And I don't just mean stress  cause you can stress yourself silly  I just mean if you ACTUALLY feel something you've never felt before and you can't ignore it  That's how I found out about my ulcer  But even still im taking meds and they should be helping soon  So please dont worry  I hope you feel better love  I really hope that you can relax and feel better because I know health anxiety can really be the worst      3
Typically the sense of impending doom happens seconds or minutes before they die  You would have been dead if yours had anything to do with health issues  Just paranoia anxiety

I've been there  So many times  Just this week  actually  I was talking to my therapist about it today and there really is something to be said for throwing ourselves at breakneck speeds in work schedules so much that when we do get a day  or 7  that's unstructured  we go completely the other way and "waste" it   It's not a pleasant feeling  And I always wish I could at least have it back and use it to read or do something fun if I wasn't going to be otherwise productive anyway    But especially around the holidays and winter   It's not like sleeping is the antithesis of what our bodies need    Hang in there 
Noone can say  Shrooms might give you 1 week's remission  or 3 months  Or they wont work at all  Or ketamine will do it  Only way to find out is to experiment 
Someone on  r nootropics said a while back that there's four main things that we can say with confidence help to improve mood and general functioning  Those things are exercise  diet  sleep  and meditation  If you can get more of those things into your life you'll have a much better foundation from which to build on and improve your life   It sounds like you sleep well enough  though if you can get it so that you spend more time awake during the day  ie  get up at like 10am or earlier  you'll probably be better off  At the very least you'll get more of your Vitamin D naturally   If you can get an exercise   meditation routine going that would help  Start slow  Headspace  phone app  offers a free 10m guided meditation which might offer a good start    Diet definitely helps  Maybe you could try cooking up some recipes  If you like it you could become good at it  and maybe it could become a hobby  It's a good skill to have regardless  and it might help you feel more confident if you get good at it   I'd personally add another thing to the list  and that's herbal tea  Specifically  relaxing ones like chamomile  holy basil  valerian root  mint  There are others as well  These can really help me turn a day around  in that I might be a nervous wreck before and then pretty chill after drinking some tea  None of them will cure you  but they definitely won't hurt  And your body will definitely appreciate them  goes with diet to some degree   Lots of teas are good for you in other ways as well   You're only 22  so you have lots of time to figure it out  And your unique life experience actually gives you a unique perspective that may turn out to be pretty useful  It's good that you're getting fed up   you should be able to use that motivation to get better

Hello  I don't have much experience with bentonite clay  but I do think that if you look it up it's actually very commonly used as a face and body mask  which is probably why you did it and saw the videos     If many people do it very often  I would 1000 percent say you should not worry  In fact there are 100s of articles that explain why it's actually a good idea to use this clay  And if they have done it and nothing happened to them  lets be honest if it did  we would all be saying DO NOT USE THIS CLAY   STOP ITS CAUSED PROBLEMS AND LEAD POISONING    Also you are correct  If you immediately felt that way then it is DEFINITELY anxiety  This has happened to me too  For example if I try a new medication  I always think "What if im allergic  " and I freak out  I think "I shouldn't try it I mean I know I have to but I really am scared" then I take the medicine and guess what  Almost EVERY TIME no matter what the medicine I get dizzy and lightheaded and almost give myself a panic attack   Why is this  Because when we are worried about something we are about to do we pay even more attention to how we are feeling after we take it or use it  the clay mask  the medicine   So of course we notice EVERYTHING even things that aren't there  So you are very very right and smart to think that it was your anxiety   Also please remember that it probably has a very insignificant amount of lead in it  Back in the day people used lead for all kinds of things daily and eventually after years of exposure developed problems  If you use a mask with even just 2 percent of lead or something  it is not going to affect you  One time  I accidentally got bleach in my mouth  just a bit  I freaked out and called an emergency hotline and the woman told me even if I drank some the most it would do would be give me a stomach ache  Remember  if a lot of people are using this product  they are   and nothing has happened  then if you use it 1 time you are soooooo very unlikely to have ANY reaction whatsoever  So I would suggest throwing it away so that you don't scare yourself anymore  but just remember how often it's praised and suggested  It cannot hurt you and I promise you  you are fine   Sorry for the long reply I've just been in your shoes before

Teacher with anxiety here myself  A few things   1  Your first five years of teaching are tough  with the first year being the worst  It  does  get easier   2  Don't bring work home  Stay at school and do your grading there  I found bringing marking home always caused me anxiety   3  Find alternative ways of assessing  Not sure what you're teaching  grade subject   but there are online tools like Kahoot and Plickers that make life WAAAAY easier   4  Write mini goals for yourself  Make a check list and use it  It may even have steps broken down into smaller steps   5  Look into the Pomodoro method of getting done  When I'm feeling really anxious about a task  this approach really helps me    6  Is there any way the students could do some of the grading   7  Do you have a mentor teacher that can help you   8  Look at the TeachersPayTeachers website  It has a lot of lessons preplanned  Some are free  some are paid resources  The way I look at it is that my time is money and if I can spend a few bucks for something that will help with planning  it is worth it   9  Breathe  Remember to breathe    10  Be forgiving towards yourself  This is your first year teaching  Your admin knows this  Your colleagues know this  No one expects you to be perfect  And  it's okay to ask for help 
You know I have eaten all kinds of steak and not once have I thought about vCJD  And lets be honest  if you didn't know about vCJD you probably wouldn't have thought about it either    Please do not worry  300 cases   In total  Everywhere  Even just in the US alone  That is still a significantly low number  im talking about so very very low  There are 319 MILLION people in the us alone  and when I tried to calculate the percentage of people that is compared to everyone in the US  it literally gives me such a low  uncalculatable number  Were talking about the chances of you getting it being less than 0 00000000001  excuse my math im not that good but you get the idea   Also you'd have to eat the EXACT piece of the brain or spinal cord of the cow affected with mad cow disease in order to get the disease  Did that delicious steak seem like brain or spinal cord  That lessens your chances even FURTHER  vCJD is EXCRUTIATINGLY rare     Very very rare so please do not worry    I looked it up and sure enough getting struck by lightning has the same number of people affected as vCJD  Which means that your chances of getting mad cow disease for ANY YEAR not just in your entire life but any YEAR is 1 104 200 000 that is AN INSANELY low number  You do not need to worry  It's almost impossible  Just remember how rare it truly is  Feel better and eat that steak1

Yes  Cutting back on alcohol will most certainly help your depression  Alcohol is a depressant  Yes people can get tipsy and wild and have fun on it  but the stimulant itself is a depressant    I am a child of an alcoholic  Thankfully  I never became one  but I do enjoy the craft of alcohol beer mead etc  My friend and I run a YouTube channel about beer  no I won't give it to you  and last year we exchanged advent calendars  I did a video every day about the different beer I had received  Three weeks in  I had a suicidal attack  I did not want to wake up  Some how I KNEW it was the alcohol consumption  Though I enjoy the craft of it  I didn't partake a lot of it  Yes  I have been drunk many times  But I have never wanted or felt the appeal of having a drink every night  From then on  I am very cautious about drinking  I still do  but not in the slightest like I did last year   The best thing for you is to go to AA  One day at a time  AA helps so much  You even get coins for reaching different milestones  if you're a gamer it's like a reward   I'm not saying you have to go cold turkey but it is often the best way

Here's my take OP   We all have certain times in our life where we feel completely trapped   Anything would be better than the current situation   But at the same time it's hard to think about consequences clearly because emotions can cause strong reactions   For you  it's likely that things have not gone well so far  and you feel that you can't fix the situation and make yourself comfortable   The problem is that you're at one of those crucial crossroads   Sure  you can go back to college  but you're there right now   It doesn't get any closer to higher education and an easier life   You have to remember that a situation change doesn't automatically lift the psychological root problems   They're stopped for a bit  but it doesn't take much to land yourself into another trap   If anything  a job is not freeing  especially ones where you have no degree or experience   The jobs you will end up finding are likely going to exasperate you in the same ways   If you do somehow find a no stress job it'll likely be something janitorial   There are very few low level jobs that aren't physically socially demanding in some way   I wanted to do janitorial for similar reasons  but I believed I was in a situation where it was OK   For you  you have the possibility to finish your degree  find a job that suits you  and you will look back on all of this struggle in a positive way   No one remembers all of the shitty anxious moments  moreso the best moments of that period of time when they look back years later   There's nothing wrong with going into class one day and just being a different person   You don't have to hold the weight of previous encounters and conversations in such a high degree   Class work is stressful  but being organized with it can do wonders   Really  it's more about calming your mind  realizing that every moment you're alive is the moment where good things happen  to change you need to accept your surroundings   This is your life   You're an adult   You will make these decisions regardless of what I say   I just think that you need to see the situation without your stress attached   I hope everything works out

Hey bud  I've gone through something similar to that and the best thing to help me out was to just get out of my comfort zone  I know hanging out with people doesnt seem like something you want to do but take the time of isolation to figure out what makes them your friends  whether it be from childhood or not  Find the reason why they're apart of your life and think of that reason next time they ask you to hang out  You let them into your life for a reason and vice versa  They want to see you buddy  If you make it a habit of not seeing your friends then you might not want to see them once that feeling you have passes  I wish you the best  friend     Edit  comma

Traveling alone is awesome  You get to do whatever YOU want to do at whatever pace you want  If you stay in hostels with other travelers  people are always up for going out to eat  or going sightseeing together  Or you can decline and do those things by yourself    I like traveling with others  but I also enjoy being alone    So traveling by myself works out  
I used to drink most nights and at one point  I was drinking a bottle of wine a night  I would stop for a while and I would feel marginally better  When I would drink  I would always wake up feeling despondent the following day  I didn't have that feeling when I stopped drinking  but I still felt "depressed " It's like gradations of grey scale  Physically  I was sleeping better and losing weight from not drinking extra calories  Emotionally  I felt only slightly better  nothing really to write home about   This past November  I bit the bullet and asked my doctor for help with my depression  I was at such a low ebb  I really wanted to shuffle off this mortal coil  but I have a kid and I can't do that to him  I stopped taking anti depressants almost two decades ago  because they only seemed to work briefly  I got tired of the side effects and messing around with different combinations doages  I have been white knuckling it since then and I think that's how I got into heavy drinking  It was taking the edge off of the depression in that moment  but the price was a rebounding  soul crushing depression in the morning   I am not telling you or suggesting you do this  I am just providing my experiences  I started taking this anti depressant and within 3 weeks my cravings for booze went away and I felt like life sucked a little less  I am feeling better  bit by bit  I don't dread getting up in the morning and I don't sit around in my pajamas until 4 PM anymore  I think because I am no longer severely depressed  I no longer need to seek relief through a glass or three of Pino Grigio   I do want to point out  I didn't take the anti depressant to quit drinking  it was from a desperate desire to stop feeling like shit  The reduction in booze cravings was a bonus  I was basically drinking to blunt the depression    From your post  I feel like you are in a similar place where I have been  I know it's a shitty place to be and shitty cycle to be trapped in  I hope you will explore this further with your therapist  because it's honestly no way to go through life  Take care   3

I've been rolling around in this existential muck for years now  I suppose this post of mine is a breakdown of what it meant to me   Life is still meaningless to me   
29yr old female  ptsd   major depression  and anxiety paranoia  After trying almost every ssri out there they finally tried Lamictal at 100mg and its pretty good  but what really made me go up was adding 150mg of effexor xr  ssnri    5mg of Zyprexa and 2mg of prazosin  I  would be dead without my meds by now  The effexor killed my Sex drive at first but it's slowly coming back   The Zyprexa really helped with my paranoia with almost no side effects  The prazosin is what I call my miracle drug  it kills my nightmares so I can sleep restful for the most part   I started on a low dose of Lamictal  and when they raised it I got a horrible rash  apparently that can be either a deadly rash or a simple hive like reaction  it doesn't happen anymore thankfully but they say I'm at my max dose for it 
It's very rare  but stress ulcers do exist  You are far more likely at 22 years old to have a ulcer than stomach cancer  Stress ulcers can also be called gastritis  Anyways  listen to your doctor  Work with him or her with a plan of action  Quit the alcohol  spicy food  fatty food  caffeine and smoking  Start meditating or some other relaxation stuff and eat stuff that soothes your insides    Good luck  Stomach issues sucks  But again  stomach cancer at your age is super rare  You will be fine

The Mirena releases a very small amount of a progestin  and the majority of women who use it experience their usual hormone cycles after they've had it for a little while    Here's a detailed breakdown on how an IUD and other forms of birth control vary in terms of how they affect hormones    https   www bedsider org features 317 all about hormones
I've known I was going to be a pathetic  friendless loser since I was a little kid  and I still can't get over it  You'd think I'd be used to the idea by now  that it wouldn't hurt so much when I saw happy young people out on dates or just hanging out with all their friends  but it's still devastating  If there's one thing I hate more than anything else about being human  it's the engrained need for contact with other humans  Obviously it's a wonderful thing for a lot of people  but it's a curse for people like me  like us  people who weren't socially conditioned in a healthy manner when they were kids

I mean  if you take it to that extreme  I believe the term for that would be mania or hypomania   I agree though   A healthy human does not sit at the polar opposite of the spectrum in terms of depression  they're more in the middle  if that makes any sense     
My anxiety gets worse around nighttime  Do you have access to a computer  If so  I'd say turn on something light to watch like videos from YouTube or Netflix if you have it  If not  there's two options  journaling and meditating  Write down what you're anxious about and why  but make sure to keep these notes positive  That's crucial to help make sense in your mind that everything will be ok  which is the truth  Then try meditating  It's not a difficult process  Since you can't use your phone for a meditating app  just try to focus on laying down  Breathe in through your nose and out through your mouth for a little while  then return to normal breathing  After that  listen to the sounds where you are and focus on how your body feels  Then count your breaths while feeling your stomach rise and fall  and then open your eyes after a few minutes of that  Hopefully something will help

I had a paraguard copper IUD for 4 years  If it's covered by insurance or inexpensive for some reason  I think it's worth trying since it can be extremely effective and worry free   I think sometimes our brains latch on to what we hear  so I'm hesitant to explain my negative experiences  But since you're asking  I think my body slowly  and then rapidly  rejected the IUD  My cramps were so intense I was asking friends for leftover opiates even though they make me kinda sick  I started getting BV which had never been an issue  and my resulting self consciousness ruined my sex drive  My OB Gyn said he'd had several patients start having problems after a year or two and decide to get it out    In the last few months before I had it removed it felt as if something was very  very wrong that I had trouble pinpointing    my anxiety was flying high all the time  about everything  and I had strong feelings of wanting "this thing" out of my body  I'm very much a skeptic and had zero qualms with the IUD going into it  I was so excited to get it  actually   but I became so physically and psychologically uncomfortable that I was scouring forum after forum on copper IUD's and found hundreds of women who had bad reactions similar to mine  You might say these were not reliable sources necessarily  but I felt so strongly something was very wrong and they matched up well to my experience  The only scientific study I found was one that found copper levels were too high in women after a year of use  But that was only one small study      then again who will fund further studies on the negative effects of such reliable birth control    I can dig it up if you're curious   Personally I think the recent craze over IUD's isn't representative of the many women whose bodies react poorly to them  I'm not saying don't try it   if costs are low  it's totally worth seeing if it works for you  But I personally wouldn't recommend someone drop  500  1000 on one  And if you're feeling uncomfortable  don't hesitate to remove it  I felt so much better once I did     Edit  I also went from 3 day walk in the park periods to 5 6 days of murder scenes  But that part was worth it to me  It was the pain  anxiety  malaise  and BV that pushed me to have it removed  Also important  my best friend LOVES paraguard and has no extra pain or other issues       Edit 2  just fyi I'm very sensitive to both pain and hormones   My best friend who loves paraguard is sensitive to hormones but not pain

One thing I want to add is that our language  and really all languages  constrain the way we think  words are finite when life is anything but  "Social anxiety" has such a strong connotation to it  personally I try not to think how 'bad' my SA is and in turn it almost goes away completely   There's a great book that helped me a lot when I first realized I had SA  it's called "The Wisdom of Insecurity" by Alan Watts  He talks about this for a chapter  I recommend it to anyone who wants to improve themselves

I don't know where you're from  but I'm from Canada  I've known a lot of guys who have gotten into various professional hockey levels  and it's really not all it's supposed to be  They say once you're in it  it becomes a job just like any other  There's a lot of pressure and stress  Your job performance is always in question  and if you don't want to lose your slot  you have to be working constantly and sacrifice every other part of your life in order to make it work   If you really love sport  use it as your refuge   Everything else is shit  don't drag the complicated shit into the thing you love   As for what to do with the rest of your life  people in your and my age group are expected to change careers eight times in our lives  Not just jobs  but whole sectors of employment  The 40 year factory job doesn't exist anymore  there's only the hustle  When I was thinking about my future  I did an exercise  I just took a piece of paper and tried to figure out what I was good at  I have really terrible self esteem  so this was really hard for me  I eventually had to start asking people for help finding the good things about myself  Then I looked for interesting problems that matched my skill set  Maybe your friends and family  or someone else can help you with a similar exercise  And remember  you won't be stuck in a 40 year job ever  because they don't exist anymore  If you don't like a career  build knowledge on the side and move on  You're not chained to a wall or anything like that

Most people feel nervous and awkward when meeting other people    even if they don't act like it   So here's the thing we have to tell ourselves   "That other person   they feel awkward too  I'll just help them meet people by helping them meet me"    I'm usually happily surprised when I stop thinking of myself as the stranger and instead think of myself as a person who helps others feel more comfortable   You may find this hard to believe   I certainly did   But here's a fun fact    only 1 2 of 1  of people actually like going to a party or group where they don't already know someone   That's a tiny portion   Even though when you look around  you'd swear a large portion of people are extroverts   Well  a lot of people are extroverts  but it still doesn't make them feel less insecure or less awkward   they only act like they don't

Hi there  6'3" and 33 years old here  I have suffered from self worth issues and depression since I was about 10  Apart from the daughter  we don't have kids  I could relate to a lot of your story  Seemingly good decisions I have made in the past   not realising how it would affect my future mostly due to things completely out of my control  I started concentrating so much on the past and thinking "if only I did this and that" and I just spiraled into a worse and deeper depression     I'm not sure if they will work for you   but these are the things that have helped me out     1  talk about  it  Either to your wife   or your local neighbourhood counsellor or a local support group  I'm not sure if this exists where you're from   but in Australia we have something called "mens shed"  There are heaps of them in each local area and they are designed to get men together to discuss issues that guys are always told not to because we just need to "man up" and not have feelings  They do hobby work   wood work and local neighbourhood projects     2  move forward  This is the hardest one for me  I get so stuck in a rut thinking about what I wanted to do that I forget that today is tomorrow's yesterday  I try to give myself realistic goals and aim for them   like getting myself back in shape etc   Having a schedule for my spare time has really helped     3  relax  Not the sort of relaxation I thought would help   i e   alcohol or computer games   but real relaxation  I have always been on the move and want to keep busy because I don't want to spend any time with my thoughts  so I find it very hard to relax  I have found a couple of apps that help  The one that had helped me the most  which is also free  is called "Depression CBT Self Help Guide" that I have in my smart phone  I cannot recommend this strongly enough     4  ask if your wife is okay  I'm sure you've done this one before   but if she is suffering depression also she may be feeling exactly the same as you  A couple with depression may seem loveless sometimes   but is more just an issue with internalising    5  get fit  Nothing is better for my mental health than psychical health  I used to be quite fit and 5 years of extremely stressful jobs  those life choices again    saw me get quite unfit  which is where I find myself at present  I have been regularly exercising again for a short while and am already feeling a lot better fit it  Perhaps you and your wife can go for walks or to the gym together  It would be a nice way to spend some stress free time together too    Anyway that's what helped me  I hope things work out well for you bud  both for yourself and your family  
"Doomed" is a big  permanent sounding word  Meeting people is just a skill like any other    Improvement comes with practice  practice  practice  You're not doomed

Hi Kisua   There are answers to all of your questions  but if you haven't sought out therapy with someone trained in sexual assault trauma  it's going to be difficult to move forward     What I can tell you is that you can re learn how to enjoy yourself sexually with a partner you like or are in love with   It just takes  time  practice and patience for both of you   It would help for you partner to know what you've gone through  so he can help you to experience pleasure and orgasm together     Of course  I don't know your specific history  but my guess based on women I've worked with  is that you are drawn towards men you don't like because you have a need to punish yourself for what happened   Another possibility is that by going out with men you aren't attracted to  part of you is hoping you won't be drawn to doing anything sexual with them   You can say which fits best for you   Panic attacks are an anxiety response from the primal part of our brain that is trying to warn us of danger   With panic attacks though  we are being fooled because there is no actual danger in the moment   Knowing this is one step towards dealing with them and learning how to reduce them over time  If you like  I can provide what are called "grounding techniques" to help you with this   One book I recommend for women who are wanting to be sexual and having a hard time is Wendy Maltz' "The Sexual Healing Journey "  It's best used after going through recovery with a therapist  but it may be of help to you   The best thing is to keep asking  writing  and talking about what you need   Either here or with partners you trust   All my best

I conquered my crushing anxiety about my grades and specifically my classes this semester  I fell behind by almost 3 months in my robotics class but clawed my way back through seven programming assignments in one week  and even checked my transcript  I got 2 As and 2 Bs this semester  I feel that under my situation  most people would have given up and dropped out of school  and I'm really proud of myself for surviving a situation that seemed impossible  It's hard enough to get decent grades at an elite engineering school  University of Michigan  but to do it with panic attacks every time I worked on any content related to my programming classes was fucking heroic  I also managed to confront my bizarrely specific fear of checking my grades   Tomorrow I must register for next semester's classes  It is a huge anxiety trigger for me because I am in my last semester of college and I envision scenarios where I don't get enough credits to graduate and screw myself over  Wish me luck

Hi There    First off you aren't alone    I've dealt with severe anxiety for as long as I can remember    Yo have to figure out you but there is millions of people who deal with the same thing everyday    First off if you have any caffeine in your diet cut it out  Second of all don't try and hide your anxiety  tell her about it  I'm sure she will be nothing but supportive    Try to set a routine and keep yourself busy as it typically helps most people    For the times when your anxiety is out of control I suggest downloading headspace the app it's great to listen to and it should help calm you down    Last just know that you are perfectly normal and anxiety is a beautiful things  The darkest tunnels can lead to the brightest of lights  It will make your mind and spirit stronger and more creative than you could have ever imagined    Feel free to private message me    Stay strong and remember we aren't given more than we can handle

Hi kali   It's difficult to give you any really helpful answers   I will say knowing is always better than not knowing when it comes to a history of sexual abuse   Especially when it's affecting you in ways you aren't certain of   If your mother has answers that may help you understand things better  than it will be better for you in the long run    That said   without the support of a therapist or at least a support network of friends trusted others who can be there for you  learning more details may have a short term impact on you that could be very difficult to deal with   I typically recommend to my clients that we increase sessions or other supports to ensure that getting new information won't cause more disruption in their lives than they are capable of handling   You are clear about your history of depression and addiction and I'd hate to have this spiral from your control  assuming it's under your control now   There are some alternatives to therapy if you cannot afford it   One would be seeking out a therapist who will do some pro bono or drastic sliding scale work with you   Others would be utilizing ad hoc supports like RAINN  a chat forum like pandys org  or here   7 Cups of Tea is a moderate choice as it's not done by professionals  but can provide free support when you need it   I'll be honest that this work is best done with a qualified professional and I wouldn't want to set you up to destabilize if you don't have the supports in place to take in whatever your mom has to tell you   I'm sorry I can't be more decisive  but hopefully this will give you some guidance in how to approach this   All my best

I am so sorry to hear this  so truly sorry for your loss  My moms passing a few years ago was very much like this  very unexpected  She was 59  my dad had gone to pick her up from dialysis  and i was over cooking them dinner  I realized they'd been gone too long  called my dad  who didn't want to worry us so he just told us her blood pressure wasn't coming up  a common complication after dialysis  But a few minutes later my sister pulled into the driveway and said we'd better head up to the hospital  She was unconscious by the time we arrived  her heart only coming back briefly  They did all they could but she was gone    I had a lot of guilt about what stress she may have been under  I was just out of state with my husband not two days before  where we decided to divorce  and I was moving in with my girlfriend   I wasn't cheating  I want that to be clear  though I don't wish to explain the situation   She was very worried about me  I know  and I have this fear that it was my fault  I know she was happy for me as well  but stress seems to do more damage than than happiness will ever do good  I was so ashamed of myself and afraid that her concern for me was a huge factor here   I only go into this so you know where I'm coming from  I hope it's alright to share these details  This pain  this sense of unreality and disbelief  there are no words to describe how it feels  But I want to say please don't linger on this guilt if you can help it  You can go over every angle  every moment you could have done something differently  But that is futile  Those are details  In the end  I'm sure she knew that you loved her  and I'm sure you know she loved you  No matter what was in the past  no matter what you did or didn't say  you did the best you could for each other and that is all we can ever ask of each other  You may have days of regretting the way you behaved toward her  then have days when you are bitter about how she acted toward you  But the details will never take away how much you loved each other  Let these doubts pass  When you feel the guilt and pain  focus on the feeling of love  That is what matters   I wish I had better advice  but it's a personal journey to get through this and no matter how well anyone wishes us we must bear it ourselves  It's terribly hard  Be kind and patient to yourself and your family  Don't be afraid or ashamed of your feelings  face them and work through them  Please don't blame yourself  you didn't do anything wrong    I know I'm just a random stranger  but I honestly do wish you my condolences and sympathy  If it helps  and you want someone to talk to  feel free to pm me  Above all  take care of yourself

IMO the best thing for panic attacks is meditation   If you don't know how to do that then just breathe very deeply and slowly  Wait a couple seconds between inhalations exhalations  Try to only focus on things you can physically feel right now   like  the weight of yourself sitting in your chair  the way your clothes feel  the weird fluids and tensions running through your body  Try to clear out any lingering thoughts on intangible things   don't worry about anything except this exact moment  Allow yourself to slow down   If you can figure out how to defuse a panic attack then hopefully you'll manage until you can get into another session

Magnesium acts as a muscle relaxant and most people are deficient in magnesium  It can be difficult to get enough through diet  I originally took it for anxiety on advice from a book about natural anxiety treatment since I don't tolerate psych meds well and it had the side effect of clearing up the dull ache and sharp  transient pains in my chest and sternum  Worth a try

A trick I found that had worked wonders for me  do a little chore every time there's a commercial on when I'm watching a show  Commercial  Start a load of laundry  Empty the dishwasher  Set out the trash  Pick up the bedroom  Wipe down the kitchen counter  Sweep the bathroom  Little things like that  one or two at a time depending on how long the commercials are  Simple  little chores that over the course of one show can add up to a picked up and often cleaned up home

To put it very simply  CBT is how you think about things  and DBT is controlling your emotions  For bipolar  it seems CBT is more useful  It definitely was for me  and I have recently looked into DBT and it seems to have a huge foundation built from CBT  Look up the 10 cognitive distortions and really study and apply them  They improved my life tremendously    DBT seems to be mostly for people with BPD  but of course it can be applied to any disorder  I don't find much of a use for it

In my own experience  I find that when I'm really depressed  I'm always looking at the world in the wrong way  somehow   a little "off " or a little too bleak  I study a lot of philosophy  and one of the things that I notice there is that the clearest thinkers don't really seem to be depressed  but they do seem to be sad  somehow  like they never quite lose sight of things like death  or the impermanence of what they love  a kind of melancholy runs through all of Aristotle  for instance  or through a really lucid poet  like Homer   So I think that's what being "too aware" looks like   a kind of sadness  rather than a kind of hopelessness   though  even with that being said  I'd still rather be too aware than not aware enough

Well you said about becoming like your mum and not being able to feel guilt or remorse right  That's impossible for anxious people because our senses of guilt and remorse for things we haven't even done minor issues are already off the scales  The losing touch of reality becoming cynical and not caring about things is part of the depression that comes with OCD and anxiety disorders  It's like a protective screen that stops us from going into overdrive all the time  All the worries you have about being narcissistic or not caring about people are being reinforced in your mind by the physical symptoms of your anxiety but you aren't narcissistic because you're aware that your anxiety is affecting you in this way  does that make sense

Hello friend    That's the bitch of depression  it's a disease with no known cure  only treatment  and the things that trigger a depressive episode might not be based in reality  Even people who have a great life "on paper" can be diagnosed  just look at Robin Williams et al   You're seeking help  and you started medicating  so that's a step in the right direction  All I can offer is  don't get discouraged if your meds don't help as much as you think they should  Keep working with your doctor to tweak your prescription or try different meds  And keep in mind  the meds will never "cure" you  but they might make it so that instead of staying in bed all day  for example   you muster enough motivation to get up and go to the gym  etc    Good luck friend
The only way to fix depression would be to remove the emotion  the hurt    and we need that  The best thing is to find balance    peace   
Don't internalize the guilt  Your ex wasn't good for you  there was nothing you could do to fix that situation  Focus on improving and respecting yourself  No one deserves to be treated as a lesser person  You are a human being who deserves love  Spend time with people where you feel it the most  
I guarantee you aren't alone   in any of the "weird" things you feel think  or "bad" habits    Procrastination is one of the biggest symptoms of depression  but not really commonly known     Obviously it's good if we do all the things we should every day   but for a lot of us that isn't realistic just yet    Don't try to "fix" everything at once  we are more likely to fail and that is likely to make us get more depressed    Doing like OP and starting with one basic thing and creating a habit is the way to go   then we get the pride of succeeding  the knowledge we CAN succeed  and find it is enjoyable  It makes us feel better about ourselves  even just a little  and can motivate us to take another step    Start with small  easily attainable goals for each day  Even if it is a list that can be completed in 10 minutes   it is still a list of accomplishments to check off  and still is something to reflect on at the end of the day    No Zero Days  look that up online   there are a few write ups about the concept     We don't have to do it all at once   we just need to at least one little thing each day  The rest will follow    Don't worry  there are a TON of us

It also entirely depends on what form the lead is in the clay  You can play with liquid lead all day with your hands and have no increase in the amount of lead in or body  This is because in several forms lead cannot be absorbed easily through the skin  Ingestion or in certain chemicals you can get absorption through the skin  but these are highly regulated and they likely wouldn't be able to legally sell them for use on skin    
From my experience with my depression often you need to go to the source of your depression and that may mean looking at specific areas of your life you need to work on  Identifying the source of the pain which leads to the feelings is difficult and in my experience needs either years of introspection or a very good professional in real life   Maybe this sub is like a gateway  a top level where you acknowledge you have an illness  You make your way from here to somewhere more specific and deeper where you can work on the specific problems and try and fix and improve them   One example for me  r stopdrinking which helped me to have 3 months off drinking last year but also that community helped shed a light on my addictive behaviour  yes I'm drinking again but with open eyes and realisation that it compounds my depression  Maybe others may need help with grief or money  I suppose those that don't know what the problem is may have more soul searching to do here and in real life     It's an interesting predicament this condition puts you in  Thanks for the response  Any thoughts on answers

I am so sorry for your loss  and I feel your pain  I'm having a hard time finding the right words  but for now  I'd like to say this   The initial shock and pain will wear off over the next few days  It will be replaced by a dull ache in your chest  Occasionally it will return  but every time it does  it will be slightly more bearable  and slightly less painful  It will never quite go away though  Which  in my opinion is good  You don't really want it to   I reckon everything feels a little surreal right now  If so  it's because you haven't really registered what's happened completely  and probably won't for a little while yet    Once the dust has settled  when all the condolences and shows of support are finished rolling in  some time in maybe a few days  weeks or months  When the world has moved on  That's when you will be hit with the true realisation of what's happened and it will hit you hard    I urge you  please  Don't stand in it alone  Your family loves you  and they are in the same place as you  They will need you  as much as you will need them  Cry openly  Talk to each other  Scream at the world if you need it    Remember  There is no limit to mourning  You will never stop  And it's okay not to    I hope you all the best  Good luck  I'll be thinking of you and your family in the year to come

I always get the sense of doom right before a panic attack  I think this is our brain and body going "wait  something's different  RED ALERT EVERYONE " I always think the feeling of doom is that split second when my  for example  average joe plumber cells put their tools down and reach for the weapons  All hands on deck type situation  It's brief  but to those of us with anxiety and health anxiety  feels terrifying    I find the only helpful thing is breathing and riding it out  and that usually helps to stop the ensuing panic attack as well  But sometimes it doesn't then you just gotta ride that out as well

Dude that's not funny  
You're very welcome 
I highly recommend you read the book "Why Am I Still Depressed " by Dr  Jim Phelps  My psychiatrist recommended it to me  with the warning that some of the information is a little outdated   It goes over a lot of these issues  such as what very mild cases of hypomania can look like  Many people think they're just having a rare good day  What's significant is that you're having breaks in the depression yet continue to relapse  In contrast  someone with just depression would have one or two major episodes throughout their life  during which they would not experience relief  However  once the depression is over  it's over  Bipolar depression comes and goes   The book also discusses the idea that bipolar disorder and unipolar depression are on a spectrum  and it's possible to not "really" be bipolar but be just bipolar enough that you'd do better on mood stabilizers than antidepressants  Not all mood stabilizers are scary  especially the ones for milder cases  I personally am on Tegretol and Lamictal  and haven't had many side effects other than a little bit of forgetfulness  Nothing more significant than forgetting a word in the middle of a conversation  In contrast  before I took these meds I was suicidal  Definitely worth it   When I was on antidepressants  lexapro  to be specific   I did find them to help enormously in terms of making that awful  empty feeling go away and preventing me from becoming suicidal  However  I did continue to experience mild depression and changes in attitude   for example  being talkative and productive one day  and antisocial and exhausted the next   I highly recommend you read this book and request an evaluation  Good luck with everything

they are not     They are not considered extremophilic because they are not adapted to exploit these conditions  This means that their chances of dying increase the longer they are exposed to the extreme environments  6  whereas true extremophiles thrive in a physically or geochemically extreme environment that would harm most other organisms  3  13  14    If you think about it  things could Yes  the  cholinergic hypothesis of depression  https   scholar google com scholar hl en q cholinergic hypothesis of depression btnG  as sdt 1 2C30 as sdtp   was the subject of several papers in the 70s and 80s   Here are some more recent papers that are interesting   https   www ncbi nlm nih gov pmc articles PMC3587265    An AchEI increased anxious and depressive behavior in rodents  reversed both by an SSRI and by anticholinergics   http   www sciencedirect com science article pii S1471489207001968   this posits that accumbens dopamine acetylcholine balance could be important in withdrawal related anxiety from amphetamines and opioids 
Leap2 has the best advice anyone could give on the matter  Until the source of these attacks is rooted and a particular path of treatment is referred to  the best we can do is pull some guesses  In the mean time  there are several things you can try that wouldn't hurt at all  such as writing down whatever comes to mind during your attacks  maybe you'll find a pattern   brewing your preferred hot drink to settle down with  taking hot showers  rolling yourself in your covers to give yourself a sense of security  and so forth

Not everyone can be bothered to read long ass text messages  There's a reason people add 'TL DR' to Reddit posts   Sorry I'm not having a go at you intentionally it's just long boring texts that blab on really bother me personally and turn me off    From my experience I would suggest a few short sentences at most which quickly gives the message what's going on or how you're felling so the recipient gets the message quickly and easily then at the end add "can we get together to talk when you are free "  for example

I have GAD as well  A great hobby that helps me relieve anxiety is walking  just getting out the house and walking around the neighborhood  Running tends to make me scared and I worry about what other people think when they look at me  so I walk now  I definitely recommend that      As for crazy day to day situations  the best thing that helps me are breaks  If I'm feeling overwhelmed or stressed out  I leave to the bathroom to calm down and tell myself that my fears are irrational  and it's just the anxiety talking  I go there around 4 times a day to do this  Sometimes a feel lazy and unproductive because I need so many breaks  but it's important to remember that your personal sanity comes first

I read all my comments   I understand that they have no concept of malice despite acting out like a bunch of tiny barbarians  doesn't change the fact that they are inflicting pain on me  Don't get me wrong  I don't mind the black ones biting me since they barely hurt at all  but the red ones can cause me to yell and wince when they bite   As for living things  I try to have empathy for them as long as they are friendly with me  I've had pets and I treat them like my babies  I wouldn't dream of hurting them  even if they bite me  But red ants you see  they swarm  they are territorial and they are in my way  I can't safely relocate them without them crawling up my hands and giving me a world of pain    But  I'd also say this  I don't value the life of any creature  perhaps only mine and my family for practical reasons  This is silly to say but those ants can either be my friends  be neutral  or suffer consequences 
I feel like more people need to be open to talking about their negative traits  As a person with depression  I've had trouble in the past talking about things I hate about myself and if someone brings them up I'd just ask them not to talk about it  This led to a lifestyle where I was able to understand why I was unhappy  but unable to do anything about it as I didn't know how to change it or who to talk to  to change it   I'll give a personal anecdote for this  I've always been pretty awkward  I never really knew why  I just though that was how I was supposed to be and there was nothing I could do about it  The more I talked about how awkward I was  the less awkward I became  It shed new light on things I hadn't even considered before  it led to me understanding the root of my awkwardness and how to effectively combat it  It turned from me hating my awkwardness  to me embracing that I was awkward sometimes  but I could improve my social skills and become more outgoing   Introspection can only get you so far in the end  You really need to talk to someone to truly understand how you feel  as an outside opinion can often by the tipping point in the end to understanding yourself  It's a constant battle between having to want to get better and the depression  however when you start to improve your life in any way it can lead to you wanting to get help and not being content with just being nothing   I suppose first you need to understand what makes you unhappy about yourself and actively want to change that  You can't just want other people to fix your life  it won't happen  but they can really help you keep on track with self improvement  You have to do a lot of soul searching and introspective thought before you can even begin to understand yourself and I don't think I truly understand myself to this day  but I still know a lot more than I used to and I'm happy about that   This is a bit of a ramble  but I wanted to share because you seem like a nice  good person  We're all a little fucked up  but being able to confront our demons is how we better ourselves and you can only take on so many demons by yourself  Congratulations on staying sober for three months  It's a true accomplishment  even if there was a relapse  You seem like you can conquer if  if need be and if you need any help feel free to talk to me  Have a good day

If you're willing to do an experiment try this  next time the teacher tells the class to form groups and you see that your classmates are starting to approach each other don't just stand there  approach them too  Don't say anything  don't ask if you can be in their group  just walk to their side and stand there  This may be helpfull for 2 reasons  first if the other classmates see the group is already full they may not approach it and you get to stay there  second because you'll get to see what is the reaction of the other group members to your approach  Also try to do this with groups of people you've already been a part of in previous classes  they may be more accepting that way    This may not work  but I guess it's worth trying  Just don't injure yourself on purpose  in some years you will look back and realize how not worthy that was  You can even end in a weelchair  or a bed  for the rest of your life because of that kind of things

thing inside me that I hate deeply that clings to hope  I wish I could just do it  But that part of me just won't stop saying  'soon'  Soon it will be bearable  Soon there will be relief  and hope a little piece of me is saying there's a pinprick of sun up there and I can't ignore it  I wish I could  It would be so much easier to quit  It's like that cartoon that says   depressed people are the most hopeful people of all  A depressed person is like an unarmed soldier behind enemy lines surrounded by people trying to kill him with a trillion weapons and the soldier is crying out  "I'm outnumbered  but I can survive if someone just handed me a stick  just a stick and I would fight through every one of these men with guns  I just need one sign that someone is rooting for me against these awful odds and I will be okay  I'll manage  It's just me against a million but I'll be ok if I just had something to fight with" That is some crazy fucking optimism  It sounds insane  But it's how we are living our lives  in our minds  I wish I could find that cartoon  it says it better than I did  I'm just rambling at this point  I don't know what my point is  You're not alone  I'm rooting for you  I'm in the same situation  except we are both on different battlefields but we're fighting together  There's lots of us out there  Many of us only have our fists to fight with  fists against machine guns but we're still alive  That's a vicious  perverted kind of victory  but it's something  We have touched the limits  we have felt rock bottom and made our beds there  If we can do that then we make the long and bloody crawl back up to sunlight  just out of spite and defiance and the knowledge that we've climbed out of hell with half our limbs chopped off and our hearts shattered and bipolar II     other co existing mental illnesses   i am 29  have been smoking for a large portion of my life  probably 15 years steadily  everyday  also eat edibles  use concentrates and RSO sometimes for pain   i am VERY specific about strains  indicas  indica dominant hybrids  CBD strains  sometimes i will smoke an evenly split hybrid but I stay away from straight up sativas and heavy sativa dominant strains  Sativas make me anxious and exacerbate any manic episodes I may be having  but indicas  etc  never let me down    helps me focus  helps me remain calm  I am unfortunately quick to anger   the right strains help my CPTSD and anxiety    huge proponent of weed so long as you figure out what works best

Did it actually grow mold   I mean  that question aside  you can wipe it down with a bleach solution inside and out  take the strings off first   Don't soak the wood   Wood is naturally antimicrobial  which is why butcher block cutting boards are better than plastic   so you only imperatively need to introduce the bleach to the surfaces that the towel may have touched   The inside should be fine because it's likely an untreated surface   Still  you can spritz a little bleach cleaner in there  Now let the whole thing dry while lying face up on the floor   Then  if you have central heating  place the ukulele near  but not on top of or resting over  a heater vent   If you don't have central heating  use a small space heater  Place the ukulele there  resting upon a dry towel   Rest it on its back for a couple hours  then turn it over and rest it on it's back     The gentle heat and forced air of the heating is just enough to evaporate the moisture and dry the wood   Don't do it too quickly  or the wood might warp   After it's dried maybe overnight  or over the course of an afternoon  put the strings back on and tune it   Should be fine

I agree with myceli yum that it would be important to get checked out by a doctor just in case  But if that does not lead to an insight  I would try a number of experiments if I were you  Try different exercises to see if the nausea occurs no matter what you do  for example what if you just go swimming for a change  Or go for a jog  Or even a walk  Try a much shorter and easier workout and see if you still get nauseous  Try it with a different trainer and without a trainer to see if it is something about your interaction with the trainer that leads to anxiety  Try working out on your own without anyone present  Also try to take the trainer's advice an increase your caloric intake significantly  and see whether that helps  Try different things and keep track of any times when you are not nauseous and figure out what could account for it  Once you find a way to work out without nausea  then you can start from that and see how much you can modify it to be more like your preferred workout but still without nausea  That's how I would approach it anyway

I smoked most days for about 10 years  from college to my late 20s  Most times when I took a break I would move to hypomania after a few days  which at the time was a great motivation to take a break  Of course  this was before I was diagnosed   My last binge was a couple of months after I was prescribed Wellbutrin  and when I stopped I came the closest to a full manic episode that I ever had   In retrospect  the prescription alone had already put me in hypo territory   After that I had my diagnosis and prescription changed  and started regular appointments with a pdoc   Now  I smoke on the rare occasion  a couple of times a year  and it is not a problem  Looking back  it certainly helped me cope before I got any professional help  and it certainly held me back from accomplishing a lot that I could have  including getting help   I never had the option of choosing strains  so I cannot say what effect that may have had   I really miss smoking weed  but I can honestly say my life is better now without it

Here is how to progress if you cant do 1 push up   Warm up your wrists  important   and do negative push ups  If you dont know what that is  You put yourself in the push up position with arms straight and go down as slowly as possible    repeat until you can go down and then up afterwards

That's very sad that your parents do not believe your depression is real  Well  I believe you  and I don't think you are acting badly through being depressed  It means that you are hurting and that you have needs which aren't being met  and people need to care for you and respect you  Your parents are probably unable to empathize because when they were younger  their parents  or other adults  didn't empathize with them  That would explain their behaviour and maybe help you to feel compassion for them  but know that it's also okay to be angry at them    What exactly is the bedroom situation 
 Sorry  tried to reply in the proper place below but my computer's acting up    I know  right  It's the last thing you want to be told when you're feeling like hell with terrible OCD   'Just make a bunch of lifestyle changes you totally don't feel like doing right now and you'll get better'  There were days when mine was at its worst I couldn't do much except just lie there  shaking and crying  literally unable to get up or concentrate on anything  or think about anything except the fear  It wasn't easy to keep doing the healthy things I knew I ought to do  With exercise and stuff  it got to the stage where I would pretty much go do a workout video in my living room when a panic attack hit  and think sarcastically 'Wow  it's not like this is instantly making me feel better  but it's sure nice to have something to do while I panic '  I was pretty cynical  It's just that when you get to that fight or flight adrenalin stage  sometimes you do feel better if you literally run about and burn off all those stress chemicals   it's what your body was designed to do in that situation  it's harmless and it works  So yeah  I get what you mean about feeling hopeless  That's a totally legitimate emotion to have when OCD is taking you over  especially if a medication has been promoted to you with false hope and you were really wishing for something that would take these awful thoughts away   However  the situation isn't truly hopeless  I'm coming to the end of my recovery now  moving into that symptom free zone for a lot of the time now  I just need it to be more consistent and get a bit more resilient to stress again   and my head feels unbelievably improved  I'm at a stage I never thought I would get to  I just don't have intrusive thoughts anymore  really  only the very normal infrequent ones maybe once a day where you get a tiny unscary moment of 'hey  imagine if I dived off this bridge' or 'just think  I could stab my cat with the kitchen knife right now ' and it goes away immediately after  Apart from the lingering phobia residue of my old OCD theme  I'm not getting any thoughts that actually severely scare me  or barge into my head and stay there  repeating  Plus there's been positive personality changes and other changes to thinking   I feel more confident  less socially nervous  I doubt my viewpoint on big issues less excessively  I feel more sure when I take decisions  all of which feels REALLY good   And a lot of people told me it wasn't possible to get to this stage  So I guess   being hopeless wasn't an accurate way to be  because improvement has been so major   A couple of things that might work for you to combat hopelessness  since you ask     Rate your recovery progress using measureable scales  and keep a quick record of them each day  Like  you can rate the amount of distress you're feeling at any given time out of 10  the number of times a day you give in and do a compulsion  the amount of intrusive thoughts you get in one morning etc  It's VERY motivating to look back through a recovery progress record and think 'wow  a fortnight ago I was going through the whole day at a 6  10 distress  and that felt pretty scary  but today's been my first real 3  10 day and it feels much more relaxed ' And if you have a shitty day where it's easy to forget all your progress  look back over the recovery records and realise that even though this afternoon has been a really mean 7  10  yesterday morning was only a 3   10  and you can aim for that again     Try an OCD recovery podcast  especially one you can just pick a motivational talk from and listen to first thing in the morning  OCD experts Ali Greymond's and Mark Freeman's ones might be best for you  because they firmly hold that OCD is a fixable problem you can make a good recovery from  because they have this personal experience and they help coach other people who also have this experiencea  Ali's one  https   www youtube com watch v xoZSqI6kioo and Mark's   https   www youtube com watch v BMqV746A7bs    Lots of great advice from them and sometimes it can be motivating on dark days just to hear them talk about recovering  even if it's a podcast you've heard before     Breaking your recovery down into 24 hours at a time can help too  If you can't even imagine how you're ever going to feel ok with these terrible thoughts  just stick to the day ahead of you and say 'Ok  whatever else happens  for this day  I'm going to try my hardest to do the healthy stuff I need to do  like cutting out compulsions  getting enough sleep  and taking my meds  and try my hardest not to unhealthy stuff that'll make my OCD worse  like giving in to compulsions or ruminating ' That way  you know that however bad today is  tomorrow is very likely to be a little better  because every single day you manage to do the right things instead of the wrong things is another day that your brain can heal  If its overwhelming to think of yourself having to resist compulsions all day every day for the rest of your life  it won't really be like that  but it feels that way when you're really suffering   don't try and think of those big time frames  Just put it more like 'Can I do the right things for the next 24 hours '

I'd recommend telling all of this to the doctor who prescribed it to you   In fact  just cut and paste this into an email to the doctor  assuming you have their email address   You may just need a different dosage  or you may need a different med   What works for one person may do nothing for the next  it's not you it's just the way things are   And  it's probable that a med is only part of the solution for you   Don't give up  it's really worth finding what works for you

I read many books about cognitive behavioral therapy and law of attraction  Collectively this led me to make the decision that  1  I am not a victim of my condition and I will get out of it  I take 100  responsibility for my thoughts and actions   2  I change my thinking habit bit by bit from negative to positive   Making decision means you really decide to do everything you can control for change  I would like to give you a magic trick but there was none  I just made a decision and start to change  You can do this in the next minute  And if you can flip that switch once  you can do it again and again  Next thing you know  you are normal 
Btw  I am new to Reddit and need karma to post a question  If my answers help you  please upvote       If you have more questions feel free to ask 
Yeah    I just tried it with eating  literally just went into my kitchen and asked  'what will make me feel better'  And have since started eating some chickpeas  And I do already feel a little better  Seems intuition has something going for it 
Thanks for this    sorry that you're dealing with it as well
Yes  I've had these thoughts too    A lot of it always goes back to the government for me  They are trying to poison me and everyone else and downplay our abilities    And the Truman show is just a mind fuck  Lolol  
Can so relate  I'm too busy living in my imaginary world to participate in reality  It's hard  Sometimes even think why go outside and do something when my fantasy will always be 10x better 
To make my point more clear I will give you an example of taking responsibilities for my thoughts and actions and change them bit by bit   Suppose you caught yourself thinking  I am depressed therefore I cannot be successful  my brain is messed up   You will then take a piece of paper and write down the thoughts  Then you will write a counter thought  For example  write "If I want to be successful I have to stop entertaining this belief that I cannot be successful because my brain is messed up  People with that type of beliefs cannot be successful  In fact  I believe that although I have not figured it all out yet  there's a way for me to become better  To have better attitude  To love myself again  And if I keep changing my thoughts deliberately  I will build the necessary mental habits  I will be alright "   At first  it's like forcing yourself to write down things you don't believe in  but over time  trust me  the positive thoughts will become your new normal 
i am in the exact same situation  even 10 years  you know that corny cliche saying   when one door closes  another opens   but were too stuck looking at the closed door    i think that applies in this case  baby steps 
I think it's important for people with anxiety to find a job where they are surrounded by mostly kind and positive people   I have quite severe generalised anxiety disorder   I struggle to leave the house without panic attacks  new things are incredibly difficult for me and require lots of preparation and relaxation in advance  etc   and I graduated university in the first half of last year  thank god for being able to work from home   I was terribly scared that I wouldn't survive employment  But I mustered my courage up and just threw myself out there  and I will admit that I got very lucky    I ended up in a job where everybody I have contact with is pleasant  and the atmosphere is very relaxed  I've been here since July and I have had only a handful of very bad anxiety attacks   which for me  is extremely good  Jobs with fast changing environments  lots of travel  lots of customer facing time such as retail  probably aren't as good for anxiety as a "behind the scenes" job   I feel like you need to find work where you can rest assured that people are comfortable if you make mistakes every now and again  We can all try our best at our jobs and still make mistakes because we are only human  and it's important to note that being berated can be very damaging to someone with anxiety   It also probably helps to try and find work in something you are passionate about doing   for me it is computing and I am continually fascinated and immersed by what I do on a day to day basis  which is a great way for me to relax and take my mind off my anxiety

I really hope it works but I also hope you don't get your hopes up to much on the first try  It can take several weeks to find the right dosage and maybe the right combination of drugs  Good luck though I hope you find what you need  
Not conspiracy like  It's a legitimate question   THC cannabis often causes bad anxiety  it can make you delusional but it can also definitely clear the way for real memories and things to appear to you  And that can be scary   I ate too much edibles last summer  and something similar to what you're talking about did happen  I did feel very anxious at points  uncomfortable  and got quick flashes of insight as to what happened to me  Revelations which are now just barely remembered because I was so high and because it's hard to retain high memories  They weren't memories per se  though  more just thoughts realizations about why I had a certain phobia  for instance  Putting pieces together and realizing the details of what might have happened to me   But I've never had concrete memories of what happened to me and so I'm still in the dark and going off of symptoms and feelings and random revelations but no hard "evidence "  Anyway  long story short  I think it can definitely help  but it's not for everyone  and the anxious state it often provokes is probably not going to make for a pleasant experience when you're already having a flashback to these kinds of memories 
 3
Whatever you do  don't mess with your dosage   stick to it for the next 2 months diligently   FYI  From the national alliance on mental illness   "Sleep  energy  or appetite may show some improvement within the first 1 2 weeks  Improvement in these physical symptoms can be an important early signal that the medication is working  Depressed mood and lack of interest in activities may need up to 6 8 weeks to fully improve "

You sound alot like me  I went from 170 lbs to 120 lbs over the last 3 years just from anxiety and inability to eat  I've had emetophobia since I was 8  I'm 35 now   The thing that finally helped my emetophobia was anxiety meds and therapy  no joke  With me I have a fear that certain foods will trigger a reaction  making a reaction more likely to happen just due to the panic attack symptoms  So I avoid foods in general if they make me anxious  To make matters worse I have GERD and IBS which create symptoms and feed the emetophobia   The things that really helped me was finding the right meds for my anxiety  mainly the SSRIs  Cipralex  and  Benzos for anxiety panic  Clonazepam   I also take Domperidone for gut motility and Zofran for nausea  very expensive   Plus  the usual assortment of over the counter meds  Pepto bismol  Maalox  Zantac  Diovol  etc    I also eat lots of healthy priobiotics  sauerkraut  kefir  kombucha  and drink copious amounts of herbal tea  ginger  fennel  peppermint     Therapy is also very important  whether that's group therapy and or one on one counselling  I try to get as much as I can  I find it very helpful when dealing with my anxiey depression emetophobia  Just getting out of the house and having people to socialize with is very important  don't isolate yourself like I did for 10 years  until recently    I also do a lot of deep breathing  relaxation techniques  exercise yoga  distraction  etc   to try and reduce stress and anxiety  For me sleep is also very important  if I don't get a good sleep I'm sick the entire next day  So  I try to practice healthy sleeping habits  get off computer by 6 8pm  and then relax the remainder of night  keep a regular sleeping schedule  etc        tldr    From my experience the main thing is getting that anxiety in check  Once you manage the anxiety the emetophobia fear should come down with it  For me that means therapy  SSRIs  and benzos  Every person is different though  what worked for me might not work for you  There's a very strong anxiety emetophobia connection though in my opinion   
Jacqueline is right  practice is key  I could barely play in tune when I started  I've known people with dyspraxia learn to play guitar  even helped teach one or two  not that I'm a magical teacher who knows everything about guitar    Start with power chords and slower songs then pick up the pace over time  incidently metal core with all its 1s and 0s can be an okay place to start

Kind of funny story I want to add on here about what helped me realize my delusions  and what delusions actually are    So  when I went to the doctor to get on my meds I was talking to my psych and I was saying  'I have delusions  My delusion is that I think every person in my life at some point hates me  My mom  my boyfriend  my friends  everyone doesn't want me in their life '   And he said  ' Those are not delusions  Delusions are things that are out of possibility  Something like the government is following you  aliens  conspiracy theories  alternate realities  Those are delusions  Everyone not liking you is a real possibility'   And I know I sat there with the blankest look on my face after that because 1  He just told me everyone very well may not like me    Which is actually true because of the path of self destruction I continue to go on in my ups and downs  I do things to make people not like me sometimes   But obviously that didn't really settle well with me upon impact  So 2  I'm sitting there like  'Well this guy is brainwashed idiot '   It took SO LONG for me to start thinking      Maybe I should think about that some more  Lol  Like I say it's still very much an issue  but I'm on my meds and working through it  And maybe my psych's definition can help someone else out there  Love you guys  And Happy 2017   3
