I know this sounds like a very standard response  and I understand if it annoys you to hear it  but have you seen a therapist psychologist  I say this not because it's a default suggestion for mental illness  but because I think it can actually help with working through where this stuff is coming from and how you can change it  I've found myself more interested in super violent and gory films and videos recently  and talking through why I'm drawn to these things and what I feel it gives me with someone professional I hope is helping me to address whatever it is in my mind that's underlying this
I was a way chronic smoker as a teen  also drugs  First psychotic episode at 22   it was bad  I didn't feel like myself for almost two years when I gradually started smoking weed again  It definitely led to my next psychotic episode  hospitalized 3 months  No weed for 20 years  functioned ok  Started smoking  felt weird at first  bad reactions  but kept smoking  after a year  another severe psychotic episode   bad  I'm positive weed led to these  2 bad psychotic episodes for me  I learned my lesson and won't smoke ever again  I'm on disability for life  Every psychotic episode does something to your brain  makes bipolar worse  I can't have another one   I wish I never started weed or drugs  I'm sure my bipolar wasn't helped by it

Impressive list of things you've already tried  but then to get to the end and see your awareness that you don't like the path you're on and don't care to finish the 7 months of classes you have left  I would imagine that might be why all those other things didn't work  Diet and exercise might improve the mood of somebody who is just generally down in the dumps  but has little to with realizing you don't like the path that you're on  Simplest solutions are usually the best  You don't like where you're going  so aim elsewhere  Doesn't sound good to me trying to medicate yourself into wanting something that you don't want  Beyond that  I don't know how to address the lack of motivation to make the changes  That is something I struggle with too  I do things on a daily basis that I know aren't taking me where I want to go

I have been where you are now and I can tell you one thing   it does get better  From your post I am getting that you feel like you don't really know who you are  This distressed me for many years and I have one big piece of advice for you  if that is how you feel   I never did find out those things that I was missing  and that you are missing  Instead  I accepted it as a part of my life that I would use as a "clean slate" to try and find new things to pursue  I feel like this might help you  Try new stuff  Search hard for those interests  You don't have to do a million things at once  But if you focus all your energy into doing something new  one thing at a time  you just might find yourself in a much better place   Where you are right now is only temporary  and you can't blame yourself for what others want for you  like your parents  It's okay for what  you  want and what your parents want to be very different   and if they don't understand or see that now  all you can do is hope that they do with time  You are not living your life for them  you are living it for you  never forget that   Around this time two years ago I felt like you feel now  Then I started just  doing stuff  Not quickly  I could only muster up so much courage because of my anxiety  but I would try new things when I felt positive enough to do so  After just a few months  I tried riding a motorcycle for the first time  It was one of the scariest experiences of my life  But it really clicked with me  I felt the same anxiety as I did doing everything else  but I felt something else too    The next two years that followed until now I have centred my entire life around that interest  I'm like an entirely different person  Finding something to do that you like can have a profound effect on you as a character  and there's always the bonus of meeting new people too  Being  excited  to go and do something  or to be a part of something  is a great motivator  And I wish I could help you find what your calling is  or find the motivation to chase it  but only you can help you with that   Ultimately  my advice is to use this time where you are feeling lost to develop yourself as a person  Instead of searching for pieces that you think should be there  have a shot at creating some new pieces  It could end up leading you on an amazing adventure  and I really hope it does  And even if you still don't know what you're going to do and feel stuck  focus on the excitement of finding out 
Always something I have struggled with  When you have very few friends from the start  it's easy to keep forgiving bad behavior when you feel like it's either bad friends or no friends at all  But obviously there's no point in keeping something in our lives once it has a larger negative effect than a positive one  so you just have to try to gauge that somehow   If someone is hurting your feelings or disappointing you more often than they bring any light into your life  it might be time to let that go   As far as what to do about it  sometimes nothing is best  You don't really have to make it a grand official gesture and tell them that the friendship is over  If they've been a crappy friend in the first place  chances are if you just distance yourself and talk to them less they probably won't even notice you're gone for a while  Unless you definitely want the certainty and closure of knowing that bridge is burned for good  then you could tell them or message them somehow and tell them why you feel the way you do and what you've decided to do about it   Of course the middle ground in there somewhere is that you could try to tell them how they hurt you and see if the relationship can be salvaged somehow  but that depends on if you think they're the type of person who will give two shits to listen to what you have to say  
Getting out into nature  Which is hard to do since it requires time and effort  Hiking some trails or going to sit by a river has never failed to make me feel better  Kind of a limited option during the colder months  
In those times  just remember  you are loved and important to somebody  Even if you don't know it  Your small talk or conversion with your local grocer could be the highlight of their day and the thing they look forward to in their job   You have an impact on more people than you think and there is nothing wrong with reaching out to others when you are weathered by the hardships of life   Hang in there mate and I wish your aspirations and dreams come to fruition in 2017

Yes  My anxiety comes and goes  But it has been almost unmanageable the last two months ever since I accepted a new position in the company  I work in an large retail chain  I went from a position that kept me largely in the backroom to out front in the optical center  I took the job because it was more money and everyone told me how much they enjoy it  Long story short  it's a nightmare for me  The doctors I work in conjunction with frighten me to no end I'm constantly worried I'm going to screw something up and get fired  There are way too many times I am left alone in the department even though there are many tasks I haven't learned how to do yet  and once more  I'm terrified of messing something up  When patients come in to get their glasses adjusted I'm frightened of breaking them and my hands shake so bad that I have trouble doing the simplest of adjustments  Before work I have trouble eating anything because I gag  During work I am both hungry and want to throw up   It is so bad I have asked to return to my old position for less money  I feel like a colossal failure and disappointment but I have to do what is right by my health  I will most likely be seeing a counselor again when I return to my old job to work on my confidence issues and my poor management of stress  But after this  this is the last time I'm going to try to move up in the company  I would prefer to just be done with customer service all together and find a job elsewhere

Before you ask  no  this isn't a shady way of saying "I"  But my friend has a relationship for literallybone day  Now he has hard time getting over it 
Our ancestors developed mechanisms that are subconscious but were and are essential for our survival  That is why most people can depend on their feelings of fear  anxiety or what is called "impending doom"  they're there to keep us safe and warn us of possible danger after all  The problem with anxiety as a disorder is that our "system" is NOT working properly  it's oversensitive and therefore we cannot depend on it without questioning  If you're bleeding  hurt or there's anything wrong with your body or situation in general then yeah  you definitely want to take it seriously  otherwise it's just your brain being wrong again  
Currently on 100mg of sertraline  don't give up hope if it takes a while to work  Pay attention to how you feel while on it  side effects can happen  shouldn't be major though   Also  at least for me  do NOT forget to take it when you get in the habit of taking it daily  When I forget a day  I get this buzzy like dizzy feeling  and get extremely nauseous  Good luck

insight to be able to list the improvements you've made and also the things that you know you haven't tackled yet  At least having that information gives you an advantage compared to somebody who might be feeling down but can't pinpoint why    You're two days into dropping another bad habit  you say you're still uncovering and working through some abuse experiences  you know you have room to improve in diet and exercise   As they say  you have to try to appreciate the journey and not just yearn for the destination  No  I don't think where you are now is "as good as it gets"  I think you are well on your way to it continuing to get better and better  But in life there probably never is a distinguishable end zone  aside from the grave  Don't look at this as some end point that you're trying to get to  You'll be on this journey for the rest of your life  You have a pretty long list of things you've already improved and it sounds like your mind tends to downplay those things and instead focus on whatever else hasn't happened yet    I've dealt  still dealing  with narcissism in my family and sadly pretty much understand it'll be an emotional scar for life  It is hard to connect with other people when you know they can't ever understand what it was like    Getting the blood work done was a really smart idea as many people never make the connection that there can be something physically wrong that contributes to moods and mental states  Getting any information back about any deficiencies you might have is just one more big step you're taking that will continue to make things better    I think you're doing awesome  Sounds like you just have that all too familiar negative attitude that comes from having lived in the shadow of a narcissist    I really need to get to work on watching what I eat and getting back to exercise  As expected  it's January 3rd and I still haven't gotten started  You're not the only one not looking forward to making those changes  I'll see if I can make an effort today  maybe you can too  Even if it's just going for a walk  A lot of times getting your heart rate up and getting some oxygen to your brain is a huge boost for mood

I used to have some really odd nightmares when I first started talking about the sexual assault I experienced  It's only recently that they have died down and I haven't had one for a long while  I've just finished specialist counselling and the link with the nightmares for me was control and power  My nightmares where usually unrelated to my abuser or the assault but the theme was very much linked  The counselling really helped as it helped get the stuff out of my head and express the anger and sense of loss I felt about the part of me that was gone   I also found getting a pillow with a small speaker in helped as I could play relaxation exercises or music through it  I also discovered the sleep with me podcasts  which are deliberately dull  meandering podcasts that give a focus to your thoughts without being stimulating  I got my pillow off amazon and I just plug my iPod into it and play stuff  I haven't needed to in a while but it's a good fallback if I find my dreams getting disturbed again

I lost my father the day after his anniversary last year  7 months ago now   edit  to cancer  so it was not entirely unexpected   I know it feels terrible  like you're drowning and you can't seem to figure out what you can do to catch a breath  and that's okay  It's natural to be overwhelmed right now  and if you could somehow stop feeling that way  you're just kicking the can down the road    You may have lost your mother  but you've still got a father and sister who love you very much  You're all going to need each other in the coming months  and as hard as it can be sometimes due to how we process grief  remember to try your best not to push them away  Be open and honest about how you are feeling and encourage them to do the same    I subscribed to this sub a long time ago when things were much worse for me  and I mostly avoid posting because I've gotten better over the years  which I mention now because it's important to realize the effect that surrounding yourself with other crushingly depressed people can have on you  Seek out positive elements and do your best to make them a part of your life  now more than ever  Try to smile on a daily basis   even if everything seems wrong  there's always something to look forward to  so set your sights on that  pick yourself up  and keep moving  If you remain static you run the risk of becoming paralyzed by your grief and your fears    Finally  a bit about grieving that I am going to shamelessly steal from another  much older and wiser  redditor     u GSnow   Alright  here goes  I'm old  What that means is that I've survived  so far  and a lot of people I've known and loved did not  I've lost friends  best friends  acquaintances  co workers  grandparents  mom  relatives  teachers  mentors  students  neighbors  and a host of other folks  I have no children  and I can't imagine the pain it must be to lose a child  But here's my two cents    I wish I could say you get used to people dying  I never did  I don't want to  It tears a hole through me whenever somebody I love dies  no matter the circumstances  But I don't want it to "not matter"  I don't want it to be something that just passes  My scars are a testament to the love and the relationship that I had for and with that person  And if the scar is deep  so was the love  So be it  Scars are a testament to life  Scars are a testament that I can love deeply and live deeply and be cut  or even gouged  and that I can heal and continue to live and continue to love  And the scar tissue is stronger than the original flesh ever was  Scars are a testament to life  Scars are only ugly to people who can't see    As for grief  you'll find it comes in waves  When the ship is first wrecked  you're drowning  with wreckage all around you  Everything floating around you reminds you of the beauty and the magnificence of the ship that was  and is no more  And all you can do is float  You find some piece of the wreckage and you hang on for a while  Maybe it's some physical thing  Maybe it's a happy memory or a photograph  Maybe it's a person who is also floating  For a while  all you can do is float  Stay alive    In the beginning  the waves are 100 feet tall and crash over you without mercy  They come 10 seconds apart and don't even give you time to catch your breath  All you can do is hang on and float  After a while  maybe weeks  maybe months  you'll find the waves are still 100 feet tall  but they come further apart  When they come  they still crash all over you and wipe you out  But in between  you can breathe  you can function  You never know what's going to trigger the grief  It might be a song  a picture  a street intersection  the smell of a cup of coffee  It can be just about anything   and the wave comes crashing  But in between waves  there is life     Somewhere down the line  and it's different for everybody  you find that the waves are only 80 feet tall  Or 50 feet tall  And while they still come  they come further apart  You can see them coming  An anniversary  a birthday  or Christmas  or landing at O'Hare  You can see it coming  for the most part  and prepare yourself  And when it washes over you  you know that somehow you will  again  come out the other side  Soaking wet  sputtering  still hanging on to some tiny piece of the wreckage  but you'll come out     Take it from an old guy  The waves never stop coming  and somehow you don't really want them to  But you learn that you'll survive them  And other waves will come  And you'll survive them too  If you're lucky  you'll have lots of scars from lots of loves  And lots of shipwrecks

The burden of depression is hard to carry  especially when everybody wants you to pretend you're fine when you're not   I hope you can shed this burden or at least lighten the load you carry by yourself each day   There is no shame in reaching out if you ever need to  I hope your depression is gone or at least eases this year   Remember life has highs and lows  depression mutes the highs and amplifies the lows  but you are important and loved 
I had the same issue at 22 and went thru a ton of test  Ended up I didn't have an ulcer and it was just from stress causing issues to my stomach  Turns out increase production in stomach acid is one of the first things your body does under stress    Have you had a scope done to your upper gi  It would tell you if you had stomach cancer or even an ulcer  Also a gi doctor talk would help if you have been having issues  More then a regular doctor    You literally sound like 22 year old me  I was in my last semester of college when it all started  Probably from all the stress going into the real world was bringing   I had to keep a food journal of what caused my biggest problems stomach wise  and just cut them out of my diet  I still eat fairly crappy  But I always make sure to do something probiotic and get in enough healthy stuff to balance it out  Once I started eating better and eating yogurt daily  I haven't had any chronic shits  but I do occasionally get stomach discomfort  I'm used to it by now  It's nothing serious  Usually just a build up of gas that I panic over and make worse  
It helps me to deconstruct them  and identify what the underlying fear is    For instance  I have dreams that sound pretty mild and normal  but I feel very upset over  In the most recent one  I had a guest in my home for the first time and he criticized my decor  It might sound silly  but I woke up  unreasonably  upset  So I dug into that feeling until I identified that the main "button" getting pushed was shame  So from there  I could reassure myself not about the dream  but about what's really on my mind    I've given up on trying to control dreams  But you can control how you respond  You live a good life  and you're a responsible pet owner  and your little ones are okay  And you'll be okay too  
I vividly remember the morning in 1997 when  after 4 weeks on an SSRI  I woke up feeling     not euphoric  but     normal  fine  okay  No feelings of dread or despair  or wishing I could just sleep forever  There was morning sunlight coming into the room  and I lay there for a bit thinking how nice that was  and realizing that it had been months and months since I had been able to notice how nice the morning sunshine is  I've had recurrences since then  and I've had to adjust my medications numerous times due to side effects or a specific med becoming ineffective for me after a few years  But I've had good psychiatrists who 1   Listened to me and took me seriously whenever I felt there was a problem with my medications  2   Were knowledgeable about a wide range of medication options  and 3   Were flexible and creative with adjusting doses or combining different medications  I talk to a lot of people who went to a general practitioner  or a second rate psychiatrist  who prescribed the latest "breakthrough" drug  or some old standby medication they always prescribed  and then when the results weren't good  the doctor would basically blame the patient  So these people went on suffering terribly with depression under the mistaken belief that "antidepressants don't work for me " Ooh  I could just throttle the quacks who treat their patients that way  if any practitioner tells you you're out of options with medications  or that the side effects you are experiencing are "not typical for this medication"  i e "you are imagining things"   find another doctor  You can feel better  Non chemical strategies such as cognitive behavioral therapy are important  too  and can be very very helpful  but in my experience I couldn't use those tools effectively until my underlying biologically based depression was under control  I wish you luck  Do not give up    You are going to have a good  fulfilling life

Yes  sadly everything is actually a symptom of everything  Because by this point there is enough cases that enough people have claimed they have had every symptom wth every single disease  All it takes is one google search to mentally crippled someone    
ive gone from 50mg to 100mg in bad times recently  and i find myself suicidal every morning   its been about 3 weeks   should i keep going 
My PTSD nightmares seem to come and go in waves  I have noticed they're much less common and less severe when I sleep a little bit cold  no heating blanket  maybe one less blanket on me then I'd like  and when I don't eat anything for 3 5 hours before bed  I also like to sip herbal tea before bed  the ingredients don't do anything but I find it calming  I also have a very non stressful tv show or podcast ready on my phone to watch if I wake up from a nightmare  since it quickly diverts my attention away from the nightmare and back to reality 
You should buy a pet that will keep you company and love you    and also finding a girlfriend over time  D good luck hope all works out for you  3
I second what  u leap2 has already said  I used to have extreme panic attacks very often and it has been going for a while  but therapy really helped  Note that therapy doesn't always mean "go take a bunch of pills"  there are many kind of therapies and a lot of them what you could call "talk therapy"    I underwent Cognitive Behaviour therapy and it helped to reduce the intensity and frequency of panic attacks  It also teaches you how to help yourself without the need for distracting yourself  with video games for example   I'm just throwing this one in as an example of non pill taking therapy  I know there are many more but I have no experience with them    So the best thing to do would be to consult with your doctor and take it from there 
There is an important distinction that needs to be made here    'Ideas of reference must be distinguished from delusions of reference  which may be similar in content but are held with greater conviction'  13  With the former  but not the latter  the person holding them may have 'the feeling that strangers are talking about him her  but if challenged  acknowledges that the people may be talking about something else'  14  https   en m wikipedia org wiki Ideas of reference and delusions of reference  A delusion is fixed and false and cannot be reasoned through despite evidence to the contrary    I assure you not everyone hates you   and I bet you can find some examples for yourself to counter this  idea  and  feeling   It is a cognitive distortion that can be reasoned through  If you  believe  everyone hates you  you may provide elaborations for your delusion like you are damned or a mastermind villain    I think the gray area or spectrum for this may be if there is a great delay in your ability to reality test

As a teenager I had panic attacks  Eventually I found myself on Paxil and later Zoloft which essentially fixed it  The panic attacks became rare and predictable  In college I went off all meds  I am now 29 and they have manifested in a new way  I get extremely anxious anywhere that I cant get to a bathroom or perceive it as inappropriate to suddenly leave and go  For example a 10 minute meeting at work is hell to me as soon as I realize I am trapped in that room  My stomach will turn and a panic will set in  Car rides are a nightmare  I am 29 and this started slowly this summer but has escalated now and has begun to take over my life  Christmas parties were hardly enjoyable  I went as far as to get a colonoscopy and am on some stomach meds now but it has become apparent that the mental end is the bigger problem since the gastro didnt find any wrong  I never wanted to go back on anxiety meds but I just scheduled an appointment with the doctor  I will probably look into CBT this time around as well  Heres to hoping this roller coaster if over soon

I know you have already tried many things  and therapy  But here are my 2 cents  Try this book  Overcoming OCD by David Veale  Its fantastic  It is the core book used by therapists who are leaders in the field  So if you cant afford the fancy OCD programs  try this book  They literally use it in their own treatment programs   https   www amazon ca Overcoming Obsessive Compulsive Disorder Behavioral dp 046501108X ref sr 1 1 ie UTF8 qid 1483455743 sr 8 1 keywords Overcoming Obsessive Compulsive Disorder  Different methods work for different people  but I find a good combo is using SSRI meds to bring the anxiety OCD down to manageable levels and then using CBT such as Exposure Response Prevention to then treat the OCD  and then keep going and slowly reduce the medication  to the point where you no longer need the meds  and the CBT is what is keeping the OCD at bay  Using this approach I have seen OCD virtually disappear but you need to keep a wary eye to the signs and symptoms and fight it quickly if it ever creeps back

I smoke weed very casually  I was told by a psychiatrist once that it could have a similar effect on my mood as alcohol if I used it extensively  I trusted her  She was an exceptional physician  and this wasn't in a part of the world where marijuana was really stigmatized  I have heard it can worse mania    Generally  though  I think the research about bipolar disorder and pot is pretty inconclusive at this point though   There ARE long term consequences of smoking marijuana  though  They are well documented  and don't forget about them    My general opinion is that pot is great for anxiety and mild depression  It is probably better for your body than an antidepressant  and CERTAINLY better for your body than taking benzodiazepines regularly

Hey there   I'm sorry you're going through this   Are you still in a control situation with your parents   I ask because I was severely abused by controlling parents  and I could not heal very well until I was away from them   For me it took a huge student loan and three part time jobs  but it was worth it to get out from their home and their toxic behavior   It was incredibly difficult for me to even think straight when every time I walked in the door I was barraged with abusive comments   If you are out from your parents home  then I think you might start by putting less pressure on yourself   It sounds like you're pushing yourself to figure out who you're attracted to and to move on those feelings  but if you feel confused  then acting on attraction may just be hurtful to you     It is okay to feel angry and hateful sometimes   During my severe depression times I would feel like I just wanted to destroy my body completely  Sometimes I felt suicidal and sometimes I just felt this global anger at my entire being   A lot of that was anger at other people  at my abusers  that I was redirecting inward   The important thing is  don't judge yourself for those feelings   They're only emotions  they aren't "wrong" or "bad"   it's just a way to feel   If you are able  feel them and let them pass     And if you can  be kind to yourself   Start with small self care  and build up from that   If you can do small things   go to bed on time  take your medications  if you have them  as I do  at the same time each day and be proud of yourself for that  wear comfortable clothing that you actually like  do some meditation if you are able   Once you get a good habit track going  you can fall back on it during really bad times   I'd be happy to talk more about this with you but I don't want to overwhelm you right off the bat

You have to dig deep and try to figure out if this just isn't the right thing for you  or if you're wimping out of something that could be really good for you  Forcing yourself to do something that you dread won't lead to anything good  but avoiding something simply because it's uncomfortable isn't good either  I just saw some quote in the past few days along the lines of "the comfort zone is a safe place where nothing ever grows"    Being humble and vulnerable enough to admit when you're bad at something is really freeing  You could choose to have a good humor about it  tell the class leaders how inept and silly you feel  compliment the other students who are better than you and learn from them  Maybe you could approach one of the leaders separately after a class and tell them how you're feeling  maybe they'll have an idea whether they think you'd be better off sticking with it or not    If it's not where you belong  that's fine  but try to replace it with some other pursuit then  Maybe just working out in general where it's not a group activity   Nobody in my family was ever athletic or helped me understand how to be so I know that's frustrating  I did come to find my own love for weight lifting  although I've ignored my own health for a few years now    Giving up is only self sabotage if you're giving up too easily  Nobody wants to have a class scheduled that they dread thinking about for the entire week  If you don't want to be there  don't do it  But just challenge yourself by asking if you're giving up for the wrong reasons  
1  It doesn't mean that  You definitely will see literature saying antidepressants are not useful for bipolar disorder  This is because research is not definitive yet  Lots of people with bipolar II disorder  probably bipolar I as well  take an antidepressant  Very common  They don't work for everyone  But having efficacy on an SSRI doesn't rule out bipolar II   2  My reaction is usually "you'd know " I have bipolar II  I wouldn't sleep for days  like 3 hours across a week  and would feel euphoric  talk so fast I'd choke on my words  Afterwards I'd be like    yeah not normal  Even though hypomania isn't full blown mania and you can function  you're still abnormally up up up  With that said  I didn't know at first and was only diagnosed when I was 23 after being treated for depression since I was 19  Things just kind of kept getting worse  Just talk to your doctor about highs you have and see what they say   3  Mild is a weird word because different drugs effect different people  But yes there are treatments that require less of a "commitment" than lithium  i e no blood work or being careful with liquid intake    4  Something that we cannot tell you  but I have heard it is normal for your body to have mood swings a bit until it readjusts to not having the antidepressant  Generally  though  you shouldn't have just stopped without a doctor   5  Not sure

I got on sertraline about 10 days ago   I was on 25 mg the first week and then up to 50 mg since then   I would talk to someone that you trust  if you can   Other people can sometimes notice symptoms that you cannot   I definitely have noticed side effects and effects  but they changed from day to day at first  but now things seem to be stabilizing   The side effect were generally mild and tolerable  one day  no sex drive  which is unusual for me  another day  light dizziness  another day  a nice feeling of calm  another day  heartburn  another day  diarrhea    Good luck  
First of all  congratulations on not 'freaking out' about your new diagnosis  I'm really proud of you too  That can be very scary on its own  and with anxiety it can be even worse    As far as being scared to sleep  I'm so sorry for what you're going through  We all know how important sleep is  and if you're anything like me your anxiety probably gets worse if you're not well rested  My biological father has sleep apnea  and while he doesn't suffer from high anxiety  it made him deeply afraid to sleep as well  The good thing is that they had solutions for him  he now sleeps with a mask that helps him breath during the night  even if his brain forgets  This actually has helped with his depression and with a heart condition he takes medication for    I'd encourage you to pursue a sleep study and talking to your doctor about possible solutions  I seems so much easier to not know and not deal with situations on this side of them    but imagine what it will feel like to have control over this situation and be working toward some solutions to help you be healthier  It's okay to be scared and feel like you're up against something scary and unknown  but you have me and r anxiety to help you along the way    Good luck with whatever you decide moving forward  and please PM me if you want to talk or need some extra support

I have a lot of avoidance strategies  I try and get busy when I have intrusive thoughts  Go for a walk  clean my house  drink tea  moisturise  paint my nails  go online and read the news blogs  exercise if I can be bothered to  plan meals to cook  generally avoid letting my mind idle too much  I avoid showers during these times which probably isn't great    Or you can try to 'put it down'  By which I mean give physical form to whatever is going through your head and then you can put it down and walk away from it  I do this by writing in a journal  but especially writing poetry and painting is helpful for me  I was able to put down and walk away from a lot of distressing memories because of painting  I keep the paintings and can choose to look at them or not  But having them out of me is a relief    If your problem is persistent  I'd say you should seek professional support if you haven't already  Counselling may help  Best thing I did for myself is get back on anti depressants and anti anxiety medication     Wish you all the best

It's been a little over seven years  and the PTSD isn't as bad as it used to be  The depression and anxiety are manageable with medication and monthly therapy  Working out releases some good mood boosting hormones  I did yoga for a while  I journal sometimes  I play video games with online friends and that's a big part of my social life and makes me happy  And I acknowledge that it may never get 100  better  and that this may always be a burden I have to bear  Everyone has burdens  despite what their bright and peppy social media feeds may tell you  This one is mine  and I can be strong enough to carry it  as long as I do what is necessary  such as take my little white pill every morning  Things may not ever be the same as they used to  but I do believe they get better

Tackle this problem one issue at a time  You'll overwhelm yourself if you focus on all of these various things that are causing you anxiety and depression    There are two things that you can immediately work on with little to no risk of making your social anxiety worse  your parents being overbearing and trying to control your life and your porn addiction  You should confront your parents about them pressuring you to get a girlfriend and tell them that they need to realize it is only making things worse for you  You should also explain to them how you are feeling    they are your parents and will love you unconditionally even if they don't understand  I would   STRONGLY   recommend seeing a therapist to talk about these issues  That is something that has no negative side effects even if it doesn't work for you    For porn  I would at least recommend cutting it down  I know it's pretty hard to break an addiction  but if you can really put your mind to it and tell yourself why this addiction is bad you will be able to break it    So what if you're a virgin  I was a virgin until I was 25  It's not a big deal  Trust me  I hate seeing myself in the mirror to this very day  And I have a woman that wanted me  It will get better  you just have to take the necessary steps to start beating it  Therapy being the biggest one    Have you considered taking medicine for your depression anxiety  That would help in a big way with your university program and beating the social anxiety associated with that    Please feel free to PM me  i'd be glad to listen to you if you need to say anything else

Everyone has told me to make something beautiful from my pain   Yes  my happiness is forever dulled  I agree with the other poster that there is no going back  But i also have learned to embrace the darkness  to use it as fuel to succeed at work and school  to create beautiful  tormented art    So much of my life is fucked because of my trauma  I have c ptsd because I've had multiple traumas  I have embarrassed myself over and over with my extreme insecurities and obsessive clingyness to those I deem worthy to trust  I have so many issues  my weight constantly goes up and down  switching between not eating and eating too much  I've had an eating disorder for a long time     My traumas have created so much pain in my life  I often feel like screaming and crying  wailing  Yet I walk around  numb to most of life  I'm so far away from fixing how they continue to effect me  But I have learned how to take that pain inside of me  and turn it into something good  Even talking to others  sharing your experience and stories  sharing your strength   is a way to fight the dulling    It doesn't bring you back to who you used to be  but it does counter the effects with something different and good   something that is you  something that makes you feel better about yourself  something you can always carry with you

Assuming you live in the UK  because of A Levels etc   go to your GP and ask about seeing an occupational therapist   this has been the most helpful for me  CBT has helped but Occupational Therapy works by finding ways to do the things you want to do  They can meet you at your home and help you to go out  sort you out with an exposure therapy type treatment tailored for you  help with general life stuff like sleep schedules and mine has even sorted out going to art classes  I live in Scotland and I've also had help from "Befriending Services" which despite the patronising name is simply someone who comes to you and simply takes you out to help with any exposure work that you might need someone to accompany you  which sounds like it might help you since your family is unwilling to help  the one I used was called SAMH but unfortunately they are a Scotland only service       With all due respect to some of the other posters in the thread  going back to school or to a gym will almost definitely not be an easy "small" step for you  You aren't pathetic for not being able to go out without someone else  I've certainly been in that position and I know many of the other posters on r agoraphobia have been or are exactly where you are  some people call this being housebound  A good way to judge a small step to get better from agoraphobia is to choose something you think you can do  but that will raise your anxiety levels a bit  For me 3 years ago and in a very similar position to you this was simply sitting at the window looking out for 10 minutes  I repeated this until my anxiety reaction was much lower then increased the difficulty  longer period of exposure  then opening the window  standing by the door and so on  eventually each of these steps took me a few months later to being able to go to the shops alone  I'm still in the middle of recovery so there is an awful lot I can't do  but everything I have been able to do has been the result of tiny seemingly insignificant steps

Sure you can  You don't have to be constantly down to be depressed  Even depressed people can have good moments or even days  For people with MDD  major depressive disorder   the pattern is they'll be in a relatively normal emotional state and go through depressive episodes which last 2 or more weeks

What kind of job will you be doing  Project programming  tool programming  IT  bugfix  databases management        Depending on what your tasks are  your involvement with other people vary   I'm a software engineering student currently doing and internship in a big name company  I'm mostly doi g programming on the main project to further that peoject  and I also work a lot with another department of peogrammers specialized in datamining on the user's interacrions with our project  I implement stuff that sends data to their databases  I also do bugfixing like every other programmer in my department   My point is  I was scared shitless to do interviews  and when I entered the company for my first 2 weeks  I had no prior programming job experience  so this was pretty much like stepping on the unknown  And I adapted  It is scary at first  because you don't know anybody  you don't know what you're doing  you don't know if you're doing your job properly or if you are closing tasks fast enough  I know that for the first 2 months  I was scared that I wasn't doing a good enough job   My main contact throughout the first month was my internship supervisor  who was the lead for my team of programmers  I would report to him  I would get my tasks from him  and I would go to him for help  He introduced me to other people from various departments sometimes because they had the info I needed  He helped me fit in  He helped me know who to go to when I needed help from a specific department   After a month  I was pretty much ok with asking other people directly for help  I even started talking a lot more to the collegues that were sitting on the desks around me   After two months  I had and internship meeting with my school evaluator and my supervisor  And I learn that I was doing a great job  and that I adapted to and learned the project better than most interns they had in the past  However  he said that I was reluctant to go directly to other people for help and that I needed to broaden my circle of contacts   So overall  I wasn't doing so bad at all  I'm saying all this because I was in your shoes  Scared of interactions  scared of judgement from co workers  And overall  I discovered that its not that bad  Its harder at first simply because you don't know anyone and you have to learn the project  and you feel like you don't know what your doing or that you're not doing it good enough   Truth is  you're an intern  You're not expected to know everything  You're not expected to adapt as fast as someone who has been in the industry for years   As for relationship  everything will come in time  If you're scared of talking to other people and need help with your tasks  go to your supervisor or your lead  Talk to him  He'll guide you to whom you need to talk to  He's there to help you  He'll introduce you to the right people   Good luck  I hope you enjoy yourself

I go to an art class once a week and have been going for just over a year and it has only become easier getting there in the past couple of months  and still occasionally it will be difficult  The only suggestions I have would be doing some more exposure work on days off  it doesn't have to be tasks as difficult as your trip to work  anything that raises your anxiety level will teach your body how to dissipate anxiety  and using more coping tools to help you feel less anxiety while out  grounding  breathing exercises  distraction techniques

you're a good person who acted out of frustration and feeling like nobody was on your side  You have to have some self love and self respect that will steer you away from situations like this in the future  You have to be able to like yourself based on a set of standards and ethics that you define for yourself  You can't let your opinion of yourself be defined by other people  because good A couple things to note about sertaline  I take 100 after titrating up to it from 25   The side effects won't come on for the first few days  if you're lucky  you won't notice any  You might get a bad headache for a few days and maybe some urinary retention  After 4 weeks  you'll start to notice the positive and negative results   Your anxiety will fell like it has faded and you'll feel better inside  Most SSRI's  with the exception of Prozac  take time to start working   Good luck  I think you'll be happy with the results  If not  talk to someone about it  Try something out  A lot of picking the right meds is careful guesswork 
You're not insane  Insane people don't know they're insane  or that they're going insane  Therefore you're either overreacting or need help  I suggest you figure that out and work from there

Quit your job   It might be looked down upon  but you need to worry about your own health first   You are not mentally strong enough to handle that kind of work yet   Go to therapy  or at least try tackling your anxiety by starting small and working your way up to more stressful activities   I don't mean to offend you or make any assumptions  but if your anxiety is consistently acting up at your job  you're probably not doing the company you work for any favors either   The time you spend coping with your anxiety compromises your ability to perform the tasks expected of you  and if it happens too frequently  it becomes a liability   In my opinion  it is okay to quit a job that is too stressful as long as you either look for a job that is less stressful  or you actively work on your stress anxiety tolerance so you can eventually handle the same job or similarly stressful work in the future

Try to see ocd as a thought process rather than focusing on particular elements of it  For instance it's really helped me to break it down into   Obsession  intrusion a feeling etc  Compulsion  behaviour can be physical or mental to bring down anxiety    Then you can apply it to so many different things and they don't seem as scary as you can see that it's the same process but just applied itself to different things like contamination or health anxiety   Check out cognitive behavioural therapy    
Theres nothing shameful about needing meds  I've been on three different SSRIs  and have a couple Xanex for when my anxiety gets bad  Mental illness is often caused by a chemical imbalance  and medication can help fix that    Also  I think you would benifit from visiting  r anxiety as well

I feel better today  I let myself feel like shit yesterday with the understanding that I would get to the gym this morning and be productive at work  Going to the gym in the morning is a huge part of my fight against my depression and I am still riding the endorphin buzz  I'm not being too productive at work but that's mostly because we're slow right now   Here's something I do when I'm feeling overwhelmed  I think of one simple thing I can do and call an accomplishment  Maybe it's taking a shower and brushing my teeth on a really bad day  Maybe it's do a load of laundry  Or maybe mow the lawn  But it's one simple thing  8 10 I wind up doing more than the one thing  1 10 I just do the one thing  And  of course  that last 1 10 is the times when it just doesn't work  But  I'll take those odds    Hope you feel better soon

 Here is my backpack flying home    http   imgur com DDUG78Z   There were days I had to be out of my hostel by 11 am and didn't leave for the next city until evening so I would carry it all day  I had a decent backpack  looking back I wish I had invested money into a real traveling backpack  Mine had 3 compartments  The hardest part for me as a somewhat high maintenance person was no hair dryer  My hair was short and was a mess most of that trip  I got a hot iron brush to tame it in the AM and showered at night in my hostel  The worst was shoes  I wore hiking boots almost everywhere but I had one pair of nice flats  I didn't have room for tennis shoes  With outfits I traveled city to city in my bulkiest items  boots and sweater jacket   I rolled all my clothes very tightly into cylinders and stacked them vertically inside my backpack  I kept a small umbrella in my bottle sleeve  I basically had a long blue blouse I wore almost everywhere over leggings  I had one t shirt for sleeping and a couple nice dresses that didn't wrinkle  I washed my clothes once when I was at a hostel with a nice laundry room  Sometimes I rewore undies and socks  yeah      For make up I just had the basics  foundation and some mascara and eyeliner and one lipstick  I did 4 cities on that trip so as far as clothes go  I wasn't too concerned about a variety  I had small baggies full of Tylenol or whatever in tiny backpack pockets  It was hard for me too cause I love being prepared

It's short for General Education Development   It's a program available for drop outs or people tired of the drudgery of the institution  which in the continental United States must be respected at the same level as a high school degree  Basically  take 6 months of class  take a test  so yeah it's still work  but you can do it on your own time and your own way  My brothers been struggling with the same lack of motivation to complete the drivel monotony of high school  so he's taking steps to move past it on his own terms  in a practice way  You can claim the independence you want  and still have the basic education credit needed to succeed in society  Would strongly recommend you check it out

 First of all  I'm so sorry this happened to you  Don't feel embarrassed  As a mom I can tell you that two adults acting the way those men did is disgusting and probably criminal  They are the ones who should be embarrassed and feeling like they want to die  not you    The most important thing is to protect yourself from STDs and pregnancy  You can call a rape crisis hotline  1 800 656 HOPE  and ask about local treatment options  Planned parenthood or a women's health clinic can also help you  Some local crisis centers can connect you with a trained adult who can help you through the exam  and through the legal process if you choose  so you aren't alone   If you trust your parents  I recommend talking to them about what happened  And definitely speak with someone anonymously on the hotline  Even supportive parents sometimes can't relate  or don't know how to support you    If you get a rape kit done  you don't have to decide today what to do  It's there  in case you decide to press charges later    You are not alone  And the most important thing to do is guard your physical health  and your mental well being  The police can help you with a restraining order or pressing charges  but they aren't always trained to be sensitive and understanding about trauma  If you go to the police and they are insensitive  don't take it personally  or as a judgement on your worth or honesty  They're just doing their job    Best of luck to you  I'm sorry you went through that  and I know sometimes the embarrassment about your peers talking about you can be the worst part  But it's not your fault  Reach out for help and support  It's there for you

Hello      I'm so glad your life turned around  It sounds like there are some really good things in it right now     I completely understand the thought of "my life's good now so I SHOULD be happy " Try to reframe that thought      The wonderful things in your life right now can't erase or cancel out the effects of your past trauma  The trauma was never processed so unfortunately it's still "trapped" in your nervous system and your mind  I'm not sure if you can ever "get over it" but you are absolutely capable of reprocessing the trauma and healing from it       Your history will always be your history but through therapy it won't always sting  trigger you or have a hold over you      At the moment since your PTSD has not yet been addressed  OF COURSE you feel depressed and anxious  You are not wrong at all for having these feelings  It's a perfectly normal response  The depression and anxiety you're feeling has to do with your past  it is NOT a reflection of how appreciative you are of the good things in your current life     I understand the nervousness about your upcoming therapy  That also is natural  Yes  there will be uncomfortable moments in therapy  Maybe think about it like you're taking care of a wound that you've had for a long time and has become infected  The healing process is going to hurt a lot in the beginning  taking the bandage off  disinfecting the wound  Very painful      but necessary if you'd like it to heal  Know that going in  that way you're not going to run away or quit therapy when you feel anxiety during therapy      The beautiful thing is that when you start healing  you will be able to feel more joy from the good things in your day to day life like your husband and child  Try to envision this  what your life looks and feels like when you can "access" that joy  Keep a mental picture of it in your mind  Recall this picture whenever you feel nervous at any stage during therapy       It's not easy or quick but it's doable  You're a survivor  You survived your past so I already know how strong you are  You can do it  You are worth it  Life on the other side of therapy is worth it      Much love to you  Have courage 
I'm here if you want to talk
yeah SSRIs typically say 4 weeks to feel
I take hypnotic sleep medications  They help me let go of a portion of my anxiety before I fall asleep  They also make my memory of my dreams fuzzy and since I otherwise fight sleep  it's the only way I can keep a regular sleep schedule

As in  my roommates are all chill people who don't subscribe to extremist ideology   White supremacy neo Naziism "alt right" is also a form of identity and racial politics  which a lot of the thinkpieces I've read fail to acknowledge  If there's going to be criticism of identity politics  it needs to be balanced  I'm concerned about the safety of low income  immigrant  including undocumented   POC  Muslim  Jewish  Sikh  queer  and disabled people  I'm concerned about alienation  harassment  and bullying in schools  which is where a lot of my anxiety stems from   I'm concerned about policies that will harm institutions  communities  and individuals that have suffered for decades  For me  at least  these are all concerns regarding basic safety  dignity  respect  and well being  I want people to be able to live their lives without fear and with their civil rights intact   When it comes to crossing the political divide regarding identity politics  I'm not sure what the best option is for the left as a whole  At their roots  the demands of many activist movements and groups on this side of the spectrum are pretty basic  stop killing us  end hate crimes speech  etc   and it's difficult to separate those from identity as people are being targeted and harmed on the basis of identity  I'd like to read more on what people recommend for much larger and broader center left organizations like the DNC  which already has a lot of work to do regarding voter mobilization  internal politics  and candidate lineup IMO

You're the best thing that's ever happened to someone  You might not feel that way  but you are  You are loved  you are cherished and each day is a new day to start over    Give em hell  friend  
I appreciate your post  Thanks  The question "am I delusional or not " can definitely be inadequate for understanding your beliefs  When I'm trying to assess a problematic belief or thought process  I think about it along three axes  each scaled from 1 100   First axis is probability  where 1 is "this is a proven  verifiable thing that is currently happening " and 100 is "this is impossible " Second axis is degree of belief  where 1 is "I do not believe this" and 100 is "I believe this with every fiber of my being " Third axis is degree of distress  where 1 is "this doesn't bother me" and 100 is "this is so upsetting that I'm in a constant state of panic and unable to function "    Very few things are impossible  but some things are so vanishingly improbable as to essentially be the same thing  "I can teleport to Mars this afternoon" can pretty easily be rounded up to a 100  Whereas  say  "the FBI is keeping close personal tabs on me" could span more or less the entire range depending on your political activities     When your second axis doesn't square with the first  there's an issue  and it helps to discuss with a trusted third party    a therapist  a close friend    to try to figure out what's up  If I am 100  convinced that the FBI is following me  but it's objectively unlikely that they'd be so invested in my activities  I want someone to persuade me of that latter part  particular if this belief is really upsetting to me or keeping me from doing things  Which is the third axis     You can also believe in things that you  know  are impossible  which sounds completely contradictory    but human minds are  I believe  and I'm not being facetious with this  that I could speak Russian in an emergency  I have never studied Russian on even the most elementary level  but I believe I could do it in the same way that a mother can lift a car off her baby    fueled by adrenaline and  in my case  an ability to tap into the collective unconscious and draw language from it  Do I  know  this is ridiculous  Yep  Is it  to quote the language of religious discrimination laws  a "sincerely held belief"  Yep  And since it doesn't bother me at all  and isn't dangerous   that should probably be a fourth axis   I don't feel the need to try to reality check my way out of it     Your belief that everyone hates you sounds  using the language of psychology  anyway  more like a cognitive distortion than a delusion  but I think what matters more than the terminology is how you are able to disprove or minimize this belief  and decrease the amount of pain it causes you      Anyway  I hope you feel better  and it is extremely unlikely that everyone hates you

Cool  Yeah maybe try to aim for 10am or something like that  It's not that early  but not that late either  It's hard to motivate yourself  or at least myself  to get up earlier than that unless there's a good reason to  ie  work or school or whatever  There will definitely be an adjustment period though so it will probably suck for a few days or more  but long term it will be better for your life in general  Maybe to make it easier you could get up at 2pm for a week  1pm the next  and so on until you get to 10am   Regarding teas  just remember that herbal teas  like the ones I mentioned  are not the same plant as actual tea  Black  green  and white teas are all from the same plant and all contain varying levels of caffeine  while the teas I mentioned are all different plants and contain no caffeine  You might know that already  but I've come across a lot of people in life who don't know this so I figured I'd mention it

After my ex and I broke up I sat down and wrote out every quality I needed from a partner  Some things were top priority while others would just be a bonus  I told myself that if those qualities weren't there then the relationship wouldn't last  You have to make sure your needs are being met    To give you some ideas  I wrote down things like "treats family well " Of course there are exceptions if the family is toxic but generally how they speak to their parents siblings is telling of how they'll treat you later on  Another important one for me was the ability to talk about science and philosophy in depth  I  need  someone with the same passion for learning as I have  I love to bounce ideas off of other people and hear different view points  But I also need someone who thinks farts are hilarious  too   Think about what's important to you  What do you desire out of a relationship  Write it down  don't settle for less when it comes to top priorities  Don't think about the qualities of your friend while doing this  just write what you want  It will help you determine if you should act on your feelings   Please know that it's possible to have a relationship when you have anxiety  My boyfriend of 5 years has panic attacks and GAD while I have ADHD  GAD and MDD  We're one of the happiest couples I know   So  I'd suggest digging deep and determining whether or not you'd have a fulfilling relationship  Then  wait a bit and see if you still have feelings for her    Obviously anxiety is impacting your social life so you should be doing things to aid in that if you aren't already  It sucks to have one person as your only support    I'm like you in that I'm distant in some regards  I'm much better now but I still find it difficult to be close with people  Aside from my boyfriend  I only have like three people I'm close with  Building up just one or two more relationships would help you immensely in regards of the fear of losing your best friend

I know how difficult perfectionism is as I experience it every day                      I'd say the best way would be to just forget about it  save it and keep it away until the day you'll apply with it  I know that this sounds like a stupid or meaningless suggestion but trust me  anything else leads to huge procrastination  You'll constanly feel the need to change every little detail              Also  why not give it to somebody else who's good at writing them  anyway  So  you won't only avoid bothering to make it perfect but also find time to relax knowing that somebody highly experienced has already prepared it for you way before the deadline 
I'm so sorry this happened to you  It's so wrong what they did to you  You are incredibly strong   First off  I am super impressed by your boyfriend  It sounds like you two have a really healthy   trusting relationship  It's great to hear that you are able to talk to him about these issues and that he listens and is kind and willing to adapt to help you feel safe  That's just incredible    Are you suggesting that your discomfort in being a bottom stems from your assault  Or perhaps it's just not your thing  just like it's not your boyfriend's thing to be on bottom  Just a thought I had  I know you want to please your boyfriend sexually  but would being on bottom make you happy  too  It's okay not to want to do the things he wants you to do    Other than that  I'm not sure I can help you much  It may just take more time   more communication to feel comfortable and avoid flashbacks  Try not to rush it if you can  Baby steps     
It's quite common that we only notice problems with compulsions when they get in the way of something we want  At that moment  it's like being in the middle of a 5K race and noticing you're out of breath  that you don't have the ability to continue the race  Your legs hurt and your lungs ache  The opportunity to build the ability to run the race was in the months and weeks before the race    So in situations like this  I find it useful to separate things like getting the resume completed from dealing with the anxiety  Learning the skills to handle anxiety is like building cardiovascular fitness  it's a long term practice    Getting the resume done is something you can do now  like finishing a race  but it'll be intense  It can help to make space for those intense feelings and expect them to be there  You can choose to feel them and not react to them  Feel panicked after writing a sentence and then write the next and welcome all of the anxious thoughts your brain throws at you  They're like sweat when running  it'd be weird if they weren't there  What matters is taking one step and then another    Another option is to hire a resume writer to finish the race for you and take this as a useful lesson that you need to start preparing for the next race by cutting out compulsions and learning to handle the stuff in your head before you're in need of those skills   Good luck with the application

that they're breakthrough is just an affirmation of the thing most people were already doing  and it's the thing that's easiest for white people to do  I mean  I'm white  and male  and it seems to painfully obvious that this is borne out of doing what's easiest  It's also throwing POC and immigrants and all the people the left claims to care about under the bus  defending you has become a political liability  so    good luck    Like  I agree that maybe not all racism needs dealt with the same way  The guy who tattoos swastikas on his forehead and burns crosses is not the same as the guy who thinks  "they just need to pull their pants up " and one of those guys might be talked out of his views  or the guy that thinks BLM is a "terrorist organization" might be able to be corrected  but if we refuse to talk about "identity politics " the pants guy and the BLM guy will only have their views reinforced or go unchallenged   And you hit it too  all politics are identity politics  all politics are personal  No one bans gay marriage or passes it because it's a nebulous idea  like the interest rate  something that we don't get to vote on  because it's not political  because it's not personal   it gets passed because it matters a whole lot to you  or it gets banned because it's deeply threatening on some level    In terms of moving forward  because as much as people hated Clinton  she would have probably been a better choice for people who voted Trump simply because they need a job  there does have to be some outreach  I think  I don't even know how to go about it  because historically white people have been all about moving minority rights forward until it rubs up against the boundary of other white people  and I balk at the idea of expecting  for example  a scared brown person "go make friends with a racist" for the sake of progress  There's a quote I can't find from Malcolm X telling his followers to ask white people what they thought of a particular guy from the Civil War  this guy fought for the Confederate  had a change of heart part way through  and then worked to free slaves specifically  but he had a very brutal life characterized by the slaughter of a score of white slave holders  Malcolm's point was that white people are all on board with civil rights    until they realize they might have to oppose other white people  and I think this "identity politics" backlash is a reflection of that

Psychiatrist tried switching meds  seemed to only make my mood worse  As for dosage increases  originally I was taking 20 mg  Was upped to 40 mg and then again to 60 mg where it currently is  I also was given adderall for a while  and we concluded that it didn't seem to change anything whatsoever 
When I tried Viibryd I went up slower than the introductory packet suggested to avoid the digestive problems it's known for  That worked  Unfortunately the Viibryd effect  and it was good  only lasted for 3 months  That was the end of that 
I am actually content with my low entry jobs  I like not having to be so responsible  I'm a care aide  and a cashier  It's the bottom rung on the nurses spectrum and I'm happy to wipe butts  I don't have to deal with all the technical stuff  life altering decisions  and full fledged responsibilities    Thank you for sharing that page you linked  it was a like psych profile of me  I never heard the term 'self esteem attack' and now I have a word for all those terrible moments of panic that weren't really related to anxiety  It resonated a lot with me  I had the unfortunate luck to have to deal with all those problems without knowing what they were or meant    Don't beat yourself up though  It's something that page doesn't really include  I am brutal with myself  I have said things to myself that I wouldn't say to my worst enemy  I'm a learning to be more compassionate and gentle to myself  Try to forgive yourself for failing and try again but this time with a gentle approach to academia and yourself    
Im a 20 year old guy and have been struggling with bad health anxiety for about 5 years due to chronic pain and ringing in my ears  Doctors didn't know what was causing it so I started to assume the worse  I began to start having panic attacks and develop new symptoms in what I now suspect is a psychosomatic disorder  basically where you imagine symptoms but genuinely feel them   I had self diagnosed myself with MS  then moved on to cancer  then brain tumour  then diabetes  then schizophrenia  pretty much anything I could think of manifested itself with actual symptoms  It was terrifying as I would look up my symptoms and then see Disease X  and then experience all the other symptoms I read about leading me to believe I had the condition  You've just got to be aware when you're panicking that you have already identified the fact you have this compulsive worry and that you're most likely not sick at all  But if you get overly worried  the best way to alleviate that is to just go to the doctors and get them to verify that you're fine  I still get symptoms to this day  go in at least once a month  and they give me the all clear  As long as they're reasonable doctors they should be understanding  But maybe consider talking to a therapist or something about the anxiety as I got caught in a terrible loop and started getting panic attacks constantly  and that can cause weird symptoms and make you worry even more  I think I'm dying at some point at least once a week when I'm having a panic attack  It's hard to believe I could be so irrational in hindsight but that is how anxiety can manipulate your mind so it's important to see that as the root of your problem  I find this fear of illness I have is now very manageable if that's any encouragement  Everyone will worry about their health to a certain extent and that is normal  All the best 
I wrote at length about it  here  https   www reddit com r BipolarReddit comments 3vonfd marijuana cxpgdkh   and  here  https   www reddit com r BipolarReddit comments 3wwp7l weed and meds cxzrsmv    but my relationship with it's changed since then  I guess a super condensed TL DR of those comments is  weed helps my depression but can make me psychotic   Since then I've come to realize that the more I smoke it the lower my motivation becomes and the harder it gets to cope with stress without chemicals  But it definitely makes me euphoric  fantastic thing  and gets me to eat  problematic thing given my propensity for overeating   Food tasting amazing  unbelievably good orgasms  satisfying sleep  and a reprieve from dark thoughts makes it ideal for getting me out of a crisis  But I also abuse substances and overuse them  so it's definitely contributed to the 10lbs I'd gained since mid december   I recently learned that while it's gotten me out of suicidal depression  it had also caused psychosis that I thought was someone else's fault  That someone else had shared their super potent weed induced psychosis  but what I think had actually happened was that I'd hallucinated that  too  So whether the guy hypnotized me to believe it or I hallucinated him doing that  weed's at fault  And that psychosis is behind every time I've been inpatient and at least half of my suicidal episodes   It can make us manic  and with heavy use it tends to bring on depression  although the causality on that is still being investigated    For me  I use it to relax and escape depression  I also prefer it to alcohol  because alcohol makes me depressed but weed leaves me feeling better for awhile  My biggest issues with weed right now are the legal status and implications for employment  I'm on the job market   It still induces some psychotic symptoms if I'm careless  but I've got them extremely well controlled and am no longer afraid of them  I figure any significant changes to my beliefs I'd consider while I'm high need extreme circumspection  and I'm already able to identify and largely dismiss the hallucinations that made it dangerous in the past     TL DR  Weed is      nuanced       It's dangerous  but also lifesaving     PS  redditors   can we not  downvote every discussion about weed  Seriously  this shit has gotten old  It disappoints me that what's probably my most upvoted submission to BPR is about how weed causes psychosis  yes  it does  but every time anyone asks questions about it  where you'd have the opportunity to say it yourself   you guys downvote rather than have an actual dialogue about why you think it's bad  Downvoting silences discussion and keeps people from having conversations where you can tell them why you think it's a bad idea  Dialogue is how people grow  not downvotes 
Listen to a podcast  I love listening to podcasts and the radio when I'm really uninterested in doing anything  It feels like I am part of the conversation and I don't feel as lonely

Yep  This x100  But  I actually in someways appreciate it  I have ADHD and  like most ADHDer's I can hyperfocus on boring tasks when it's down to the wire and there are severe consequences  I was a huge procrastinator  but I almost always got it done because I didn't want to let my parents and teachers down  I knew they saw me as a good kid  Fast forward to college when I was a faceless student in a lecture hall and only I know my grades  Needless to say they plummeted  The adrenaline I needed to focus came from the way overblown social anxiety  not the more legitimate fear of bad grades  Given that a lot of people with ADHD also suffer from social anxiety  it makes you wonder how much we could help by not treating them like dumb kids as so often is the case  If they know that you truly see them as smart and capable the consequences of letting you down may be enough to help them focus  Of course  this could backfire badly if you're expectations exceed their capabilities  I've been there too and it is crippling   Anyway sorry to go on a tangent  But yes  in general  I rely on that to keep me accountable but I imagine if I'd didnt have ADHD and were reasonably competent with executive functioning I may not appreciate it as much

I feel like I have known you  even though I don't know you   I'm 47 and when I was in college  I belonged to a RPG fantasy scifi etc club   I knew a lot of guys who were quite introverted  and what you describe about yourself sounds like you are too and that's not a bad thing   So this would make it more difficult and more frustrating and quite possibly less rewarding for you to socialize than it might be for others   Just guessing bounce these words inside your head and see how they sound   I also want to point out something not directly related to depression  but another mental illness   When I was thirty  I moved and had to get a new psychiatrist  have been seeing them since adolescence  long history of depression    When I told him my life story  one thing stuck out   I told him that for most of my childhood  I often felt bored   Long story short  sometimes  when some people use the word "bored" when describing social settings or life in general  it cooouuuld be  very tentative  not projecting  don't jump the gun   that the person is suffering from undiagnosed ADD   Mind you  not the hyperactive part  but the just the deficit part    So  when you couple someone who is naturally introverted with a touch of ADD  you get a person who WANTS all the pleasures of social interaction and WANTS to be involved in the dating game BUT said person also gets frustrated quickly  that's an ADD trait  and finds that the pleasures they can find on their own are easier to come by yet wholy different from the pleasure of social and dating things   As far as depression goes  your words don't suggest that to me  but maybe someone else can offer better insight   Good luck either way 
Absolutely it can be useful to tackle that as part of all the other OCD crap    You only have one brain so it can be useful to approach all symptoms as one big pile of mental health 
I'm very sorry that you have experienced such abuse as a child   Since your brain was not developed enough to process what you were experiencing memories of your abuse may have been repressed  The brain will do this in order to protect itself    Sexual assault rape are about taking power and control away from another person  It is not uncommon for survivors to recreate sexual experiences in order to attempt to be in control of the situation  This helps to explain your need to find older men who you wanted to hurt you sexually  You were trying to create situations where you might have the opportunity to regain a feeling of power and control over your body    I suggest that you look for a trauma therapist to consult with about your experiences  Someone who has training in this area will be able to help you understand your choices  properly process the memories in a safe environment and guide you towards healing and recovery  If you live in the U S  the RAINN website can direct you to a therapist in your area  with no fee for services   Or you could search online for a trauma therapist in your community or call a support line to ask about available resources  RAINN and pandys org offer online forums as well as other information   You are not alone and there are professionals who can help you when you are ready  Keep reaching out for support  You may also find help in the sub rape counselling   Take good care of yourself

22 here  and fortunately I've at least experienced kissing twice and that was about it   no relationship though   I feel you OP  I used to get this bad feeling about how pathetic I am for still not experiencing something probably most people my age have and I'm just left in the dark  etc  You have two choices though   1  You can keep on dwelling on how pathetic your life is  how you're a joke  and that things will never get any better which will actually result in that as you go further and further into the vicious circle of self loathing all the time  or    2  You can accept that you have never been in a relationship yet even after reaching age 20 and just continue on living and trying to improve yourself  Remember  there are some people who have it way worse than us   I personally decided to go with  2 and break the vicious circle of beating myself up and started trying to improve myself  Started eating healthier  exercising  trying out new hairstyles  regularly watching YouTube videos on how to improve this and that  Also videos  pictures  quotes  etc  that boost the mood  There's still no relationship yet but we can't give up   Remember  there are some people who have it way worse than us  Apologies for the crappy english
